8.name: Mind Control
8.text: Take control of an enemy minion.
8.flavor: Nominated as "Spell Most Likely to Make Your Opponent Punch the Wall."

9.name: Prophet Velen
9.text: Double the damage and healing of your spells and Hero Power.
9.flavor: He's been exiled from his home, and all his brothers turned evil, but otherwise he doesn't have a lot to complain about.

42327.name: Phantom Freebooter
42327.text: Battlecry: Gain stats equal to your weapon's.
42327.flavor: There's no such thing as a free boot.

12.name: Mana Addict
12.text: Whenever you cast a spell, gain +2 Attack this turn.
12.flavor: She’s trying to kick the habit, but still takes some mana whenever she has a stressful day.

38914.name: N'Zoth's First Mate
38914.flavor: Hates when N'Zoth yells "Ahoy Matey!!", but there's not really much he can do about it.

42328.name: Skelemancer
42328.text: Deathrattle: If it's your opponent's turn, summon an 8/8 Skeleton.
42328.flavor: What do you mean there's no such thing as "Skelemancy?" But "Dinomancy" is ok?

22.text: Deal $1 damage to a minion and give it +2 Attack.
22.name: Inner Rage
22.flavor: They're only smiling on the outside.

23.text: Deal $2 damage to a character. If that kills it, summon a random Demon.
23.name: Bane of Doom
23.flavor: My advice to you is to avoid Doom, if possible.

38916.name: Addled Grizzly
38916.text: After you summon a minion, give it +1/+1.
38916.flavor: Druids who spend too long in bear form are more susceptible to the whispers of the Old Gods.  Right now they are whispering the lyrics to "La Bamba".

40988.name: Cryomancer
40988.flavor: She loves Frozen. I mean who doesn't?

30.text: Copy 2 cards in your opponent's deck and add them to your hand.
30.name: Thoughtsteal
30.flavor: "What do you get when you cast Thoughtsteal on an Orc?  Nothing!" - Tauren joke

32.name: Al'Akir the Windlord
32.flavor: He is the weakest of the four Elemental Lords.  And the other three don't let him forget it.

34.name: Silvermoon Guardian
34.flavor: The first time they tried to guard Silvermoon against the scourge, it didn’t go so well…

36.name: Cenarius
36.text: Choose One - Give your other minions +2/+2; or Summon two 2/2 Treants with Taunt.
36.flavor: Yes, he's a demigod. No, he doesn't need to wear a shirt.

37.name: Pint-Sized Summoner
37.text: The first minion you play each turn costs (1) less.
37.flavor: She's quite jealous of the Gallon-Sized Summoner.

2047.name: Force-Tank MAX
2047.flavor: There is a factory in Tanaris for crafting force-tanks, but it only ever made two, because of cost overruns.

41.name: Frostwolf Grunt
41.flavor: Grunting is what his father did and his father before that.   It's more than just a job.

45.name: Tauren Warrior
45.flavor: Tauren Warrior: Champion of Mulgore, Slayer of Quilboar, Rider of Thunderbluff Elevators.

2046.name: Mechanical Yeti
2046.flavor: The yetis of Chillwind Point are a source of both inspiration and savage beatings.

48.name: Voidwalker
48.flavor: No relation to "The Voidsteppers", the popular Void-based dance troupe.

38920.name: Bloodsail Cultist
38920.text: Battlecry: If you control another Pirate, give your weapon +1/+1.
38920.flavor: They're really just in it for the Blood Parrot.

51.name: Windfury
51.flavor: Windfury is like Earthfury and Firefury, but more light and airy.

41081.text: Give a friendly minion +1/+1, then gain Armor equal to its Attack.
41081.name: Earthen Scales
41081.flavor: You can make your own Earthen Scales at home. Step 1: Roll around in the dirt. Step 2: Magic.

61.name: Spiteful Smith
61.flavor: She'll craft you a sword, but you'll need to bring her 5 Steel Ingots, 3 Motes of Earth, and the scalp of her last customer.

41874.text: Deal $3 damage to a minion. Summon three 1/1 Pterrordaxes.
41874.name: Feeding Time
41874.flavor: True, they're only 1/1s, but they eat as much as most 4/4s!

64.name: Swipe
64.text: Deal $4 damage to an enemy and $1 damage to all other enemies.
64.flavor: When a bear rears back and extends his arms, he's about to Swipe!  ... or hug.

67.name: Silverback Patriarch
67.flavor: He likes to act like he's in charge, but the silverback matriarch actually runs things.

68.name: Stranglethorn Tiger
68.flavor: The wonderful thing about tigers is tigers are wonderful things!

69.name: Silver Hand Knight
69.flavor: It's good to be a knight.   Less so to be one's squire.

70.name: Blessing of Might
70.flavor: "As in, you MIGHT want to get out of my way." - Toad Mackle, recently buffed.

75.text: Destroy all minions except one. (chosen randomly)
75.name: Brawl
75.flavor: Do you know the first rule of Brawl Club?

77.name: Polymorph
77.text:
Transform a minion
into a 1/1 Sheep.
77.flavor: There was going to be a pun in this flavor text, but it just came out baa-d.

40973.name: Shellshifter
40973.flavor: Master of the Three Shell Monte.

43022.name: Strongshell Scavenger
43022.flavor: It isn't "grave robbing" when there's no grave. It's just scavenging…

86.text: Choose One - Deal $5 damage to a minion; or $2 damage to all enemy minions.
86.name: Starfall
86.flavor: Is the sky falling?  Yes.  Yes it is.

90.name: Chillwind Yeti
90.flavor: He always dreamed of coming down from the mountains and opening a noodle shop, but he never got the nerve.

41875.name: Chittering Tunneler
41875.text: Battlecry: Discover a spell. Deal damage to your hero equal to its Cost.
41875.flavor: Ear to the ground, he carefully interpreted the chittering noises: “You wanna cast a spell? I wanna cast a spell!”

95.text: Choose One - Gain 2 Mana Crystals; or Draw 3 cards.
95.name: Nourish
95.flavor: Druids take nourishment from many things: the power of nature, the songbird's chirp, a chocolate cake.

43025.name: Crypt Lord
43025.text: [x]Taunt After you summon a minion, gain +1 Health.

113.text: Secret: When your opponent casts a spell, Counter it.
113.name: Counterspell
113.flavor: What's the difference between a mage playing with Counterspell and a mage who isn't?  The mage who isn't is getting Pyroblasted in the face.

41076.name: Pterrordax Hatchling
41076.flavor: Aww.  So cute.  Want to feed him another finger?

43028.name: Plague Scientist
43028.flavor: The excruciating pain means it's working!

41086.name: Elder Longneck
41086.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a minion with 5 or more Attack, Adapt.
41086.flavor: And so the bartender says, “Why the long neck?”

43029.name: Deathaxe Punisher
43029.text: Battlecry: Give a random Lifesteal minion in your hand +2/+2.

132.name: Voodoo Doctor
132.flavor: Voodoo is an oft-misunderstood art. But it is art.

134.name: Ravenholdt Assassin
134.flavor: Just mail him a package with a name and 10,000 gold.  He'll take care of the rest.

41096.name: Bright-Eyed Scout
41096.text: Battlecry: Draw a card. Change its Cost to (5).

138.name: Doomsayer
138.text: At the start of your turn, destroy ALL minions.
138.flavor: He's almost been right so many times. He was sure it was coming during the Cataclysm.

2071.name: Micro Machine
2071.text: At the start of each turn, gain +1 Attack.
2071.flavor: This card is the real thing.

140.text: Secret: When a friendly minion dies, return it to life with 1 Health.
140.name: Redemption
140.flavor: I am not sure how you get demptioned the first time.  It’s a mystery!

141.name: Hunter's Mark
141.flavor: Never play 'Hide and Go Seek' with a Hunter.

145.text:
Put a copy of
a random minion from
your opponent's deck into the battlefield.
145.name: Mindgames
145.flavor: Sometimes it feels like this is all a game.

147.text: Destroy a friendly minion and deal its Attack damage to all enemy minions.
147.name: Shadowflame
147.flavor: Start with a powerful minion and stir in Shadowflame and you have a good time!

149.name: Ancestral Healing
149.text: Restore a minion to full Health and give it Taunt.
149.flavor: I personally prefer some non-ancestral right-the-heck-now healing, but maybe that is just me.

151.text: Choose One - Give a minion +4 Attack; or +4 Health and Taunt.
151.name: Mark of Nature
151.flavor: Druids call it the "Mark of Nature."  Everyone else calls it "needing a bath."

41116.name: Stone Sentinel
41116.text: Battlecry: If you played an Elemental last turn, summon two 2/3 Elementals with Taunt.
41116.flavor: He and his friends just want to rock out.

157.name: Lord of the Arena
157.flavor: He used to be a 2100+ rated arena player, but that was years ago and nobody can get him to shut up about it.

41118.name: Sergeant Sally
41118.text: Deathrattle: Deal damage equal to this minion's Attack to all enemy minions.
41118.flavor: "Who is she?  Where did she come from?  We don't even have a police force here in Gadgetzan!!" - Mayor Noggenfogger

41120.name: Volcanosaur
41120.flavor: Always fun to say out loud "VOL-CA-NO-SAUUUR!"

163.name: Sacrificial Pact
163.text: Destroy a Demon. Restore #5 Health to your hero.
163.flavor: This is the reason that Demons never really become friends with Warlocks.

41126.name: Dispatch Kodo
41126.text: Battlecry: Deal damage equal to this minion's Attack.
41126.flavor: "Crime reported at First Bank of Gadgetzan.  Huge quantities of Jade being carried away by what looks like a bunch of Hozen.  Kodo 77 can you make it over there now?"

28.name: Kor'kron Elite
28.flavor: The Kor'kron are the elite forces of Garrosh Hellscream. Let's just say you don't want to run into these guys while wearing a blue tabard.

41130.text: Set a minion's Attack and Health to 10.
41130.name: Dinosize
41130.flavor: Comes with fries and a drink.

172.text: Freeze a character. If it was already Frozen, deal $4 damage instead.
172.name: Ice Lance
172.flavor: The trick is not to break the lance.  Otherwise, you have "Ice Pieces."  Ice Pieces aren't as effective.

175.name: Dalaran Mage
175.flavor: You don't see a lot of Dalaran warriors.

41137.name: Ravasaur Runt
41137.text: Battlecry: If you control at least 2 other minions, Adapt.
41137.flavor: Doesn't like to adapt unless others are watching. Some minions are such show-offs.

178.name: Windspeaker
178.flavor: Is there anything worse than a Windspeaker with halitosis?

179.name: Wisp
179.flavor: If you hit an Eredar Lord with enough Wisps, it will explode.   But why?

180.name: Backstab
180.text: Deal $2 damage to an undamaged minion.
180.flavor: It's funny how often yelling "Look over there!" gets your opponent to turn around.

41145.name: Sunkeeper Tarim
41145.text: Taunt Battlecry: Set all other minions' Attack and Health to 3.

186.name: Ancient Brewmaster
186.text: Battlecry: Return a friendly minion from the battlefield to your hand.
186.flavor: Most pandaren say his brew tastes like yak.  But apparently that's a compliment.
186.targetingArrowText: Return a minion to your hand.

38943.name: Deathwing, Dragonlord
38943.text: Deathrattle: Put all Dragons from your hand into the battlefield.
38943.flavor: To his credit, Deathwing really took to heart the feedback he was receiving that he needed to be "more of a team player".

189.name: Fire Elemental
189.flavor: He can never take a bath. Ewww.

191.name: Murloc Raider
191.flavor: Mrrraggglhlhghghlgh, mrgaaag blarrghlgaahahl mrgggg glhalhah a bghhll graggmgmg Garrosh mglhlhlh mrghlhlhl!!

192.text: Secret: When your hero takes fatal damage, prevent it and become Immune this turn.
192.name: Ice Block
192.flavor: Ice is nice, and will suffice!

41153.name: Arcanologist
41153.flavor: What did you draw? Shhhh… it’s a secret.

41154.name: Steam Surger
41154.text: [x]Battlecry: If you played an Elemental last turn, add a 'Flame Geyser' to your hand.
41154.flavor: Explorers nicknamed him the Teapot Elemental.

195.text: Secret: After your opponent plays a minion, summon a copy of it.
195.name: Mirror Entity
195.flavor: "You go first." - Krush'gor the Behemoth, to his pet boar.

196.name: Vanish
196.text: Return all minions to their owner's hand.

38262.text: Give a minion +1/+1 for each of your Totems.
38262.name: Primal Fusion
38262.flavor: Golce and Dabbana have a new line of Earth Totems available at vendors everywhere this holiday season.

41158.text: Secret: When your opponent casts a spell, add a copy to your hand that costs (0).
41158.name: Mana Bind

41159.text: Deal $15 damage randomly split among all minions. Overload: (2)
41159.name: Volcano
41159.flavor: Many young shaman summon a volcano as their first school project.

201.name: Defias Ringleader
201.flavor: He stole the deed to town years ago, so technically the town is his. He just calls people Scrub to be mean.

41162.name: Pyros
41162.text: Deathrattle: Return this to your hand as a 6/6 that costs (6).
41162.flavor: If you strike her down, she shall become more powerful than you can possibly… well, she'll become a 6/6 anyways.

45263.name: Sonya Shadowdancer
45263.text: After a friendly minion dies, add a 1/1 copy of it to your hand. It costs (1).
45263.flavor: Love like you've never been hurt. Dance like a 1/1 is watching.

41168.text: [x]Quest: Cast 6 spells that didn't start in your deck. Reward: Time Warp.
41168.name: Open the Waygate
41168.flavor: Although powerful, the incantation is simple. It’s just a jump to the left, and then a step to the right.

41169.text: Discover a copy of a spell in your deck.
41169.name: Shadow Visions
41169.flavor: This one’s a bird. And here’s a bunny!

41170.text: Restore #5 Health to a minion and your hero.
41170.name: Binding Heal
41170.flavor: By accepting this healing, you agree to the following terms…

211.name: Sea Giant
211.text: Costs (1) less for each other minion on the battlefield.

41879.text: Give your minions "Deathrattle: Return  this to your hand."
41879.name: Spirit Echo
41879.flavor: I guess you can say they’re… “soul survivors.”

213.name: Mark of the Wild
213.text: Give a minion Taunt and +2/+2. (+2 Attack/+2 Health)
213.flavor: Not to be confused with Jim of the Wild.

45271.text: Reveal a spell from your deck. Deal damage equal to its Cost to all minions.
45271.name: Dragon's Fury
45271.flavor: “C’mon Hucklemuck. She’ll never notice if we take just one little coin.”

41177.name: Curious Glimmerroot
41177.text: [x]Battlecry: Look at 3 cards. Guess which one started in your opponent's deck to get a copy of it.
41177.flavor: George promised to be good. But it's easy for little Glimmerroots to forget.

220.text: Gain control of an enemy minion with 3 or less Attack until end of turn.
220.name: Shadow Madness
220.flavor: You can rationalize it all you want, it's still a mean thing to do.

38266.text: Transform your minions into random minions that cost (1) more.
38266.name: Evolve
38266.flavor: So you say you want an evolution. Well, you know. We all want to change the board.

45287.name: Silver Vanguard
45287.flavor: Float like a Faerie Dragon, sting like a Hivequeen.

232.text: Secret: After your opponent plays a minion, reduce its Health to 1.
232.name: Repentance
232.flavor: Repentance often comes in the moment before obliteration. Curious.

233.text:
Destroy a minion.
Your opponent draws 2 cards.
233.name: Naturalize

41194.name: Tar Lurker
41194.text: Taunt Has +3 Attack during your opponent's turn.
41194.flavor: Hi, Tar here. Long time lurking, first time taunting…

237.name: Auchenai Soulpriest
237.text: Your cards and powers that restore Health now deal damage instead.
237.flavor: The Auchenai know the end is coming, but they're not sure when.

238.name: Feral Spirit
238.flavor: Spirit wolves are like regular wolves with pom-poms.

239.name: Rockbiter Weapon
239.text: Give a friendly character +3 Attack this turn.
239.flavor: This would be real handy if your enemy is made of rock.

242.name: Abusive Sergeant
242.text: Battlecry: Give a minion +2 Attack this turn.
242.flavor: ADD ME TO YOUR DECK, MAGGOT!

1781.howToEarn: Unlocked in The Arachnid Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1781.name: Haunted Creeper
1781.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in The Arachnid Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.

41207.text: Add two Razorpetals to your hand that deal 1 damage.
41207.name: Razorpetal Volley
41207.flavor: The result of a fundamental misunderstanding of the phrase "flower power".

41208.name: Razorpetal Lasher
41208.text: [x]Battlecry: Add a Razorpetal to your hand that deals 1 damage.
41208.flavor: The reason why there are no zombies in Un'goro.

250.name: Hammer of Wrath
250.flavor: A good paladin has many tools.  Hammer of Wrath, Pliers of Vengeance, Hacksaw of Justice, etc.

45308.text:
[x]Choose an enemy minion.
At the start of your turn,
gain control of it.
45308.name: Embrace Darkness
45308.flavor: Once you both get comfortable, darkness is actually pretty snuggly.

45309.name: Drakkari Enchanter
45309.text: Your end of turn effects trigger twice.
45309.flavor: Drakkari sorceresses have the irritating habit of repeating themselves at the end of every sentence. Every sentence.

254.name: Innervate
254.text: Gain 1 Mana Crystal this turn only.
254.flavor: Some druids still have flashbacks from strangers yelling "Innervate me!!" at them.

41216.name: Biteweed
41216.text: Combo: Gain +1/+1 for each other card you've played this turn.

257.name: Razorfen Hunter
257.flavor: Someone did mess with Tuskerr once.  ONCE.

45314.name: Mindbreaker
45314.flavor: He's a mind breaker, dream taker, ghoul trainer, don't you mess around with him.

41222.text: [x]Quest: Play five minions with the same name. Reward: Crystal Core.
41222.name: The Caverns Below
41222.flavor: Why can't it ever be The Taverns Below?

45321.name: Sanguine Reveler
45321.text: Battlecry: Destroy a friendly minion and gain +2/+2.
45321.flavor: Have some! This drink is to die for!

268.text: Give a minion +2 Attack. Combo: +4 Attack instead.
268.name: Cold Blood
268.flavor: "I'm cold blooded, check it and see!"

38957.name: Midnight Drake
38957.text: Battlecry: Gain +1 Attack for each other card in your hand.

272.name: Cabal Shadow Priest
272.text: Battlecry: Take control of an enemy minion that has 2 or less Attack.
272.flavor: You never know who may be secretly working for the Cabal....
272.targetingArrowText: Steal a minion that has 2 or less Attack.

45329.name: Bloodworm
45329.flavor: Queen Lana'thel insists on one of these, fried, every morning for breakfast.

1802.howToEarn: Unlocked in The Arachnid Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1802.name: Poison Seeds
1802.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in The Arachnid Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1802.text: Destroy all minions and summon 2/2 Treants to replace them.
1802.flavor: "Poisonseed Bagel" is the least popular bagel at McTiggin's Druidic Bagel Emporium.

38958.name: Crazed Worshipper
38958.text: Taunt. Whenever this minion takes damage, give your C'Thun +1/+1 (wherever it is).
38958.flavor: Every month they share a pancake breakfast with the Perfectly Rational Worshippers.

279.name: Holy Smite
279.flavor: It doesn't matter how pious you are.  Everyone needs a good smiting now and again.

281.name: Argent Commander
281.flavor: The Argent Dawn stands vigilant against the Scourge, as well as people who cut in line at coffee shops.

282.text: Force an enemy minion to deal its damage to the minions next to it.
282.name: Betrayal
282.flavor: Everyone has a price. Gnomes, for example, can be persuaded by stuffed animals and small amounts of chocolate.

41243.name: Stonehill Defender
41243.flavor: Briefly tried stand-up comedy under the name "Stonehill Offender", but turtles are just too thin-skinned.

284.name: Novice Engineer
284.flavor: "Half of this class will not graduate… since they'll have been turned to chickens." - Tinkmaster Overspark, teaching Gizmos 101.

285.name: Cruel Taskmaster
285.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to a minion and give it +2 Attack.
285.flavor: "I'm going to need you to come in on Sunday." - Cruel Taskmaster

286.text: Secret: When a minion attacks your hero, destroy it.
286.name: Vaporize
286.flavor: Rumor has it that Deathwing brought about the Cataclysm after losing a game to this card.  We may never know the truth.

287.name: Kidnapper
287.text: Combo: Return a minion to its owner's hand.
287.flavor: He just wants people to see his vacation photos.

289.name: Wolfrider
289.flavor: Orcish raiders ride wolves because they are well adapted to harsh environments, and because they are soft and cuddly.

290.name: Ironbeak Owl
290.flavor: Their wings are silent but their screech is... whatever the opposite of silent is.

291.name: Holy Light
291.flavor: If you are often bathed in Holy Light, you should consider wearing sunscreen.

292.name: Multi-Shot
292.text: Deal $3 damage to two random enemy minions.

296.name: Kill Command
296.text:
Deal $3 damage. If you control a Beast, deal
$5 damage instead.

45353.text: Summon 1/1 copies of 2 friendly Deathrattle minions that died this game.
45353.name: Twilight's Call
45353.flavor: If you’re experiencing resurrection sickness, press 1.

299.text: Deal $2 damage to 2 random enemy minions. Overload: (2)
299.name: Forked Lightning
299.flavor: If you combine it with Spooned Lightning and Knived Lightning, you have the full dining set.

41260.name: Fire Plume Phoenix
41260.flavor: This is what happens when you use a volcano as a bird bath.

41261.name: Emerald Hive Queen
41261.flavor: She rules the emerald hive at the end of the yellow brick trail.

41262.name: Giant Anaconda
41262.text: Deathrattle: Summon a minion from your hand with 5 or more Attack.

1783.howToEarn: Unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1783.name: Mad Scientist
1783.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1783.text: Deathrattle: Put a Secret from your deck into the battlefield.
1783.flavor: His mother wanted him to be a mage or a warlock, but noooooooo, he had to go and be a scientist like his father.

304.name: Arcanite Reaper
304.flavor: No… actually you should fear the Reaper.

41265.name: Gentle Megasaur
41265.flavor: "Low, low rents! Must enjoy a nomadic lifestyle. Quasi-sentient, bipedal, amphibious humanoids ONLY!"

306.name: Edwin VanCleef
306.text: Combo: Gain +2/+2 for each other card you've played this turn.
306.flavor: He led the Stonemasons in the reconstruction of Stormwind, and when the nobles refused to pay, he founded the Defias Brotherhood to, well, deconstruct Stormwind.

308.name: Gnomish Inventor
308.flavor: She's never quite sure what she's making, she just knows it's AWESOME!

45366.flavor: There must always be a Lick King.
45366.name: Arfus
45366.text: Deathrattle: Add a random Death Knight card to your hand.

311.name: Gladiator's Longbow
311.flavor: The longbow allows shots to be fired from farther away and is useful for firing on particularly odorous targets.

315.name: Fireball
315.flavor: This spell is useful for burning things.  If you're looking for spells that toast things, or just warm them a little, you're in the wrong place.

45377.name: Hyldnir Frostrider
45377.flavor: Don't be fooled, that polar bear's the one in charge.

45378.name: Spellweaver
45378.flavor: Spells offer twice the moisture wicking of cotton.

41286.name: Charged Devilsaur
41286.flavor: What happens when a dinosaur mixes soda and pop rocks.

41289.name: Spiritsinger Umbra
41289.text: After you summon a minion, trigger its Deathrattle effect.
41289.flavor: She sees the fate of anyone she meets, but it's always the same: dinosaur attack.

41294.name: Ozruk
41294.text: [x]Taunt Battlecry: Gain +5 Health for each Elemental you played last turn.
41294.flavor: Between you and me, Ozruk is a bit obsessed with his body.

336.name: Baron Geddon
336.text: At the end of your turn, deal 2 damage to ALL other characters.
336.flavor: Baron Geddon was Ragnaros's foremost lieutenant, until he got FIRED.

338.name: Grommash Hellscream
338.flavor: Grommash drank the tainted blood of Mannoroth, dooming the orcs to green skin and red eyes!  Maybe not his best decision.

344.name: Charge
344.text: Give a friendly minion Charge. It can't attack heroes this turn.
344.flavor: "Guys! Guys! Slow down!" - some kind of non-warrior minion

345.name: Assassinate
345.flavor: If you don't want to be assassinated, move to the Barrens and change your name. Good luck!

348.name: Dark Iron Dwarf
348.text: Battlecry: Give a minion +2 Attack this turn.
348.flavor: Guardians of Dark Iron Ore.  Perhaps the most annoying ore, given where you have to forge it.

41309.name: Emerald Reaver
41309.flavor: Not to be confused with clubbing enthusiast Emerald Raver.

351.name: Master Swordsmith
351.text: At the end of your turn, give another random friendly minion +1 Attack.
351.flavor: He's currently trying to craft a "flail-axe", but all the other swordsmiths say it can't be done.

352.name: Doomhammer
352.flavor: Orgrim Doomhammer gave this legendary weapon to Thrall.  His name is a total coincidence.

41315.name: Ultrasaur
41315.flavor: Evolved the really long neck to spy on its neighbors.

41316.name: Golakka Crawler
41316.flavor: Universally adored by both control decks and ninjas.

41318.name: Stubborn Gastropod
41318.flavor: Stubbornly pursuing its dream to become Azeroth's fastest animal!

363.name: Onyxia
363.text: Battlecry: Summon 1/1 Whelps until your side of the battlefield is full.
363.flavor: Onyxia long manipulated the Stormwind Court by disguising herself as Lady Katrana Prestor.   You would have thought that the giant wings and scales would have been a giveaway.

41324.name: Stegodon
41324.flavor: Level 40 Tortollan Paladins quest to tame a Stegodon.  There are no level 41 Tortollan Paladins.

365.text: Return a friendly minion to your hand. It costs (2) less.
365.name: Shadowstep
365.flavor: Rogue dance troops will sometimes Shadowstep away at the end of a performance.  Crowds love it.

366.text: Secret: When an enemy casts a spell on a minion, summon a 1/3 as the new target.
366.name: Spellbender
366.flavor: While it's fun to intercept enemy lightning bolts, a spellbender much prefers to intercept opposing Marks of the Wild.  It just feels meaner.  And blood elves... well, they're a little mean.

41328.name: Giant Wasp
41328.flavor: Float like a butterfly, sting like a giant wasp!

40339.text: Secret: After your opponent plays a minion, give a random minion in your hand +2/+2.
40339.name: Hidden Cache
40339.flavor: There is an urban legend that the first Toxic Sewer Ooze was born because a rookie Goon stashed an open container of milk in a Hidden Cache.

374.name: Ragnaros the Firelord
374.text: Can't attack. At the end of your turn, deal 8 damage to a random enemy.
374.flavor: Ragnaros was summoned by the Dark Iron dwarves, who were eventually enslaved by the Firelord.  Summoning Ragnaros often doesn’t work out the way you want it to.

376.text: Change a minion's Attack to be equal to its Health.
376.name: Inner Fire
376.flavor: Good idea: Buffing your minions.  Bad idea: Starting a conversation in the Barrens.

381.text: Give your minions "Deathrattle: Summon a 2/2 Treant."
381.name: Soul of the Forest

383.name: Light's Justice
383.flavor: Prince Malchezaar was a collector of rare weapons. He'd animate them and have them dance for him.

389.name: Elven Archer
389.flavor: Don't bother asking her out on a date.  She'll shoot you down.

41350.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion and $1 damage to adjacent ones.
41350.name: Grievous Bite
41350.flavor: Ooh.  I'll have a bite of this, and of this, and of this...

391.name: Perdition's Blade
391.flavor: Perdition's Blade is Ragnaros's back-up weapon while Sulfuras is in the shop.

41353.name: Jeweled Macaw
41353.text: Battlecry: Add a random Beast to your hand.
41353.flavor: It’s not LITERALLY jeweled. The goblins were terribly disappointed.

394.text: Deal $5 damage to a minion and $2 damage to adjacent ones.
394.name: Explosive Shot
394.flavor: Pull the pin, count to 5, then shoot.  Then duck.

395.name: Water Elemental
395.text: Freeze any character damaged by this minion.
395.flavor: Don't summon a water elemental at a party.  It'll dampen the mood.

397.name: Flesheating Ghoul
397.text: Whenever a minion dies, gain +1 Attack.
397.flavor: 'Flesheating' is an unfair name.  It's just that there's not really much else for him to eat.

41358.name: Crackling Razormaw
41358.flavor: Wasn't clever enough to go AROUND the electric fence.

400.text: Draw a card for each damaged friendly character.
400.name: Battle Rage
400.flavor: "You won't like me when I'm angry."

401.name: Fiery War Axe
401.flavor: During times of tranquility and harmony, this weapon was called by its less popular name, Chilly Peace Axe.

41363.text: Your Hero Power becomes 'Give a Beast +2/+2.'
41363.name: Dinomancy
41363.flavor: Anyone can dinomance. Just put your lips together and RAAWWWAARGGGH.

404.text: Give a minion "Deathrattle: Resummon this minion."
404.name: Ancestral Spirit
404.flavor: It was just a flesh wound.

405.name: Mana Wyrm
405.text: Whenever you cast a spell, gain +1 Attack.
405.flavor: These wyrms feed on arcane energies, and while they are generally considered a nuisance rather than a real threat, you really shouldn't leave them alone with a bucket of mana.

41366.name: Swamp King Dred
41366.text: After your opponent plays a minion, attack it.
41366.flavor: Swamp King Dred, more like Swamp King Dead, amiright?

41368.name: The Marsh Queen
41368.flavor: Question: What's scarier, one giant angry dinosaur or 15 smaller vicious ones? Answer: AHHHHHHH THEY FOUND MEEEEEE

411.name: Nozdormu
411.text: Players only have 15 seconds to take their turns.
411.flavor: Time to write some flavor text.

413.name: Stormpike Commando
413.flavor: The Stormpike Commandos are demolition experts.  They also bake a mean cupcake.

415.name: Youthful Brewmaster
415.text: Battlecry: Return a friendly minion from the battlefield to your hand.
415.flavor: His youthful enthusiasm doesn’t always equal excellence in his brews.   Don’t drink the Mogu Stout!
415.targetingArrowText: Return a minion to your hand.

420.name: Cairne Bloodhoof
420.flavor: Cairne was killed by Garrosh, so... don't put this guy in a Warrior deck.  It's pretty insensitive.

421.name: Assassin's Blade
421.flavor: Guaranteed to have been owned by a real assassin.   Certificate of authenticity included.

424.name: Priestess of Elune
424.flavor: If she threatens to "moon" you, it's not what you think.

430.text: Freeze a minion and the minions next to it, and deal $1 damage to them.
430.name: Cone of Cold
430.flavor: Magi of the Kirin Tor were casting Cubes of Cold for many years before Cones came into fashion some 90 years ago.

435.text: Draw a card and deal damage equal to its Cost.
435.name: Holy Wrath

436.name: Malygos
436.flavor: Malygos hates it when mortals use magic.  He gets so mad!

437.name: Animal Companion
437.flavor: You could summon Misha, Leokk, or Huffer!  Huffer is more trouble than he's worth.

440.name: Abomination
440.flavor: Abominations enjoy Fresh Meat and long walks on the beach.

41401.name: Iron Hide
41401.flavor: Week 6. I remain covered head to toe with scales. They do not yet realize that I am not a dinosaur.

41404.name: Ornery Direhorn
41404.flavor: "It's an herbivore.  How dangerous can it be?"  - Famous last words

445.name: Reckless Rocketeer
445.flavor: One Insane Rocketeer.   One Rocket full of Explosives.   Infinite Fun.

41406.name: Cornered Sentry
41406.text: Taunt. Battlecry: Summon three 1/1 Raptors for your opponent.
41406.flavor: The Draenei are seriously considering cancelling "Bring Your Murderous Pet to Work Day."

447.name: Arcane Explosion
447.text: Deal $1 damage to all enemy minions.
447.flavor: This spell is much better than Arcane Implosion.

41410.name: Servant of Kalimos
41410.text: [x]Battlecry: If you played an Elemental last turn,  Discover an Elemental.
41410.flavor: He's doing his best, but his mom thinks that if he had just applied himself in school Kalimos would be working for HIM.

453.name: Coldlight Seer
453.flavor: The Coldlight murlocs reside in the darkest pits of the Abyssal Depths.  So no, there's no getting away from murlocs.

41414.text: Deal $3 damage to all damaged minions.
41414.name: Sleep with the Fishes
41414.flavor: If you're sleeping with the fishes, we highly suggest not bringing an electric blanket.

455.text: Secret: When one of your minions is attacked, summon three 1/1 Snakes.
455.name: Snake Trap
455.flavor: Why did it have to be snakes?

456.name: Captain Greenskin
456.flavor: He was this close to piloting a massive juggernaut into Stormwind Harbor. If it weren't for those pesky kids!

457.text: Deal $2 damage to all enemy minions and Freeze them.
457.name: Blizzard
457.flavor: This spell can be very Entertaining.

41418.name: Tar Creeper
41418.text: Taunt Has +2 Attack during your opponent's turn.
41418.flavor: If you won't come to the tar pits, we'll bring them to you!

459.name: Deadly Poison
459.flavor: Rogues guard the secrets to poison-making carefully, lest magi start incorporating poison into their spells.  Poisonbolt? Rain of Poison?  Poison Elemental?  Nobody wants that.

41420.name: Molten Blade
41420.text: Each turn this is in your hand, transform it into a new weapon.
41420.flavor: It’s a sword! It’s a knife! It’s a swizzle-stick!

461.name: Sap
461.text: Return an enemy minion to your opponent's hand.

462.text: Secret: When your hero takes damage, deal that much damage to the enemy hero.
462.name: Eye for an Eye
462.flavor: Justice sometimes takes the form of a closed fist into a soft cheek.

45519.text: Summon one 5/5 Mithril Golem. (Equip a weapon to upgrade.)
45519.name: Lesser Mithril Spellstone
45519.flavor:
To dwarves of stone the demon called
With promises of might, enthralled
In grasping greed they found their doom
Forever bound in mithril tombs.

45520.text: Secret: When a friendly minion dies, return it to your hand. It costs (2) less.
45520.name: Cheat Death

466.name: Arcane Golem
466.text: Battlecry: Give your opponent a Mana Crystal.
466.flavor: Having Arcane golems at home really classes up the place, and as a bonus they are great conversation pieces.

467.name: Moonfire
467.flavor: "Cast Moonfire, and never stop." - How to Be a Druid, Chapter 5, Section 3

469.name: Blood Imp
469.text: [x] Stealth. At the end of your turn, give another random friendly minion +1 Health.
469.flavor: Imps are content to hide and viciously taunt everyone nearby.

45528.name: Dragon Soul
45528.text: After you cast 3 spells in a turn, summon a 5/5 Dragon.
45528.flavor: Crafted by Deathwing's goblin horde, but the dragon added the rainbow sparkles himself.

45529.text: Secret: When a minion attacks your hero, instead it attacks one of its neighbors.
45529.name: Sudden Betrayal
45529.flavor: You thought he was your bro-bold, but turns out he's your foe-bold.

475.name: Murloc Tidecaller
475.text: Whenever you summon a Murloc, gain +1 Attack.
475.flavor: This guy gets crazy strong at family reunions.

476.name: Consecration
476.flavor: Consecrated ground glows with Holy energy.  But it smells a little, too.

45535.text: Secret: After your hero takes damage, become Immune this turn.
45535.name: Evasion
45535.flavor: Works on weapons, missiles, and taxes.

481.text: Deal damage equal to your hero's Attack to a minion.
481.name: Savagery
481.flavor: It is true that some druids are savage, but others still enjoy a quiet moment and a spot of tea.

45539.name: Lynessa Sunsorrow
45539.text: [x]Battlecry: Cast each spell you cast on your minions this game on this one.
45539.flavor: A diet of pure magic is great for the complexion but wreaks havoc on one's mood.

45546.text:
[x]Summon an Animal
Companion, or 2 if your
deck has no minions.
45546.name: To My Side!
45546.flavor: I hunt alone.  Well, me and Misha.  And Huffer.  And Leokk.

45547.name: Feral Gibberer
45547.text: After this minion attacks a hero, add a copy of it to your hand.

493.name: Force of Nature
493.flavor: "I think I'll just nap under these trees. Wait... AAAAAHHH!" - Blinkfizz, the Unfortunate Gnome

1858.howToEarn: Unlocked in Frostwyrm Lair, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1858.name: Echoing Ooze
1858.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Frostwyrm Lair, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1858.text: Battlecry: Summon an exact copy of this minion at the end of the turn.

496.name: Frostwolf Warlord
496.text: Battlecry: Gain +1/+1 for each other friendly minion on the battlefield.
496.flavor: The Frostwolves are locked in combat with the Stormpike Expedition over control of Alterac Valley.  Every attempt at peace-talks has ended with Captain Galvangar killing the mediator.

503.text: Choose One - Give your minions +1/+1; or Summon a 3/2 Panther.
503.name: Power of the Wild
503.flavor: Never look a panther in the eye.  Or is it 'Always look a panther in the eye'?  Well, it's one of those.

505.name: Lightning Bolt
505.flavor: Lightning Bolt! Lightning Bolt! Lightning Bolt!

510.name: Grimscale Oracle
510.flavor: These are the brainy murlocs.  It turns out that doesn’t mean much.

511.text: If you have a weapon, give it +1/+1. Otherwise equip a 1/3 weapon.
511.name: Upgrade!

512.name: Frost Elemental
512.flavor: When a Water elemental and an Ice elemental love each other VERY much...

513.name: Mana Tide Totem
513.text: At the end of your turn, draw a card.
513.flavor: It is said that some shaman can say "Floatin' totem" 10 times, fast.

517.name: Felguard
517.text: Taunt Battlecry: Destroy one of your Mana Crystals.
517.flavor: Yes, he'll fight for you.  BUT HE'S NOT GOING TO LIKE IT.

41478.name: Primalfin Lookout
41478.text: Battlecry: If you control another Murloc, Discover a Murloc.
41478.flavor: Lookout is a self-appointed title that's mostly an excuse to beat things up.

519.text: Secret: When an enemy minion attacks, return it to its owner's hand. It costs (2) more.
519.name: Freezing Trap
519.flavor: "Dang, that's cold." - appropriate response to Freezing Trap, or a mean joke.

523.name: Dragonling Mechanic
523.flavor: She is still working on installing the rocket launcher add-on for Mr. Bitey.

525.name: Archmage
525.flavor: You earn the title of Archmage when you can destroy anyone who calls you on it.

526.name: Gruul
526.text: At the end of each turn, gain +1/+1 .
526.flavor: He's Gruul "the Dragonkiller".  He just wanted to cuddle them… he never meant to…

530.howToEarn: Unlocked when you have all the Pirates from the Classic Set.
530.name: Captain's Parrot
530.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked when you have all the Golden Pirates from the Expert Set.
530.text: Battlecry: Draw a Pirate from your deck.
530.flavor: Pirates and Parrots go together like Virmen and Carrots.

531.name: Faceless Manipulator
531.text: Battlecry: Choose a minion and become a copy of it.
531.flavor: The Faceless Ones are servants of Yogg-Saron, and they feed on fear. Right now they are feeding on your fear of accidentally disenchanting all your good cards.
531.targetingArrowText: Become a copy of a minion.

45590.name: Arcane Artificer
45590.text: Whenever you cast a spell, gain Armor equal to its Cost.
45590.flavor: Ethereal armor dissipates in 6 hours which can cause extreme awkwardness for first time buyers.

41496.text: Discover a spell. Reduce its Cost by (2).
41496.name: Primordial Glyph
41496.flavor: It's the Ancient Tol'vir symbol for "Whoops!"

538.name: Arathi Weaponsmith
538.flavor: 50% off fist weapons, limited time only!

41499.name: Unite the Murlocs
41499.flavor: Form feet and legs!  Form arms and body!  Oh.  Sorry.  I was thinking about Mechafin.

1791.howToEarn: Unlocked in The Arachnid Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1791.name: Maexxna
1791.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in The Arachnid Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1791.flavor: Maexxna gets super mad when people introduce her as "Maxina" or "Maxxy".

545.name: Mind Blast
545.text: Deal $5 damage to the enemy hero.
545.flavor: This spell blasts you directly in the MIND.

546.text: Deal 1 damage to a minion for each Armor you have.
546.name: Shield Slam
546.flavor: "What is a better weapon? The sharp one your enemies expect, or the blunt one they ignore?" - The Art of Warrior, Chapter 9

555.name: Arcane Intellect
555.flavor: Playing this card makes you SMARTER.  And let's face it: we could all stand to be a little smarter.

556.name: Illidan Stormrage
556.text: Whenever you play a card, summon a 2/1 Flame of Azzinoth.
556.flavor: Illidan's brother, Malfurion, imprisoned him beneath Hyjal for 10,000 years.  Stormrages are not good at letting go of grudges.

559.name: Leeroy Jenkins
559.text: Charge. Battlecry: Summon two 1/1 Whelps for your opponent.
559.flavor: At least he has Angry Chicken.

41521.text: Deal $4 damage to a minion. Restore #4 Health to your hero.
41521.name: Tidal Surge
41521.flavor: Also good for removing pesky stains.

564.name: Arcane Missiles
564.text: Deal $3 damage randomly split among all enemies.
564.flavor: You'd think you'd be able to control your missiles a little better since you're a powerful mage and all.

567.name: Windfury Harpy
567.flavor: Harpies are not pleasant sounding.  That's the nicest I can put it.

570.name: Tinkmaster Overspark
570.targetingArrowText: Transform a minion into a 5/5 or a 1/1 at random.
570.text: [x]Battlecry: Transform another random minion into a 5/5 Devilsaur or a 1/1 Squirrel.
570.flavor: Tinkmaster Overspark nearly lost his Tinker's license after the Great Ironforge Squirrel Stampede of '09.

577.text: Give your hero +4 Attack this turn. Gain 4 Armor.
577.name: Bite

581.name: Alexstrasza
581.text: Battlecry: Set a hero's remaining Health to 15.
581.flavor: Alexstrasza the Life-Binder brings life and hope to everyone.  Except Deathwing.  And Malygos.  And Nekros.

582.name: Darkscale Healer
582.text: Battlecry: Restore 2 Health to all friendly characters.
582.flavor: Healing is just something she does in her free time.  It's more of a hobby really.

584.text: Secret: When an enemy attacks, summon a 2/1 Defender as the new target.
584.name: Noble Sacrifice

585.text: Secret: When your hero is attacked, deal $2 damage to all enemies.
585.name: Explosive Trap
585.flavor: It traps your food AND cooks it for you!

587.name: Frost Nova
587.flavor: Hey man, that's cold.  Literally and metaphorically.

596.name: Armorsmith
596.text: Whenever a friendly minion takes damage, gain 1 Armor.
596.flavor: She accepts guild funds for repairs!

601.name: Keeper of the Grove
601.text: Choose One - Deal 2 damage; or Silence a minion.
601.flavor: These guys just show up and start Keeping your Groves without even asking.

602.name: Fen Creeper
602.flavor: He used to be called Bog Beast, but it confused people because he wasn't an actual beast.   Boom, New Name!

605.name: Ancient Watcher
605.flavor: Why do its eyes seem to follow you as you walk by?

41566.name: Mistress of Mixtures
41566.flavor: Her favorite mixture is cola and lime.

41567.name: Dirty Rat
41567.text: [x]Taunt Battlecry: Your opponent summons a random minion from their hand.
41567.flavor: It's not his fault…  Someone keeps stealing his soap!

608.name: Shattered Sun Cleric
608.flavor: They always have a spare flask of Sunwell Energy Drink™!

609.name: Faerie Dragon
609.text: Can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.
609.flavor: Adorable.  Immune to Magic.  Doesn't pee on the rug.  The perfect pet!

613.name: Power Word: Shield
613.text:
Give a minion +2 Health.
Draw a card.
613.flavor: Sure the extra protection is nice, but the shield really reduces visibility.

614.name: Sorcerer's Apprentice
614.flavor: Apprentices are great for bossing around.  "Conjure me some mana buns! And a coffee!  Make that a mana coffee!"

1657.name: Big Game Hunter
1657.text: Battlecry: Destroy a minion with 7 or more Attack.
1657.flavor: Mere devilsaurs no longer excite him.  Soon he'll be trying to catch Onyxia with only a dull Krol Blade.
1657.targetingArrowText: Destroy a minion with an Attack of 7 or more.

618.name: Dust Devil
618.flavor: Westfall is full of dust devils. And buzzards. And crazed golems. And pirates. Why does anyone live here?

621.text: Secret: When your hero is attacked, gain 8 Armor.
621.name: Ice Barrier
621.flavor: This is Rank 1.  Rank 2 is Chocolate Milk Barrier.

622.name: Stormwind Knight
622.flavor: They're still embarrassed about "The Deathwing Incident".

629.text: Deal $2-$3 damage to all enemy minions. Overload: (2)
629.name: Lightning Storm
629.flavor: An umbrella won't be effective, I'm afraid.

631.name: Doomguard
631.flavor: Summoning a doomguard is risky. Someone is going to die.

1794.howToEarn: Unlocked in Frostwyrm Lair, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1794.name: Kel'Thuzad
1794.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Frostwyrm Lair, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1794.text: At the end of each turn, summon all friendly minions that died this turn.
1794.flavor: Kel'Thuzad could not resist the call of the Lich King. Even when it's just a robo-call extolling the Lich King's virtues.

635.name: Sen'jin Shieldmasta
635.flavor: Sen'jin Village is nice, if you like trolls and dust.

636.name: Whirlwind
636.flavor: The way to tell seasoned warriors from novice ones: the novices yell "wheeeee" while whirlwinding.

640.name: Hogger
640.text: At the end of your turn, summon a 2/2 Gnoll with Taunt.
640.flavor: Hogger is super powerful. If you kill him, it's because he let you.

641.name: Young Dragonhawk
641.flavor: They were the inspiration for the championship Taurenball team: The Dragonhawks.

642.name: Scarlet Crusader
642.flavor: Never wash your whites with a Scarlet Crusader.

643.name: Sword of Justice
643.text: After you summon a minion, give it +1/+1 and this loses 1 Durability.
643.flavor: I dub you Sir Loin of Beef!

45707.name: Dire Mole
45707.flavor: You especially don't want to make a dire mountain out of a dire mole hill.

654.name: Frothing Berserker
654.text: Whenever a minion takes damage, gain +1 Attack.
654.flavor: He used to work as an accountant before he tried his hand at Berserkering.

658.name: Leper Gnome
658.text: Deathrattle: Deal 2 damage to the enemy hero.
658.flavor: He really just wants to be your friend, but the constant rejection is starting to really get to him.

41212.text: Draw a card, then add a copy of it to your hand.
41212.name: Mimic Pod

662.name: Frostbolt
662.text: Deal $3 damage to a character and Freeze it.
662.flavor: It is customary to yell "Chill out!" or "Freeze!" or "Ice ice, baby!" when you play this card.

667.name: Fan of Knives
667.text: Deal $1 damage to all enemy minions. Draw a card.
667.flavor: I wouldn't say I LOVE knives, but I'm definitely a fan.

670.name: Nightblade
670.flavor: Your face is the place you'd probably least like a dagger, and where rogues are most likely to deliver them.

672.name: Kobold Geomancer
672.flavor: In the old days, Kobolds were the finest candle merchants in the land. Then they got pushed too far...

679.text: Draw cards until you have as many in hand as your opponent.
679.name: Divine Favor
679.flavor: This is not just a favor, but a divine one, like helping someone move a couch with a fold out bed!

680.name: Southsea Captain
680.flavor: When he saves enough plunder, he's going to commission an enormous captain's hat.  He has hat envy.

39026.name: Undercity Huckster
39026.text: Deathrattle: Add a random class card to your hand (from your opponent's class).
39026.flavor: Psst! Wanna buy a random class card (from your opponent's class)?

692.name: Druid of the Claw
692.flavor: Cat or Bear?  Cat or Bear?!  I just cannot CHOOSE!

699.name: Tundra Rhino
699.flavor: Tundra rhinos are often mistaken for kodos.  Or am I mistaken?

700.name: Mogu'shan Warden
700.flavor: All these guys ever do is talk about the Thunder King.   BOOOORRRINNG!

45759.text: Give a minion +2/+2. Gains a bonus effect in your hand.
45759.name: Unidentified Elixir
45759.flavor: "Here, taste this." (Slurp) "What is it?" "I don't know, I found it in one of the labs."

708.text: Deal $2 damage to the enemy hero. Combo: Return this to your hand next turn.
708.name: Headcrack
708.flavor: When all else fails, nothing beats a swift whack upside the head.

710.name: Sinister Strike
710.text: Deal $3 damage to the enemy hero.
710.flavor: There's something about this strike that just feels off.  Sinister, even.

712.name: War Golem
712.flavor: Golems are not afraid, but for some reason they still run when you cast Fear on them.  Instinct, maybe?  A desire to blend in?

715.name: Mana Wraith
715.flavor: They come out at night to eat leftover mana crystals. "Mmmmmm," they say.

45775.text:
Gain 5 Armor.
Gains a bonus effect in your hand.
45775.name: Unidentified Shield
45775.flavor: The kobold stared at the bundle for a long time. “Ah hah!” he said. “It’s a shield.”

41683.name: Gluttonous Ooze
41683.text: Battlecry: Destroy your opponent's weapon and gain Armor equal to its Attack.
41683.flavor: Three time winner of the Un'Goro weapon eating contest.

724.name: Southsea Deckhand
724.text: Has Charge while you have a weapon equipped.
724.flavor: Pirates are into this new fad called "Planking".

45782.name: Unidentified Maul
45782.text: Gains a bonus effect in your hand.
45782.flavor: When all you have is an unidentified maul, everything else looks like an unidentified nail.

727.name: Hand of Protection
727.flavor: This spell has been renamed so many times, even paladins don’t know what it should be called anymore.

41690.text: Choose a friendly minion. Summon a copy of it.
41690.name: Molten Reflection

734.name: Mind Control Tech
734.text: [x]Battlecry: If your opponent has 4 or more minions, take control of one at random.
734.flavor: Mind Control technology is getting better, but that's not saying much.

736.howToEarn: Unlocked when you have all the Murlocs from the Classic Set.
736.name: Old Murk-Eye
736.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked when you have all the Golden Murlocs from the Expert and Basic Sets.
736.text: Charge. Has +1 Attack for each other Murloc on the battlefield.
736.flavor: He's a legend among murlocs.  "Mrghllghghllghg!", they say.

739.name: Bluegill Warrior
739.flavor: He just wants a hug.   A sloppy... slimy... hug.

742.name: Savage Roar
742.text: Give your characters +2 Attack this turn.
742.flavor: What do they roar? Nobody can quite tell, but it sounds like "Elephant Macho Breeze".  It's probably not that, though.

748.name: Kirin Tor Mage
748.text: [x]Battlecry: The next Secret you play this turn costs (0).
748.flavor: The Kirin Tor reside in the floating city of Dalaran.  How do you make a Dalaran float?  Two scoops of ice cream, one scoop of Dalaran.

749.name: Bloodmage Thalnos
749.flavor: He's in charge of the Annual Scarlet Monastery Blood Drive!

753.name: Stormwind Champion
753.flavor: When Deathwing assaulted the capital, this soldier was the only member of his squad to survive. Now he's all bitter and stuff.

754.name: Spellbreaker
754.flavor: Spellbreakers can rip enchantments from magic-wielders.  The process is painless and can be performed on an outpatient basis.

755.name: Blood Knight
755.text: Battlecry: All minions lose Divine Shield. Gain +3/+3 for each Shield lost.
755.flavor: The Blood Knights get their holy powers from the Sunwell, which you should NOT bathe in.

756.text: Change the Health of ALL minions to 1.
756.name: Equality
756.flavor: We are all special unique snowflakes... with 1 Health.

757.name: Argent Squire
757.flavor: "I solemnly swear to uphold the Light, purge the world of darkness, and to eat only burritos." - The Argent Dawn Oath

759.name: Sunwalker
759.flavor: She doesn’t ACTUALLY walk on the Sun.  It's just a name.  Don’t worry!

762.name: Mad Bomber
762.text: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage randomly split between all other characters.
762.flavor: He's not really all that crazy, he is just not as careful with explosives as he should be.

763.name: Defender of Argus
763.flavor: You wouldn’t think that Argus would need this much defending.  But it does.

45820.name: Possessed Lackey
45820.flavor: If you don't keep up with your payments, it'll be a repossessed lackey.

765.name: Thrallmar Farseer
765.flavor: He's stationed in the Hellfire Peninsula, but he's hoping for a reassignment closer to Orgrimmar, or really anywhere the ground is less on fire.

766.name: Hex
766.text: Transform a minion into a 0/1 Frog with Taunt.
766.flavor: If you Hex a Murloc... it really isn't much of a change, is it?

767.text: Silence a minion, then deal $1 damage to it.
767.name: Earth Shock
767.flavor: Earth Shock? Shouldn't it be "Azeroth Shock"?

768.name: Gurubashi Berserker
768.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, gain +3 Attack.

45828.text: Gain 6 Armor. Recruit a minion that costs (4) or less.
45828.name: Oaken Summons
45828.flavor: The Guild used oak trees until they all turned to ash.

774.name: Unbound Elemental
774.text: Whenever you play a card with Overload, gain +1/+1.
774.flavor: Unlike bound elementals, Unbound ones really enjoy a night on the town.

777.name: Lord Jaraxxus
777.text: Battlecry: Destroy your hero and replace it with Lord Jaraxxus.
777.flavor: "TRIFLING GNOME! YOUR ARROGANCE WILL BE YOUR UNDOING!!!!"

778.name: Harvest Golem
778.flavor: "Overheat threshold exceeded. System failure. Wheat clog in port two. Shutting down."

45837.name: Trogg Gloomeater
45837.flavor: His breath smells like agony and despair, which is still better than most troggs.

783.name: Pit Lord
783.flavor: Mannoroth, Magtheridon, and Brutallus may be dead, but it turns out there are a LOT of pit lords.

790.name: Amani Berserker
790.flavor: If an Amani berserker asks "Joo lookin' at me?!", the correct response is "Nah, mon".

791.name: Questing Adventurer
791.text: Whenever you play a card, gain +1/+1.
791.flavor: "Does anyone have some extra Boar Pelts?"

797.name: Lightwell
797.text: At the start of your turn, restore 3 Health to a damaged friendly character.
797.flavor: It isn't clear if people ignore the Lightwell, or if it is just invisible.

801.name: Crazed Alchemist
801.text: Battlecry: Swap the Attack and Health of a minion.
801.flavor: "You'll love my new recipe!" he says... especially if you're not happy with your current number of limbs.
801.targetingArrowText: Swap Attack and Health of a minion.

45859.name: Ixlid, Fungal Lord
45859.text: After you play a minion, summon a copy of it.
45859.flavor: We suggest crafting Ixlid; he'll grow on you. Literally.

804.text: Deal $4 damage. If you have 12 or less Health, deal $6 instead.
804.name: Mortal Strike
804.flavor: "If you only use one ability, use Mortal Strike." - The Warrior Code, Line 6

41094.text: Transform your Mana Crystals into 2/2 minions. Recover the mana when they die.
41094.name: Living Mana
41094.flavor: If you truly love your mana, set it free.

810.name: Gorehowl
810.text: Attacking a minion costs 1 Attack instead of 1 Durability.
810.flavor: Grommash Hellscream's famous axe.  Somehow this ended up in Prince Malchezaar's possession.  Quite the mystery!

811.name: Cult Master
811.text: Whenever one of your other minions dies, draw a card.
811.flavor: She may be an evil cult master, but she still calls her parents once a week.

41217.name: Vilespine Slayer
41217.flavor: 'Cause slayers gonna slay, slay, slay, slay, slay.

814.text: Secret: After your opponent plays a minion, deal $4 damage to it.
814.name: Snipe
814.flavor: A great sniper hits the spot.  Just like a delicious flank of boar. Mmmmm.

818.text: Draw a card. That card costs (3) less.
818.name: Far Sight
818.flavor: Drek'thar can't see, but he can see. You know what I mean? It's ok if you don't.

45877.text: Give your Silver Hand Recruits +2/+2 and Taunt.
45877.name: Level Up!

823.name: Starfire
823.flavor: Balance is important to druids.  This card is perfectly balanced.

825.name: Azure Drake
825.flavor: They initially planned to be the Beryl or Cerulean drakes, but those felt a tad too pretentious.

1937.name: Shadowbomber
1937.flavor: Shadowbomber does her job, but she's kind of phoning it in at this point.

834.name: Deathwing
834.text: Battlecry: Destroy all other minions and discard your hand.
834.flavor: Once a noble dragon known as Neltharion, Deathwing lost his mind and shattered Azeroth before finally being defeated.  Daddy issues?

45195.name: Carnivorous Cube
45195.text: Battlecry: Destroy a friendly minion. Deathrattle: Summon 2 copies of it.
45195.flavor: He's always grumpy until he's eaten his first barista of the morning.

836.text: Choose One - Deal $3 damage to a minion; or $1 damage and draw a card.
836.name: Wrath
836.flavor: The talk around the Ratchet Inn is that this card is too good and should be a Legendary.

841.name: Holy Nova
841.text: Deal $2 damage to all enemies. Restore #2 Health to all friendly characters.
841.flavor: If the Holy Light forsakes you, good luck casting this spell.  Also, you're probably a jerk.

41218.name: Sherazin, Corpse Flower
41218.text: Deathrattle: Go dormant. Play 4 cards in a turn to revive this minion.

45899.name: Duskbreaker
45899.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, deal 3 damage to all other minions.
45899.flavor: Waking up at the break of dusk is just not as impressive.

846.text: Give a friendly minion +4/+4 until end of turn. Then, it dies. Horribly.
846.name: Power Overwhelming
846.flavor: We cannot even describe how horrible the death is.  It's CRAZY bad!  Maybe worse than that.  Just don't do it.

847.name: Truesilver Champion
847.text: Whenever your hero attacks, restore 2 Health to it.
847.flavor: It Slices, it Dices. You can cut a tin can with it. (But you wouldn't want to.)

45905.text: Give your minions "Deathrattle: Summon a random basic Totem."
45905.name: Primal Talismans
45905.flavor: All that remained from the first kobold colony: a single talisman and the word "Flamestrike."

854.name: Humility
854.flavor: This card makes something really damp.  Oh wait.  That's "Humidity."

858.flavor: He's the leader of the gnomes, and an incredible inventor.  He's getting better, too; He turns things into chickens WAY less than he used to.
858.name: Gelbin Mekkatorque
858.howToEarnGolden: This was rewarded to players who helped test the Store during the Beta.

859.name: Twisting Nether
859.flavor: The Twisting Nether is a formless place of magic and illusion and destroyed minions.

860.name: Sense Demons
860.flavor: Generally demons are pretty obvious and you don’t need a spell to sense them.

864.name: Lava Burst
864.flavor: It's like an ocean of liquid magma in your mouth!

866.name: Shieldbearer
866.flavor: Have you seen the size of the shields in this game??  This is no easy job.

41105.name: Primalfin Totem
41105.text: At the end of your turn, summon a 1/1 Murloc.
41105.flavor: Emits a sound only murlocs can hear, which is good because it’s REALLY annoying.

45929.name: Kobold Apprentice
45929.text: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage randomly split among all enemies.
45929.flavor: Horrible secret: The Darkness is immune to Arcane Missiles.

45930.name: Plated Beetle
45930.flavor: "Ok, your party has defeated the beetle." "I put it on my head." "What?" "I put it on my head. Like a hat."

877.name: Arcane Shot
877.flavor: Magi conjured arcane arrows to sell to hunters, until hunters learned just enough magic to do it themselves.  The resulting loss of jobs sent Stormwind into a minor recession.

878.name: Dread Corsair
878.text: Taunt Costs (1) less per Attack of your weapon.
878.flavor: "Yarrrr" is a pirate word that means "Greetings, milord."

45936.name: Kobold Illusionist
45936.text: Deathrattle: Summon a 1/1 copy of a minion from your hand.
45936.flavor: He can make ANYTHING look like a candle.

41841.name: Madam Goya
41841.text: Battlecry: Choose a friendly minion. Swap it with a minion in your deck.
41841.flavor: She has set up her Black Market here in Gadgetzan for one purpose, to make a KILLING when Beanie Babies make their inevitable comeback.

41107.name: Fire Plume Harbinger
41107.text: Battlecry: Reduce the Cost of Elementals in your hand by (1).
41107.flavor: Good for summoning elementals. Great for making s'mores.

886.name: Lightspawn
886.text: This minion's Attack is always equal to its Health.
886.flavor: Spawn of the Light? Or Pawn of the Lights?

887.name: Master of Disguise
887.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion Stealth until your next turn.
887.flavor: She's actually a male tauren.  People don't call him "Master of Disguise" for nothing.

9081.howToEarn: Unlocked in the Temple of Orsis, in the League of Explorers adventure.
9081.name: Ancient Shade
9081.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in the Temple of Orsis, in the League of Explorers adventure.
9081.text: Battlecry: Shuffle an 'Ancient Curse' into your deck that deals 7 damage to you when drawn.
9081.flavor: Warning: Do not expose to direct sunlight.

890.name: Tirion Fordring
890.flavor: If you haven't heard the Tirion Fordring theme song, it's because it doesn't exist.

891.name: Sunfury Protector
891.flavor: She carries a shield, but only so she can give it to someone she can stand behind.

896.text: All minions lose Stealth. Destroy all enemy Secrets. Draw a card.
896.name: Flare
896.flavor: Not only does it reveal your enemies, but it's also great for parties!

41859.name: Vinecleaver
41859.text:
[x]After your hero attacks,
summon two 1/1 Silver
Hand Recruits.
41859.flavor: George and Karl!  Thank the Light we found you!

903.text: Give a friendly Beast +2 Attack and Immune this turn.
903.name: Bestial Wrath
903.flavor: The seething wrath is just beneath the surface.  Beneath that is wild abandon, followed by slight annoyance.

904.name: Eviscerate
904.flavor: There is a high cost to Eviscerating your opponent:  It takes a long time to get blood stains out of leather armor.

45833.name: Crystal Lion
45833.text: [x]Divine Shield Costs (1) less for each Silver Hand Recruit you control.
45833.flavor: Standard issue recruit gear: 1 silver sword, 1 Lordaeron insignia, 2 bags of crystal kibble.

41868.text: Quest: Cast 6 spells on your minions. Reward: Galvadon.
41868.name: The Last Kaleidosaur
41868.flavor: “Impossible!” exclaimed the Silver Hand Recruit, his eyes filled with fear. Uther shook his head, turning the crystal until it caught the light: “Life finds a way.”

41869.name: Cruel Dinomancer
41869.text: [x]Deathrattle: Summon a random minion you discarded this game.
41869.flavor: As that old saying goes: "you don't get into dinomancing to make friends."

41871.text: Corrupt every minion. Destroy them at the start of your next turn.
41871.name: Corrupting Mist
41871.flavor: The most terrifying of Un’goro magics is both silent… AND deadly.

912.name: Harrison Jones
912.text: Battlecry: Destroy your opponent's weapon and draw cards equal to its Durability.
912.flavor: “That belongs in the Hall of Explorers!”

41873.name: Lakkari Felhound
41873.flavor: Guaranteed to track tar all over your carpet.

914.name: Shadow Bolt
914.flavor: It’s a Bolt.   It's made out of Shadow.   What more do you need to know!

39747.howToEarn: Unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.
39747.name: Ironforge Portal
39747.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.
39747.text:
Gain 4 Armor.
Summon a random
4-Cost minion.
39747.flavor: Come to beautiful Ironforge! Where irons are forged and the forges are iron!

41876.name: Clutchmother Zavas
41876.text: Whenever you discard this, give it +2/+2 and return it to your hand.
41876.flavor: A bit of a snob: still refuses to drive anything with automatic transmission.

41878.text: Deal $15 damage to a minion and $3 damage to adjacent ones.
41878.name: Meteor
41878.flavor: When you absolutely, positively have to kill all the dinosaurs.

919.name: Drain Life
919.text: Deal $2 damage. Restore #2 Health to your hero.
919.flavor: "I've just sucked one year of your life away."

920.name: Ancient of Lore
920.text: Choose One - Draw a card; or Restore 5 Health.
920.flavor: Go ahead, carve your initials in him.

921.name: Jungle Panther
921.flavor: Stranglethorn is a beautiful place to visit, but you wouldn't want to live there.

922.name: Goldshire Footman
922.flavor: If 1/2 minions are all that is defending Goldshire, you would think it would have been overrun years ago.

45979.text: Copy a spell in your opponent's deck and add it to your hand.
45979.name: Psionic Probe

41885.name: Hemet, Jungle Hunter
41885.text: Battlecry: Destroy all cards in your deck that cost (3) or less.
41885.flavor: The goblin travel agency lost his luggage, but he's still having a great vacation!

926.name: Imp Master
926.text:
[x]At the end of your turn, deal
1 damage to this minion
 and summon a 1/1 Imp.
926.flavor: She would enjoy the job a lot more if she just could get the imps to QUIT BITING HER.

932.name: Gadgetzan Auctioneer
932.text: Whenever you cast a spell, draw a card.
932.flavor: He used to run the black market auction house, but there was just too much violence and he had to move.

45995.name: Grumble, Worldshaker
45995.text: Battlecry: Return your other minions to your hand. They cost (1).
45995.flavor: The grumbling grew to a mighty rumbling, and out of the caverns the kobolds came tumbling.

940.name: Cleave
940.text:
[x]Deal $2 damage to
two random enemy
minions.
940.flavor: Hey you two…could you stand next to each other for a second…

1522.name: Blessed Champion
1522.flavor: This card causes double the trouble AND double the fun.

943.name: Blessing of Kings
943.flavor: Given the number of kings who have been assassinated, are you sure you want their blessing?

158.name: Secretkeeper
158.flavor: She promises not to tell anyone about that thing you did last night with that one person.

950.name: Hellfire
950.flavor: It's spells like these that make it hard for Warlocks to get decent help.

46007.name: Drygulch Jailor
46007.text: Deathrattle: Add 3 Silver Hand Recruits to your hand.

41912.name: Lost in the Jungle
41912.flavor: George and Karl were never heard from again.

41913.name: The Voraxx
41913.text:
[x]After you cast a spell on
this minion, summon a
1/1 Plant and cast
another copy on it.
41913.flavor: I am the Voraxx.  I speak for the weeds.

46541.name: Leyline Manipulator
46541.text: Battlecry: If you're holding any cards that didn't start in your deck, reduce their Cost by (2).
46541.flavor: The shortest distance between two points is a leyline.

962.name: The Beast
962.text: Deathrattle: Summon a 3/3 Finkle Einhorn for your opponent.
962.flavor: He lives in Blackrock Mountain.  He eats Gnomes.  That's pretty much it.

1805.howToEarn: Unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1805.name: Death's Bite
1805.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1805.flavor: "Take a bite outta Death." - McScruff the Deathlord

41925.name: Humongous Razorleaf
41925.flavor: Loves goblins.  In a light cream sauce.

41926.name: Igneous Elemental
41926.text: Deathrattle: Add two 1/2 Elementals to your hand.
41926.flavor: We wanted to name him "Ingenious Elemental", but he just wasn't that bright.

41927.name: Shimmering Tempest
41927.text: Deathrattle: Add a random Mage spell to your hand.
41927.flavor: HATES being summoned for Kirin Tor party lighting.

41928.name: Blazecaller
41928.text: Battlecry: If you played an Elemental last turn, deal 5 damage.
41928.flavor: For when a flamecaller just won't do.

969.name: Summoning Portal
969.text: Your minions cost (2) less, but not less than (1).
969.flavor: NOT LESS THAN 1!  Don't get any ideas!

46026.text: Spend all your Armor. Deal that much damage to all minions.
46026.name: Reckless Flurry
46026.flavor: Look. Cautious Flurries will only get you so far in life.

971.name: Frost Shock
971.text: Deal $1 damage to an enemy character and Freeze it.

974.name: Soulfire
974.flavor: Are you lighting a soul on fire? Or burning someone with your OWN soul? This seems like an important distinction.

46031.name: Drywhisker Armorer
46031.text: Battlecry: For each enemy minion, gain 2 Armor.
46031.flavor: Kobolds use anything for armor: Pots, pans, garbage cans… even other kobolds.

979.name: Demolisher
979.text: At the start of your turn, deal 2 damage to a random enemy.
979.flavor: Laying siege isn't fun for anyone.  It's not even all that effective, now that everyone has a flying mount.

982.name: Corruption
982.text: Choose an enemy minion. At the start of your turn, destroy it.
982.flavor: It starts with stealing a pen from work, and before you know it, BOOM!  Corrupted!

46040.name: Rin, the First Disciple
46040.text: Taunt Deathrattle: Add 'The First Seal' to your hand.
46040.flavor: Signed and sealed, she delivers oblivion.

985.name: Dire Wolf Alpha
985.flavor: We are pretty excited about the upcoming release of Dire Wolf Beta, just repost this sign for a chance at a key.

990.text: Give your minions Stealth until your next turn.
990.name: Conceal
990.flavor: Rogues conceal everything but their emotions.  You can't get 'em to shut up about feelings.

993.name: Mountain Giant
993.text: Costs (1) less for each other card in your hand.
993.flavor: His mother said that he was just big boned.

994.name: Worgen Infiltrator
994.flavor: If you want to stop a worgen from infiltrating, just yell, "No! Bad boy!"

995.name: Ogre Magi
995.flavor: Training Ogres in the art of spellcasting is a questionable decision.

997.name: Bloodsail Corsair
997.text: [x]Battlecry: Remove 1 Durability from your opponent's weapon.
997.flavor: Every pirate uses the same four digits to access Automated Gold Dispensers.  It's called the "Pirate's Code".

999.name: Bloodsail Raider
999.text: Battlecry: Gain Attack equal to the Attack of your weapon.
999.flavor: "I only plunder on days that end in 'y'."

46056.name: Voidlord
46056.flavor: Never let it hold your checkbook.

46058.name: Gather Your Party
46058.flavor: Thrilling adventure! Danger guaranteed! Loot uncertain! Death optional!  Who’s with me?

1003.name: Houndmaster
1003.flavor: "Who let the dogs out?" he asks.  It's rhetorical.

1004.name: Flamestrike
1004.text: Deal $4 damage to all enemy minions.
1004.flavor: When the ground is on fire, you should not stop, drop, and roll.

1007.name: Heroic Strike
1007.text: Give your hero +4 Attack this turn.
1007.flavor: Really, if you're a hero, this is every strike.

1008.name: Flametongue Totem
1008.flavor: Totemsmiths like to use the rarest woods for their totems.  There are even rumors of totems made of Ironbark Protectors.

1009.name: Warsong Commander
1009.flavor: The Warsong clan is such drama. It's really not worth it to become a commander.

46067.text: Restore #12 Health randomly split among all friendly characters.
46067.name: Healing Rain

46069.name: Guild Recruiter
46069.text: Battlecry: Recruit a minion that costs (4) or less.

1014.name: Wild Pyromancer
1014.text: After you cast a spell, deal 1 damage to ALL minions.
1014.flavor: BOOM BABY BOOM!  BAD IS GOOD!  DOWN WITH GOVERNMENT!

1016.name: Coldlight Oracle
1016.flavor: They can see the future.   In that future both players draw more cards.   Spoooky.

1019.name: Dread Infernal
1019.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to ALL other characters.
1019.flavor: "INFERNOOOOOOOOOO!" - Jaraxxus, Eredar Lord of the Burning Legion

46077.name: Woecleaver
46077.text: After your hero attacks, Recruit a minion.
46077.flavor: Turn that frown into TWO frowns!

1022.name: Argent Protector
1022.flavor: "I'm not saying you can dodge fireballs.  I'm saying with this shield, you won't have to."

1023.name: Shield Block
1023.flavor: Shields were invented because Face Block is USELESS.

1026.text: Your minions can't be reduced below 1 Health this turn. Draw a card.
1026.name: Commanding Shout
1026.flavor: "Shout! Shout! Let it all out!" - Advice to warriors-in-training

1029.name: Violet Teacher
1029.text: Whenever you cast a spell, summon a 1/1 Violet Apprentice.
1029.flavor: If you don't pay attention, you may be turned into a pig.  And then you get your name on the board.

46087.name: Fungal Enchanter
46087.text: Battlecry: Restore 2 Health to all friendly characters.

46088.name: Rummaging Kobold
46088.text: Battlecry: Return one of your destroyed weapons to your hand.
46088.flavor: "Broken longsword is brand new shortsword." - Kobold Proverb

1035.name: Ancient of War
1035.flavor: Young Night Elves love to play "Who can get the Ancient of War to Uproot?"  You lose if you get crushed to death.

1037.name: Twilight Drake
1037.text: Battlecry: Gain +1 Health for each card in your hand.
1037.flavor: Twilight drakes feed on Mystical Energy.  And Tacos.

46101.name: Keening Banshee
46101.text: Whenever you play a card, remove the top 3 cards of your deck.
46101.flavor: "What are your strengths?" the interviewer asked. "Well," she replied, "I'm really good at keening."

46102.name: Corpsetaker
46102.text: [x]Battlecry: Gain Taunt if your deck has a Taunt minion. Repeat for Divine Shield, Lifesteal, Windfury.
46102.flavor: Her extensive collection of corpses includes one of nearly every type.  She'd love for you to join it.

46103.name: Tainted Zealot
46103.flavor: The love she shares seems to go nowhere. Now she's lost her Light, tosses and turns, she can't sleep at night...

42009.text: Discover a minion that costs (8) or more. Summon it.
42009.name: Free From Amber

1050.name: Claw
1050.text: Give your hero +2 Attack this turn. Gain 2 Armor.
1050.flavor: The claw decides who will stay and who will go.

46107.name: Twig of the World Tree
46107.flavor: For druids who want to branch out.

46118.name: Shrieking Shroom
46118.text:
At the end of your turn, summon a random
1-Cost minion.
46118.flavor: Auditioning for the next Fungal Idol.

1063.name: Murloc Warleader
1063.flavor: Do Murlocs ever get tired of making the same old sound?  Nope!  Mrglglrglglglglglglgl!

1064.text: Destroy your weapon and deal its damage to all enemy minions.
1064.name: Blade Flurry
1064.flavor: "Look, it's not just about waving daggers around really fast.  It's a lot more complicated than that." - Shan, Rogue Trainer

1068.name: Guardian of Kings
1068.flavor: Holy beings from the beyond are so cliché!

41138.name: Sated Threshadon
41138.flavor: Bet you can't eat just one murloc!

1073.name: Knife Juggler
1073.text:
[x]After you summon a
minion, deal 1 damage
to a random enemy.
1073.flavor: Ambitious Knife Jugglers sometimes graduate to Bomb Jugglers.    They never last long enough to make it onto a card though.

1074.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion. If it survives, draw a card.
1074.name: Slam
1074.flavor: "Dun da dun, dun da dun": if you've heard an ogre sing this, it's too late.

41139.name: Hydrologist
41139.flavor: Murloc hydrologists are pretty rare.  Most murloc undergrads pick computer science.

1080.name: Archmage Antonidas
1080.text: Whenever you cast a spell, add a 'Fireball' spell to your hand.
1080.flavor: Antonidas was the Grand Magus of the Kirin Tor, and Jaina's mentor.  This was a big step up from being Grand Magus of Jelly Donuts.

1084.name: Mirror Image
1084.flavor: Oh hey it's Mirror Image! !egamI rorriM s'ti yeh hO

42046.name: Lyra the Sunshard
42046.text: Whenever you cast a spell, add a random Priest spell to your hand.
42046.flavor: Arise, fair sun, and kill my envious foes. They don't have a legendary as beautiful as you.

1087.name: Pyroblast
1087.flavor: Take the time for an evil laugh after you draw this card.

1090.name: Flame Imp
1090.flavor: Imps like being on fire.  They just do.

1091.text: Secret: When an enemy attacks your hero, instead it attacks another random character.
1091.name: Misdirection
1091.flavor: Sometimes it's as simple as putting on a fake mustache and pointing at someone else.

1092.name: Mortal Coil
1092.text: Deal $1 damage to a minion. If that kills it, draw a card.
1092.flavor: If your spells look like horrifying skulls, let's be honest, you should get to draw some cards.

1093.name: Deadly Shot
1093.flavor: Accuracy is not a highly valued trait among the mok'nathal.  Deadliness is near the top, though.

1098.name: Emperor Cobra
1098.flavor: The Sholazar Basin is home to a lot of really horrible things. If you're going to visit, wear bug spray.  And plate armor.

1099.name: Mind Vision
1099.text: Put a copy of a random card in your opponent's hand into your hand.
1099.flavor: I see what you did there.

1100.text: Destroy a minion. Restore #3 Health to your hero.
1100.name: Siphon Soul
1100.flavor: You probably should avoid siphoning your own soul.  You might create some kind of weird infinite loop.

1109.name: Injured Blademaster
1109.flavor: He claims it is an old war wound, but we think he just cut himself shaving.

43193.text: Copy the lowest Cost minion in your hand.
43193.name: Simulacrum
43193.flavor: It's like déjà vu, times two.

1117.name: SI:7 Agent
1117.flavor: The agents of SI:7 are responsible for Stormwind's covert activities.  Their duties include espionage, assassination, and throwing surprise birthday parties for the royal family.

1122.name: Venture Co. Mercenary
1122.flavor: No Job is too big.  No fee is too big.

1124.name: Wild Growth
1124.flavor: Grow your own mana crystals with this Mana Crystal Growth Kit, only 39.99!

1133.name: Patient Assassin
1133.flavor: He’s not really that patient. It just takes a while for someone to walk by that he can actually reach.

1135.name: Lorewalker Cho
1135.text: Whenever a player casts a spell, put a copy into the other player’s hand.
1135.flavor: Lorewalker Cho archives and shares tales from the land of Pandaria, but his favorite story is the one where Joey and Phoebe go on a road trip.

1140.name: Booty Bay Bodyguard
1140.flavor: You can hire him... until someone offers him enough gold to turn on you.

1142.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion. If it’s a friendly Demon, give it +2/+2 instead.
1142.name: Demonfire
1142.flavor: Demonfire is like regular fire except for IT NEVER STOPS BURNING HELLLPPP

1144.name: King Krush
1144.flavor: The best defense against King Krush is to have someone you don’t like standing in front of you.

41151.text:
Deal $2 damage.
Add a 1/2 Elemental to your hand.
41151.name: Flame Geyser

41152.name: Air Elemental
41152.text: Can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.

1155.name: Raging Worgen
1155.flavor: If he's raging now, just wait until he gets nerfed.

1158.text: The next spell you cast this turn costs (3) less.
1158.name: Preparation

41252.name: Tortollan Forager
41252.text: Battlecry: Add a random minion with 5 or more Attack to your hand.
41252.flavor: In the Tortollan tongue, Un’goro is known as the “Land of the Lost and Found.”

1167.name: Aldor Peacekeeper
1167.text: Battlecry: Change an enemy minion's Attack to 1.
1167.flavor: The Aldor hate two things: the Scryers and smooth jazz.

1171.name: Bloodlust
1171.text: Give your minions +3 Attack this turn.

1174.text: Deal $8 damage randomly split among all enemies.
1174.name: Avenging Wrath
1174.flavor: Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham!

1186.name: Ysera
1186.text: At the end of your turn, add a Dream Card to your hand.
1186.flavor: Ysera rules the Emerald Dream.  Which is some kind of green-mirror-version of the real world, or something?

1189.name: Silence
1189.flavor: Reserved for enemy spellcasters, evil liches from beyond the grave, and karaoke nights at the Grim Guzzler.

42525.text: Secret: When one of your minions is attacked, summon a 2/3 Poisonous Cobra.
42525.name: Venomstrike Trap

46258.name: Benevolent Djinn
46258.text: At the end of your turn, restore 3 Health to your hero.
46258.flavor: Wish #1: funnel cakes. Wish #2: funnel cakes. Wish #3: FUNNEL CAKES.

46263.name: Val'anyr
46263.text: Deathrattle: Give a minion in your hand +4/+2. When it dies, reequip this.
46263.flavor: Recently unearthed in one of the deepest kobold caves. Traded for a large candle.

1221.name: Void Terror
1221.text: [x]Battlecry: Destroy both adjacent minions and gain their Attack and Health.
1221.flavor: If you put this into your deck, you WILL lose the trust of your other minions.

46286.text: Destroy all minions. Discard your hand.
