46286.name: Cataclysm
46286.flavor: RUN FROM SKY CANDLES! THEY BURN! RUN!

45945.name: Greedy Sprite
45945.flavor: Sparkliest of the seven deadly sprites.

46296.collectionText: Destroy 1 random enemy minion. (Play 3 Deathrattle cards to upgrade.)
46296.name: Lesser Onyx Spellstone
46296.text: Destroy 1 random enemy minion. @(Play 3 Deathrattle cards to upgrade.)
46296.flavor:
The trolls of old embraced the gift
A jewel of black for daggers swift
No party lasts who finds the stone
Those wielding it soon stand alone.

1241.name: Starving Buzzard
1241.text: Whenever you summon a Beast, draw a card.
1241.flavor: If you feed him, he loses his whole identity.

1243.text: For each enemy minion, summon a 1/1 Hound with Charge.
1243.name: Unleash the Hounds
1243.flavor: You must read the name of this card out loud each time you play it.

46303.text:
Transform a friendly minion into
one that costs (1) more. Repeatable this turn.
46303.name: Unstable Evolution

46305.name: The Runespear
46305.text: After your hero attacks, Discover a spell and cast it with random targets.
46305.flavor: When asked what the runes do, the tauren smith smiled: "A little of this, a little of that..."

46307.collectionText: Resurrect 2 different friendly minions. (Cast 4 spells to upgrade.)
46307.text: Resurrect 2 different friendly minions. @(Cast 4 spells to upgrade.)
46307.name: Lesser Diamond Spellstone
46307.flavor:
A diamond, white, this stone the eighth
A precious jewel for those of faith
A whispered prayer restores the lost
But none among them know the cost.

38913.name: A Light in the Darkness
38913.flavor: Wait, how can you have a light in the dark?  If you turn on a light while it’s dark, doesn’t that mean it’s no longer dark?

35025.howToEarn: Unlocked in the Hall of Explorers, in the League of Explorers adventure.
35025.name: Cursed Blade
35025.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in the Hall of Explorers, in the League of Explorers adventure.
35025.text: Double all damage dealt to your hero.
35025.flavor: The Curse is that you have to listen to "MMMBop" on repeat.

1261.name: Savannah Highmane
1261.flavor: In the jungle, the mighty jungle, the lion gets slowly consumed by hyenas.

41173.name: Crystalline Oracle
41173.text: [x]Deathrattle: Copy a card from your opponent's deck  and add it to your hand.
41173.flavor: Being made of light has its disadvantages, but at least it's always looking on the bright side.

1281.name: Scavenging Hyena
1281.text: Whenever a friendly Beast dies, gain +2/+1.
1281.flavor: Hyenas prefer the bones of kodos or windserpents, but they'll eat pretty much anything.  Even Brussels sprouts.

41864.text: Give a minion +2/+6 and Taunt. When it dies, summon a Stegodon.
41864.name: Spikeridged Steed

46390.name: Kathrena Winterwisp
46390.flavor: She’s not one of those treehugger elves – but she does like the occasional cuddle.

41866.name: Primalfin Champion
41866.text: Deathrattle: Return any spells you cast on this minion to your hand.
41866.flavor: Sure, he'll return your stuff.  OVER HIS DEAD BODY!

41856.name: Lakkari Sacrifice
41856.flavor: They asked, “And what must we give in return?” Gul’dan lowered his hood and answered: “Six… cards…”

46403.name: Zola the Gorgon
46403.text: Battlecry: Choose a friendly minion. Add a Golden copy of it to your hand.
46403.flavor: Her name seems a bit cheesy.

42320.name: Exploding Bloatbat
42320.text: Deathrattle: Deal 2 damage to all enemy minions.
42320.flavor: We've all been there after a night of one-too-many funnel cakes.

1361.name: Divine Spirit
1361.flavor: Double the trouble. Double the fun!

38227.name: Vilefin Inquisitor
38227.text: Battlecry: Your Hero Power becomes 'Summon a 1/1 Murloc.'

1364.name: Temple Enforcer
1364.flavor: He also moonlights Thursday nights as a bouncer at the Pig and Whistle Tavern.

2958.howToEarn: Unlocked in the Temple of Orsis, in the League of Explorers adventure.
2958.name: Summoning Stone
2958.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in the Temple of Orsis, in the League of Explorers adventure.
2958.text: Whenever you cast a spell, summon a random minion of the same Cost.
2958.flavor: Sometimes it feels like it's always the same slackers that are waiting for a summon.

1366.text: Silence all enemy minions. Draw a card.
1366.name: Mass Dispel
1366.flavor: It dispels buffs, powers, hopes, and dreams.

1367.name: Shadow Word: Pain
1367.text: Destroy a minion with 3 or less Attack.
1367.flavor: A step up from a spell cast by many beginning acolytes: "Shadow Word: Annoy".

1368.text: Your Hero Power becomes 'Deal 2 damage'. If already in Shadowform: 3 damage.
1368.name: Shadowform
1368.flavor: If a bright light shines on a priest in Shadowform… do they cast a shadow?

1369.name: River Crocolisk
1369.flavor: Edward "Lefty" Smith tried to make luggage out of a river crocolisk once.

1370.name: Oasis Snapjaw
1370.flavor: His dreams of flying and breathing fire like his idol will never be realized.

1371.name: Stampeding Kodo
1371.text: Battlecry: Destroy a random enemy minion with 2 or less Attack.
1371.flavor: This Kodo is so big that he can stampede by himself.

1372.name: Molten Giant
1372.text: Costs (1) less for each damage your hero has taken.
1372.flavor: He gets terrible heartburn.  BECAUSE HE IS FULL OF LAVA.

1373.text: Choose a minion. Whenever it attacks, draw a card.
1373.name: Blessing of Wisdom
1373.flavor: Apparently with wisdom comes the knowledge that you should probably be attacking every turn.

46432.name: Murmuring Elemental
46432.text: Battlecry: Your next Battlecry this turn triggers twice.

41872.text: The next spell you cast this turn costs Health instead of Mana.
41872.name: Bloodbloom
41872.flavor: Help save mana.  Donate blood today!

42338.name: Snowflipper Penguin
42338.flavor: On land, a group of penguins is called a "waddle."

41257.name: Thunder Lizard
41257.text: Battlecry: If you played an Elemental last turn, Adapt.

46440.name: Windshear Stormcaller
46440.text: Battlecry: If you control all 4 basic Totems, summon Al'Akir the Windlord.
46440.flavor: Don't ever doubt Al'Akir's love for basic totems.

46442.name: Geosculptor Yip
46442.text: At the end of your turn, summon a random minion with Cost equal to your Armor (up to 10).
46442.flavor: Once crafted a gauntlet out of earwax and pure ambition.

41191.name: Ravenous Pterrordax
41191.text: Battlecry: Destroy a friendly minion to Adapt twice.
41191.flavor: For better results, feed your pterrordax low-fat, high-fiber minions.

46445.name: Seeping Oozeling
46445.text: Battlecry: Gain the Deathrattle of a random minion in your deck.
46445.flavor: Uh, you might want to get that looked at.

46449.name: Master Oakheart
46449.flavor: His adventuring party consists of Goldshire Footman, Frostwolf Grunt and Hadronox.

46450.text: Destroy your opponent's left and right-most minions.
46450.name: Crushing Walls

915.name: Ancient Mage
915.flavor: Sometimes he forgets and just wanders into someone else's game.

46454.name: The Darkness
46454.text: [x]Starts dormant. Battlecry: Shuffle 3 Candles into the enemy deck. When drawn, this awakens.
46454.flavor: I would rather light a single candle than curse the darkness. But I'm willing to do both.

38265.name: Eternal Sentinel
38265.flavor: Just try to avoid eye contact.

38918.text: Deal $1 damage to a minion. If it survives, summon a 2/2 Slime.
38918.name: Blood To Ichor
38918.flavor: For his next trick, he turns the ichor back to blood and stuffs it back in you.

38267.name: Thing from Below
38267.text: [x]Taunt Costs (1) less for each Totem you've summoned this game.
38267.flavor: Just can't resist the opportunity to hang around with a bunch of totems.

46460.name: Twilight Acolyte
46460.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, swap this minion's Attack with another minion's.
46460.flavor: The dragons mostly keep him around as a snack.

46461.name: Void Ripper
46461.text: Battlecry: Swap the Attack and Health of all other minions.
46461.flavor: You had to put the portable hole inside the bag of holding, didn't you?!

42560.text: Draw a card. If it has Deathrattle, cast this again.
42560.name: Roll the Bones

38279.name: Tentacles for Arms
38279.flavor: That's right. Garrosh just slapped you to death with a tentacle.

45975.name: Spectral Pillager
45975.text: [x]Combo: Deal damage equal to the number of other cards you've played this turn.
45975.flavor: It turns out you CAN take it with you.

42391.text: Choose a friendly minion. Destroy it and a random enemy minion.
42391.name: Unwilling Sacrifice
42391.flavor: Stand right... there. Perfect, perfect! Now don't move.

42392.name: Death Revenant
42392.flavor: How's everyone doing? Hurt? Bleeding? Wounded? ... Excellent.

42394.name: Deathspeaker
42394.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion Immune this turn.
42394.flavor: It helps to speak really, really loud.

42395.name: Saronite Chain Gang
42395.text: Taunt Battlecry: Summon a copy of this minion.

42398.name: Wretched Tiller
42398.text: Whenever this minion attacks, deal 2 damage to the enemy hero.
42398.flavor: If you ever tried to plow permafrost, you’d be wretched, too.

46495.name: Gilded Gargoyle
46495.text: Deathrattle: Add a Coin to your hand.
46495.flavor: You hear a coin rattling inside the slotted gargoyle...What could it mean?

38304.name: Silithid Swarmer
38304.text: Can only attack if your hero attacked this turn.
38304.flavor: If your hero doesn't attack, it's just "Silithid Loner".

46499.name: Dragoncaller Alanna
46499.text: Battlecry: Summon a 5/5 Dragon for each spell you cast this game that costs (5) or more.
46499.flavor: Her secret is using a gentle voice and carrying a baggie of hotdogs.

38312.name: Y'Shaarj, Rage Unbound
38312.text: At the end of your turn, put a minion from your deck into the battlefield.
38312.flavor: When he's working out, he binds all that rage back into a ponytail.

38318.name: Fandral Staghelm
38318.text: Your Choose One cards and powers have both effects combined.
38318.flavor: Always manages to mention "Back when I was creating the World Tree…" in EVERY conversation. Sheesh! Enough already.

42422.name: Rattling Rascal
42422.text: [x]Battlecry: Summon a 5/5 Skeleton. Deathrattle: Summon one for your opponent.

38329.text: Give your minions "Deathrattle: Add a random Beast to your hand."
38329.name: Infest
38329.flavor: The best part is the look on their face when you jump out of the cake! Err… corpse.

38334.text: Choose One - Give your hero +4 Attack this turn; or Gain 8 Armor.
38334.name: Feral Rage
38334.flavor: Let's be honest. One option is a lot ragier than the other.

38337.text:
Give a minion +2/+2.
If it's a Beast, draw
a card.
38337.name: Mark of Y'Shaarj
38337.flavor: Y'Shaarj had three sons: Mark, Theodore, and Chris.

38340.name: Forbidden Ancient
38340.text: Battlecry: Spend all your Mana. Gain +1/+1 for each mana spent.
38340.flavor: This Ancient was banned from the local tavern after tucking a 'Dr. Boom' up its sleeve.

42439.name: Bone Drake
42439.text: Deathrattle: Add a random Dragon to your hand.
42439.flavor: The bone drake brings all the dragons to the yard. He would teach you, but you have no cards.

42440.name: Sunborne Val'kyr
42440.flavor: Bring valor to Odyn's halls, Champion!

42442.name: Cobalt Scalebane
42442.text: At the end of your turn, give another random friendly minion +3 Attack.
42442.flavor: You get a sword! And you get a sword! Everybody gets a sword!

42445.name: Night Howler
42445.text:
Whenever this minion takes
damage, gain +2 Attack.
42445.flavor: Honestly, he howls during the day, too.

42446.name: Venomancer
42446.flavor: Eight times the death of regular-mancers.

46544.name: Temporus
46544.text: Battlecry: Your opponent takes two turns. Then you take two turns.
46544.flavor: Follows adventurers, seeking the ultimate time magic: the ability to reload.

39160.howToEarn: Unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.
39160.name: Cat Trick
39160.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.
39160.text: Secret: After your opponent casts a spell, summon a 4/2 Panther with Stealth.
39160.flavor: "I know some new tricks, a lot of good tricks. I will show them to you. Medivh will not mind at all if I do."

41890.name: Direhorn Hatchling
41890.text: Taunt Deathrattle: Shuffle a 6/9 Direhorn with Taunt into your deck.
41890.flavor: His mom could beat up your mom.

46551.name: Spiteful Summoner
46551.text: [x]Battlecry: Reveal a spell from your deck. Summon a random minion with the same Cost.
46551.flavor: Sometimes she'll summon a Doomsayer. Out of spite.

45988.howToEarn: Unlocked by opening a Kobolds & Catacombs pack.
45988.name: Marin the Fox
45988.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked with the BlizzCon 2017 virtual ticket.
45988.text: Battlecry: Summon a 0/8 Treasure Chest for your opponent. (Break it for awesome loot!)
45988.flavor: My name is Marin the Fox. You took my treasure. Prepare to die.

46557.name: Dragonhatcher
46557.text: At the end of your turn, Recruit a Dragon.
46557.flavor: Which came first?  The dragon or the dragonhatcher?

42462.name: Arrogant Crusader
42462.text: Deathrattle: If it's your opponent's turn, summon a 2/2 Ghoul.
42462.flavor: To be honest, he was kind of a jerk even BEFORE he was bitten by that ghoul.

42467.name: Righteous Protector
42467.flavor: Original name was Tubular Protector, but this seems more bodacious.

42469.text: Set a minion's Attack and Health to 3.
42469.name: Dark Conviction
42469.flavor: In his court, Uther is judge, jury, AND executioner…

42471.text: Deal $1 damage to all minions. If any die, cast this again.
42471.name: Defile
42471.flavor: This spell was originally designed to help warlocks clean up their hard drives.

38377.name: On the Hunt
38377.flavor: The mastiff giggles if you don't hit any ducks.

41213.name: Obsidian Shard
41213.text:
[x]Costs (1) less for each
card you've played from
another class.
41213.flavor: You know you’re a Rogue when a sharp rock makes you go “Ooh!  Dagger!”

38922.name: Herald Volazj
38922.text: Battlecry: Summon a 1/1 copy of each of your other minions.
38922.flavor: His whole job is yelling "Yogg-Saron comin'!"

38391.name: Bladed Cultist
38391.flavor: He has a poor understanding of the law of diminishing returns.

38393.name: Journey Below
38393.flavor: Don't stop believing there's something below.

38395.text: Draw a card. Add 2 extra copies of it to your hand.
38395.name: Thistle Tea
38395.flavor: Aren't Thistles prickly?  Why would you drink them? I don't get Rogues.

41241.name: Tol'vir Stoneshaper
41241.text: [x]Battlecry: If you played an Elemental last turn, gain  Taunt and Divine Shield.
41241.flavor: He spends a lot of time keeping himself in stoneshape.

46589.name: King Togwaggle
46589.text: [x]Battlecry: Swap decks with your opponent. Give them a Ransom spell to swap back.
46589.flavor: Management of the Kobold Empire requires a careful balance between a lack of social services and fiscal irresponsibility.

38403.flavor: It's basically your own fault if you go around drinking weird green potions handed out by creepy mantid dudes.
38403.name: Xaril, Poisoned Mind
38403.text: Battlecry and Deathrattle: Add a random Toxin card to your hand.

38409.name: Twilight Flamecaller
38409.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to all enemy minions.
38409.flavor: Make sure you summon a Twilight Marshmallowcaller too! Mmmm Mmm Mmm!!

38412.name: Demented Frostcaller
38412.text: After you cast a spell, Freeze a random enemy.
38412.flavor: He prefers that you refer to him by his nickname: 'Frostwaker.'

38413.text: Spend all your Mana. Deal that much damage to a minion.
38413.name: Forbidden Flame
38413.flavor: WARNING: This flame is not to be used unless you are a licensed acolyte of the Old Gods.

38414.name: Servant of Yogg-Saron
38414.text: Battlecry: Cast a random spell that costs (5) or less (targets chosen randomly).
38414.flavor: Yogg-Saron always likes to complain about how he has too many servants and there are too many mouths to feed.

38418.text: Add 3 random Mage spells to your hand.
38418.name: Cabalist's Tome
38418.flavor: What's in there? I bet it's cookie recipes!

38426.name: Power Word: Tentacles
38426.flavor: Because you're wrapped in a protective layer of… tentacles?

38429.name: Twilight Darkmender
38429.text: Battlecry: If your C'Thun has at least 10 Attack, restore 10 Health to your hero.
38429.flavor: First she separates them from the lights, washes them in cold water, and hang-dries.

38433.text: Destroy all minions with 2 or less Attack.
38433.name: Shadow Word: Horror
38433.flavor: It's more succinct than "Shadow Word: Suck Into Vortex."

38434.text: Spend all your Mana. Summon a random minion that costs that much.
38434.name: Forbidden Shaping
38434.flavor: But the minion arrives covered in goo.

38436.name: Darkspeaker
38436.text: Battlecry: Swap stats with a friendly minion.
38436.flavor: People often think that Darkspeaker is the arch nemesis of Lightspeaker, but that title actually belongs to Heavyspeaker.

38439.text: This turn, your healing effects deal damage instead.
38439.name: Embrace the Shadow
38439.flavor: For when your Auchenai Soulpriests call in sick.

38447.name: Darkshire Librarian
38447.text: Battlecry: Discard a random card. Deathrattle: Draw a card.
38447.flavor: Do NOT be late with your overdue fines.

38452.name: Darkshire Councilman
38452.text:
[x]After you summon a minion,
 gain +1 Attack.

38454.text: Spend all your Mana. Summon that many 1/1 Tentacles.
38454.name: Forbidden Ritual
38454.flavor: Actually, C'Thun gives his full support for this ritual.

13879.howToEarn: Unlocked in The Ruined City, in the League of Explorers adventure.
13879.name: Murloc Tinyfin
13879.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in The Ruined City, in the League of Explorers adventure.
13879.flavor: High mortality rate, from often being hugged to death.

38456.text: Deal $9 damage randomly split among ALL characters.
38456.name: Spreading Madness
38456.flavor: Most citizens of Darkshire wear those surgical masks to prevent spreading Madness to tourists.

38461.text: Replace your Hero Power and Warlock cards with another class's. The cards cost (1) less.
38461.name: Renounce Darkness

38464.name: Cho'gall
38464.text: Battlecry: The next spell you cast this turn costs Health instead of Mana.
38464.flavor: Even after all this time, Gul'dan still makes Cho'gall go get donuts and coffee.

42563.name: Professor Putricide
42563.text: After you play a Secret, put a random Hunter Secret into the battlefield.
42563.flavor: Among his more notable inventions: A tentacle-groomer, a plague that would wipe out all life on Azeroth, and a fidget spinner.

38468.name: Mukla, Tyrant of the Vale
38468.flavor: Pro tip: DO NOT BOGART THE BANANAS.

42565.text: Choose a friendly minion and give it to your opponent.
42565.name: Treachery
42565.flavor: Never look a gift minion in the mouth.

42566.text: Copy 3 cards in your opponent's deck and add them to your hand.
42566.name: Devour Mind
42566.flavor: A mind is a terrible thing to waste. Seconds, anyone?

38475.name: Shifter Zerus
38475.text: Each turn this is in your hand, transform it into a random minion.
38475.flavor: It's like being able to play with THREE angry chickens!

42574.name: Shadow Ascendant
42574.text:
[x]At the end of your turn,
give another random
friendly minion +1/+1.
42574.flavor: When you're at the bottom, there's nowhere to ascend, but up.

40971.name: Verdant Longneck
40971.flavor: Always sticking its neck into other people’s business.

41099.text: [x]Quest: Summon 5 minions with 5 or more Attack. Reward: Barnabus.
41099.name: Jungle Giants
41099.flavor: Forming the Golakka Crater was the end of Barnabus' disastrous career as a dancer.

38488.name: Twin Emperor Vek'lor
38488.text: [x]Taunt Battlecry: If your C'Thun has at least 10 Attack, summon another Emperor.
38488.flavor: Do they make decisions based on age? "I'm two minutes older therefore we burn this village."

2509.name: Recruiter
2509.text: Inspire: Add a 2/2 Squire to your hand.
2509.flavor: Join the Argent Crusade!  We have attractive tabards and you get to carry really nice swords!

38496.name: N'Zoth, the Corruptor
38496.text: Battlecry: Summon your Deathrattle minions that died this game.
38496.flavor: Has not been able to get "Under the Sea" out of his head for like FIVE THOUSAND YEARS.

45328.name: Wicked Skeleton
45328.text: Battlecry: Gain +1/+1 for each minion that died this turn.
45328.flavor: It's minions like these that give normal, law-abiding skeletons a bad rap.

1634.name: Young Priestess
1634.text: At the end of your turn, give another random friendly minion +1 Health.
1634.flavor: She can't wait to learn Power Word: Fortitude Rank 2.

42596.name: Acolyte of Agony
42596.flavor: It takes many years of practiced study in order to fully master agony.

42597.text: Discover a friendly minion that died this game. Summon it.
42597.name: Eternal Servitude
42597.flavor: What do you mean I don't get overtime pay for this?!

42598.name: Obsidian Statue
42598.text: [x]Taunt, Lifesteal Deathrattle: Destroy a random enemy minion.
42598.flavor: The original artist spent many hours with a fine chisel perfecting the facial expression for maximum tauntiness.

38505.name: Yogg-Saron, Hope's End
38505.text: Battlecry: Cast a random spell for each spell you've cast this game (targets chosen randomly).
38505.flavor: I spell your doom... Y-O-U-R D-O-O-M!

1650.name: Northshire Cleric
1650.text: Whenever a minion is healed, draw a card.
1650.flavor: They help the downtrodden and distressed.  Also they sell cookies.

1651.name: Earthen Ring Farseer
1651.flavor: He can see really far, and he doesn't use a telescope like those filthy pirates.

1653.name: Magma Rager
1653.flavor: He likes to think he is powerful, but pretty much anyone can solo Molten Core now.

1655.name: Lightwarden
1655.text: Whenever a character is healed, gain +2 Attack.
1655.flavor: She’s smaller than her sisters Mediumwarden and Heavywarden.

1656.name: The Black Knight
1656.flavor: He was sent by the Lich King to disrupt the Argent Tournament.   We can pretty much mark that a failure.

38521.name: Faceless Behemoth
38521.flavor: Rejected names: Forty-Foot Faceless, Big ol' No-face, Huge Creature Sans Face, Teddy.

1658.name: Alarm-o-Bot
1658.text:
[x]At the start of your turn,
swap this minion with a
   random one in your hand.

1659.name: Acolyte of Pain
1659.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, draw a card.
1659.flavor: He trained when he was younger to be an acolyte of joy, but things didn’t work out like he thought they would.

1662.name: Eaglehorn Bow
1662.text: [x]Whenever a friendly Secret is revealed, gain +1 Durability.
1662.flavor: First Lesson: Put the pointy end in the other guy.

38528.name: Corrupted Healbot
38528.text: Deathrattle: Restore 8 Health to the enemy hero.
38528.flavor: Not so much "corrupted" as "has terrible aim".

38530.name: Ravaging Ghoul
38530.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to all other minions.
38530.flavor: But goes by "Ravishing Ghoul" when he hits the club.

38532.name: Tentacle of N'Zoth
38532.flavor: Because EVERYDAY is the Day of the Tentacle of N'zoth.

38533.name: Grotesque Dragonhawk
38533.flavor: They say that "grotesque is in the eye of the beholder," but that's just because they've never seen a Grotesque Dragonhawk. Yikes!

38534.name: Bog Creeper
38534.flavor: He's tried other things, but bog sidling, bog ambling, and bog trundling just aren't as effective as bog creeping.

42633.name: Archbishop Benedictus
42633.text: Battlecry: Shuffle a copy of your opponent's deck into your deck.

38538.name: Bilefin Tidehunter
38538.flavor: Bile actually makes for surprisingly sturdy fins.

38541.name: Zealous Initiate
38541.flavor: Ok, Initiate. You need to settle down and do your job. In this case, that means die so someone else can get a minor buff.

38545.name: Corrupted Seer
38545.text: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage to all non-Murloc minions.
38545.flavor: For seers, it's very handy to have your crystal ball hanging right in front of your face.

42642.name: Howlfiend
42642.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, discard a random card.
42642.flavor: The problem is that he carries those cards in his mouth.

38547.name: Disciple of C'Thun
38547.text: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage. Give your C'Thun +2/+2 (wherever it is).
38547.flavor: C’Thun’s recruiting pitch involves cookies, which is why it’s the most popular Old God.

1686.name: Boulderfist Ogre
1686.flavor: "ME HAVE GOOD STATS FOR THE COST"

1687.name: Core Hound
1687.flavor: You don’t tame a Core Hound. You just train it to eat someone else before it eats you.

42648.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion. If it survives, give it Poisonous.
42648.name: Toxic Arrow
42648.flavor: What doesn't kill you makes you toxic.

42649.name: Webweave
42649.flavor: O, what a tangled web we weave, hoping spiders dodge the cleave.

42651.name: Druid of the Swarm
42651.text: Choose One - Transform into a 1/2 with Poisonous; or a 1/5 with Taunt.
42651.flavor: The Druid awoke from troubling dreams to find herself transformed into a giant spider.

42656.text: Summon a 1/5 Scarab with Taunt. If your opponent has more minions, cast this again.
42656.name: Spreading Plague
42656.flavor: In the past, plagues were spread by mice or fleas. These days they're spread by elves.

42658.name: Drain Soul
42658.flavor: Cleans even the toughest clogs with just a flick of the wrist!

42663.name: Deadscale Knight
42663.flavor: His favorite spell is Chum Explosion.

42665.name: Leeching Poison
42665.flavor: No actual leeches were harmed in the creation of this card.

42670.name: Gnomeferatu
42670.text: Battlecry: Remove the top card of your opponent's deck.

42671.name: Val'kyr Soulclaimer
42671.text:
[x]After this minion
survives damage,
summon a 2/2 Ghoul.
42671.flavor: My Ghoul friend is back and you're gonna be in trouble.

38578.text: Deal $5 damage to an undamaged character.
38578.name: Shadow Strike
38578.flavor: It's like a backstab, only from the front. And with two more stabs.

42676.name: Cryostasis
42676.flavor: We'll thaw you out when we find a cure!

45342.name: Prince Valanar
45342.text: Battlecry: If your deck has no 4-Cost cards, gain Lifesteal and Taunt.
45342.flavor: Three Princes stand before you. This one devours one after another.

42678.name: Brrrloc
42678.flavor: He may be frozen fish, but he fights fresh!

41929.name: Primordial Drake
41929.text: [x]Taunt Battlecry: Deal 2 damage to all other minions.
41929.flavor: Before he became a rap artist.

38584.name: Fiery Bat
38584.text: Deathrattle: Deal 1 damage to a random enemy.

1721.name: Sylvanas Windrunner
1721.text: Deathrattle: Take control of a random enemy minion.
1721.flavor: Sylvanas was turned into the Banshee Queen by Arthas, but he probably should have just killed her because it just pissed her off.

41247.name: Vicious Fledgling
41247.text: After this minion attacks a hero, Adapt.
41247.flavor: A youngster who is truly hungry for self-improvement.

38517.name: Nerubian Prophet
38517.text:
At the start of your turn, reduce this card's
Cost by (1).

46027.name: Gemstudded Golem
46027.text: Taunt Can only attack if you have 5 or more Armor.

41249.name: Eggnapper
41249.flavor: Often misunderstood, it's just that he likes to use the eggs as pillows.

1737.name: Ethereal Arcanist
1737.text: If you control a Secret at the end of your turn, gain +2/+2.
1737.flavor: The ethereals are wrapped in cloth to give form to their non-corporeal bodies. Also because it's nice and soft.

42698.name: Mountainfire Armor
42698.text: Deathrattle: If it's your opponent's turn, gain 6 Armor.
42698.flavor: Excuse me. Your mountain is on fire.

42615.name: Fatespinner
42615.text: Choose a Deathrattle (Secretly) - Deal 3 damage to all minions; or Give them +2/+2.
42615.flavor: Her clothing? Pure silk, of course.

42700.name: Blood Razor
42700.text: Battlecry and Deathrattle: Deal 1 damage to all minions.
42700.flavor: For the close shave that you've always wanted. Caution: Very sharp.

42707.name: Stitched Tracker
42707.text: Battlecry: Discover a copy of a minion in your deck.
42707.flavor: He's just exercising his right to bear arms.

45340.name: Prince Keleseth
45340.text: Battlecry: If your deck has no 2-Cost cards, give all minions in your deck +1/+1.
45340.flavor: Three Princes stand before you. This one wants to buff his brothers.

42711.name: Bearshark
42711.text: Can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.

42712.name: Bone Baron
42712.text: Deathrattle: Add two 1/1 Skeletons to your hand.

1753.howToEarn: Unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1753.name: Zombie Chow
1753.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1753.text: Deathrattle: Restore 5 Health to the enemy hero.

1754.flavor: He's looking for a drummer.  The current candidates are: Novice Engineer, Sen'jin Shieldmasta', and Ragnaros the Firelord.
1754.name: Elite Tauren Chieftain
1754.text: Battlecry: Give both players the power to ROCK! (with a Power Chord card)

41935.name: Elise the Trailblazer
41935.text: Battlecry: Shuffle a sealed Un'Goro pack into your deck.
41935.flavor: Reno taught her that blazing her own trail is a lot more fun than following someone else's map.

42716.name: Ice Walker
42716.text: Your Hero Power also Freezes the target.
42716.flavor: Ice Walker you say? He doesn't have feet!

38621.name: Klaxxi Amber-Weaver
38621.text: Battlecry: If your C'Thun has at least 10 Attack, gain +5 Health.
38621.flavor: Amberweaving is a specialty course at the local trade school.

42718.name: Ghastly Conjurer
42718.text: Battlecry: Add a 'Mirror Image' spell to your hand.
42718.flavor: Wearing purple after the holidays? GHASTLY!

46032.name: Grand Archivist
46032.text: At the end of your turn, cast a spell from your deck (targets chosen randomly).

42735.name: Light's Sorrow
42735.text: After a friendly minion loses Divine Shield, gain +1 Attack.

45341.name: Prince Taldaram
45341.text: Battlecry: If your deck has no 3-Cost cards, transform into a 3/3 copy of a minion.
45341.flavor: Three Princes stand before you. This one wants to copy others.

38526.name: Psych-o-Tron
38526.flavor: "Annoyinger-o-Tron" was just too unwieldy. And accurate.

42743.name: Despicable Dreadlord
42743.text: At the end of your turn, deal 1 damage to all enemy minions.

1784.howToEarn: Unlocked in Frostwyrm Lair, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1784.name: Shade of Naxxramas
1784.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Frostwyrm Lair, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1784.text: Stealth. At the start of your turn, gain +1/+1.
1784.flavor: The Shades of Naxxramas hate the living. They even have a slur they use to refer them: Livers.

1786.howToEarn: Unlocked in The Arachnid Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1786.name: Nerubian Egg
1786.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in The Arachnid Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1786.flavor: Eggs are a good source of protein and Nerubians.

42747.text: Freeze a minion and deal $3 damage to adjacent ones.
42747.name: Avalanche
42747.flavor: One of our more snowbally cards.

42748.text: Give your hero +3 Attack this turn. Gain 3 Armor.
42748.name: Gnash
42748.flavor: It's rude to gnash with your mouth open.

1789.howToEarn: Unlocked in The Military Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1789.name: Spectral Knight
1789.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in The Military Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1789.text: Can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.
1789.flavor: What do Faerie Dragons and Spectral Knights have in common?  They both love pasta!

42750.name: Drakkari Defender
42750.flavor: Sometimes, the best defense is an offensive troll.

38655.text: Choose One - Summon seven 1/1 Wisps; or Give your minions +2/+2.
38655.name: Wisps of the Old Gods
38655.flavor: They're just normal wisps, actually. The "Of the Old Gods" bit is just marketing.

1793.howToEarn: Unlocked in The Plague Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1793.name: Sludge Belcher
1793.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in The Plague Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1793.flavor: DO NOT GIVE HIM A ROOT BEER.

42754.text: Secret: After your opponent plays a minion, add two copies of it to your hand.
42754.name: Frozen Clone
42754.flavor: It's like déjà vu, times two.

41259.name: Devilsaur Egg
41259.flavor: A key ingredient in all discerning Funnel Cake recipes.

1796.howToEarn: Unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1796.name: Stalagg
1796.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1796.text: Deathrattle: If Feugen also died this game, summon Thaddius.
1796.flavor: Stalagg want to write own flavor text.  "STALAGG AWESOME!"

38522.name: Eldritch Horror
38522.flavor: Often wonders what path his life might have taken if he wasn't named, you know, "Eldritch Horror".

42759.text:
[x]Deal $5 damage. Draw
5 cards. Gain 5 Armor.
Summon a 5/5 Ghoul.
42759.name: Ultimate Infestation
42759.flavor: Ghouls in the pipe, five by five.

42760.text: Put one of each Secret from your deck into the battlefield.
42760.name: Glacial Mysteries
42760.flavor: The secret is in the frosting.

1801.howToEarn: Unlocked in The Plague Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1801.name: Duplicate
1801.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in The Plague Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1801.text: Secret: When a friendly minion dies, put 2 copies of it into your hand.
1801.flavor: The one time when duping cards won't get your account banned!

42762.name: Voodoo Hexxer
42762.text: Taunt Freeze any character damaged by this minion.
42762.flavor: The Silver Hand recruits shuddered in terror when they saw the dreaded totem of the Hexxer: A tiny little snowman, impaled with pins.

42763.name: Ice Fishing
42763.flavor: Glow fish, war fish... blow fish, more fish...

1804.howToEarn: Unlocked in Frostwyrm Lair, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1804.name: Avenge
1804.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Frostwyrm Lair, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1804.text: Secret: When one of your minions dies, give a random friendly minion +3/+2.
1804.flavor: Several paladins have joined together to deliver justice under the name "Justice Force".  Their lawyer talked them out of calling themselves the Justice League.

42765.name: Snowfury Giant
42765.text: Costs (1) less for each Mana Crystal you've Overloaded this game.
42765.flavor: This minion goes all the way to 11!

42766.text: Shuffle a copy of your hand into your deck.
42766.name: Dead Man's Hand
42766.flavor: I got two pair, Rags and Armorsmiths. What you got?

1807.howToEarn: Unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1807.name: Dark Cultist
1807.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1807.text: Deathrattle: Give a random friendly minion +3 Health.
1807.flavor: The Cult of the Damned has found it's best not to mention their name when recruiting new cultists.

1808.howToEarn: Unlocked in The Plague Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1808.name: Unstable Ghoul
1808.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in The Plague Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1808.flavor: Filling your Ghouls with Rocket Fuel is all the rage at Necromancer school.

1809.howToEarn: Unlocked in The Military Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1809.name: Reincarnate
1809.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in The Military Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1809.text: Destroy a minion, then return it to life with full Health.
1809.flavor: It's like birth, except you're an adult and you were just dead a second ago.

1810.howToEarn: Unlocked in The Arachnid Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1810.name: Anub'ar Ambusher
1810.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in The Arachnid Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1810.text: Deathrattle: Return a random friendly minion to your hand.
1810.flavor: Originally he was called "Anub'ar Guy who bounces a guy back to your hand", but it lacked a certain zing.

42773.name: Acherus Veteran
42773.flavor: This is my Runeblade. There are many like it but this one is mine.

42775.name: Tuskarr Fisherman
42775.flavor: If you bring him 500 fish, he'll give you this sweet Kalu'ak Fishing Pole.

42777.name: Fallen Sun Cleric
42777.flavor: It's hard to keep a Shattered Sun Cleric down.

42779.name: Furnacefire Colossus
42779.text: Battlecry: Discard all weapons from your hand and gain their stats.
42779.flavor: Smelts in his mouth, not in your hand.

42780.name: Grave Shambler
42780.text: Whenever your weapon is destroyed, gain +1/+1.
42780.flavor: I think one of the necromancers got a little carried away.

42781.name: Tomb Lurker
42781.text: [x]Battlecry: Add a random Deathrattle minion that died this game to your hand.
42781.flavor: She hangs out in all the tombs, but she rarely posts.

42782.name: Ticking Abomination
42782.flavor: Abomination. Emphasis on the second syllable.

42783.name: Happy Ghoul
42783.text: Costs (0) if your hero was healed this turn.

42784.name: Skulking Geist
42784.text: Battlecry: Destroy all 1-Cost spells in both hands and decks.
42784.flavor: It's as though a million Jade Idols cried out, and were suddenly silenced.

42785.name: Shallow Gravedigger
42785.text: Deathrattle: Add a random Deathrattle minion to your hand.
42785.flavor: It's hard to put them six feet under when you're three feet tall.

42630.name: Rotface
42630.text: [x]After this minion survives damage, summon a random Legendary minion.
42630.flavor: Daddy! I think I made a Legendary!

42790.name: Bonemare
42790.flavor: Attacks her job with unbridled enthusiasm.

46892.name: Shimmering Courser
46892.text:
Only you can target
this with spells and
Hero Powers.
46892.flavor: A courser is a courser of course, of course, she's more of a unicorn than a horse...

41524.name: Volatile Elemental
41524.text: Deathrattle: Deal 3 damage to a random enemy minion.
41524.flavor: Currently in an anger management class with Raging Worgen, Grommash Hellscream, and The Angry Chicken. It isn't helping.

42801.text: Throw your weapon at a minion. It deals its damage, then returns to your hand.
42801.name: Doomerang
42801.flavor: Guaranteed to return your weapon directly to your hand! (Wear gloves. Thick ones.)

42804.text: Summon a 5/5 copy of a random minion in your deck.
42804.name: Shadow Essence
42804.flavor: Difficult to bottle up and sell. But it packs a punch.

42808.name: Ice Breaker
42808.text: Destroy any Frozen minion damaged by this.
42808.flavor: A great way to end a conversation.

42810.name: Animated Berserker
42810.text: After you play a minion, deal 1 damage to it.
42810.flavor: He'd be a lot easier to animate if he would just stand still.

40411.text: Shoot three missiles at random enemies that deal $3 damage each.
40411.name: Greater Arcane Missiles
40411.flavor: Wow, and I thought Arcane Missiles was great!

42818.flavor: "All that I am: anger, cruelty, vengeance, 8 attack - I bestow upon you, my chosen knight."
42818.name: The Lich King
42818.text: [x]Taunt At the end of your turn, add a random Death Knight card to your hand.

42819.name: Runeforge Haunter
42819.text: During your turn, your weapon doesn't lose Durability.
42819.flavor: Don't worry, he'll keep an eye on that for you.

38724.name: Stormcrack
38724.flavor: WARNING: DO NOT TOUCH THE PURPLE BALL OF LIGHTNING

38725.name: Faceless Summoner
38725.flavor: They never get the recognition they deserve.

42822.name: Corpse Widow
42822.flavor: Her marriage survived death, but it decayed pretty quickly after that.

38727.name: Call of the Wild
38727.flavor: "Hello. Misha, Leokk and Huffer aren't here right now, but if you leave a message we'll get back to you right away." BEEP.

42824.text: Give a minion "Deathrattle: Return this to life with 1 Health."
42824.name: Desperate Stand
42824.flavor: They're grateful for the help, but most minions would prefer not dying in the first place.

42825.name: Blackguard
42825.text: Whenever your hero is healed, deal that much damage to a random enemy minion.
42825.flavor: "Did I ever tell you the story of when I single-handedly took down a 29/29 C'thun?" - Reno Jackson

41954.name: Tyrantus
41954.text: Can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.
41954.flavor: Millennia of evolutionary pressures turned his species into the Faerie Dragons we know today.

38734.name: Infested Wolf
38734.flavor: A little flea powder will fix that right up.

38738.name: Bloodhoof Brave
38738.flavor: He thought the set was called "Flippers of the Old Cods" and hungrily volunteered to be in it.  He is definitely going to get his hearing checked.

38739.name: Malkorok
38739.flavor: Garrosh's best buddy. It's true. Look it up.

38740.name: Selfless Hero
38740.text: Deathrattle: Give a random friendly minion Divine Shield.
38740.flavor: "Don't worry about me… I'll just be here... under these tentacles."

38745.name: Rallying Blade
38745.text: Battlecry: Give +1/+1 to your minions with Divine Shield.
38745.flavor: As far as blades go, this one is pretty great in the motivation department.

38749.name: Divine Strength
38749.flavor: Every year a few paladins get disqualified from the Westfall weight lifting championship for using Divine Strength.

38758.name: Ragnaros, Lightlord
38758.text: At the end of your turn, restore 8 Health to a damaged friendly character.
38758.flavor: What happens when you try and corrupt a corrupted firelord? DOUBLE NEGATIVE, INSECT!

38764.name: Darkshire Alchemist
38764.flavor: The secret ingredient: liquified funnel cake.

38770.text: Destroy all minions. Draw a card for each.
38770.name: DOOM!
38770.flavor: We ran out of space for "DOOOOOOOOOOOM!!!!!"

38774.name: Possessed Villager
38774.flavor: It's like a pinata! A lame disgusting horrific pinata.

1913.howToEarn: Unlocked in The Military Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1913.name: Dancing Swords
1913.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in The Military Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1913.flavor: They like to dance to reggae.

1914.howToEarn: Unlocked in The Plague Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1914.name: Loatheb
1914.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in The Plague Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1914.text: Battlecry: Enemy spells cost (5) more next turn.
1914.flavor: Loatheb used to be a simple Bog Beast.  This is why we need stricter regulations on mining and agriculture.

1915.howToEarn: Unlocked in The Military Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1915.name: Baron Rivendare
1915.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in The Military Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1915.flavor: There used to be five Horsemen but one of them left because a job opened up in the deadmines and the benefits were better.

38781.name: Twisted Worgen
38781.flavor: Sometimes the Old Gods' corruptions gives you power untold, sometimes you get +1 Attack. We can’t all be winners in the Eldritch lottery.

38784.name: Infested Tauren
38784.flavor: The Overmind and the Old Gods are surprisingly similar.

1927.text: Deal $4 damage to a random enemy minion.
1927.name: Flamecannon
1927.flavor: Calling something a flamecannon really doesn't do much to distinguish it from other goblin devices.

38792.name: Eater of Secrets
38792.text: Battlecry: Destroy all enemy Secrets. Gain +1/+1 for each.
38792.flavor: You don't want to be around after it has eaten an explosive trap.  You thought Sludge Belcher was bad...

1929.text: Add a random minion to your hand. It costs (3) less.
1929.name: Unstable Portal
1929.flavor: The denizens of Azeroth have no idea how much work goes into stabilizing portals.  We spend like 30% of GDP on portal upkeep.

38795.name: Doomcaller
38795.text: Battlecry: Give your C'Thun +2/+2 (wherever it is). If it's dead, shuffle it into your deck.
38795.flavor: "Hello, is Doom there? No? Can I leave a message?"

1932.name: Cogmaster
1932.text: Has +2 Attack while you have a Mech.

38797.flavor: Who's a cute widdle N'Zoth? You are! Yes you are! Yes you're the cutest widdle N'Zoth in the whole world!!!

1934.name: Goblin Blastmage

1936.name: Shrinkmeister
1936.text: Battlecry: Give a minion -2 Attack this turn.
1936.flavor: After the debacle of the Gnomish World Enlarger, gnomes are wary of size-changing inventions.

1688.name: Angry Chicken
1688.flavor: There is no beast more frightening (or ridiculous) than a fully enraged chicken.

1938.text: Deal damage to each minion equal to its Attack.
1938.name: Lightbomb
1938.flavor: This is what happens when you allow goblins to be priests.

1939.name: Flame Leviathan

1939.flavor: Mimiron likes to take the Flame Leviathan out on some sweet joyrides.

1940.name: Mechwarper

1941.text: Put a copy of each friendly minion into your hand.

42909.name: Corpse Raiser
42909.text: [x]Battlecry: Give a friendly minion "Deathrattle: Resummon this minion."
42909.flavor: He was just minding his business, farming corpses, when you meddling adventurers came along.

38825.name: Southsea Squidface
38825.flavor: Quick! Before I drown! Let me sharpen your sword for you.

1693.name: King Mukla
1693.flavor: King Mukla wanders Jaguero Isle, searching for love.

38832.name: Scaled Nightmare
38832.text: At the start of your turn, double this minion's Attack.
38832.flavor: I like it because it scales.

38833.name: Twilight Summoner
38833.flavor: If you strike him down, he shall become more powerful than you can possibly imagine.

42756.name: Doomed Apprentice
42756.flavor: Jaina was never good at keeping up apprentices.

38666.text: Spend all your Mana. Restore twice that much Health.
38666.name: Forbidden Healing
38666.flavor: No one's quite sure why it's forbidden. And yes, that should make you nervous.

38843.name: Stand Against Darkness
38843.flavor: Or if you're too tired, you can just kind of lean against the darkness.

1982.name: Fel Reaver

38848.text: Add a copy of each damaged friendly minion to your hand.
38848.name: Blood Warriors
38848.flavor: They have an uneasy rivalry with the Blood Paladins.

1985.text: Deal $5 damage to a minion.  If it's a friendly Demon, give it +5/+5 instead.

1986.name: Mal'Ganis

42948.name: Howling Commander

42948.flavor: Enlistment in her battalion comes with several pairs of earplugs.

1989.name: Cogmaster's Wrench

1989.flavor: For tightening cogs and smashin' troggs!

1990.name: One-eyed Cheat

1991.name: Feign Death
1991.flavor: The hardest part about doing a "Feign Death" convincingly is learning how to make the right smell. It takes a lot of commitment.

1992.name: Iron Sensei
1992.text: At the end of your turn, give another friendly Mech +2/+2.
1992.flavor:
Mechs like learning from him because he really speaks their language.

38864.name: Twilight Geomancer
38864.flavor: "Ok C'Thun, repeat after me: 'Your mother was a hamster.'"

38868.text: At the end of your turn, give your C'Thun +1/+1 (wherever it is).
38868.flavor: Just doesn't understand those Twilight Youngsters any more - with their comic books and their rock music.

2007.name: Vitality Totem

2008.name: Siltfin Spiritwalker
2008.text: Whenever another friendly Murloc dies, draw a card. Overload: (1)

38873.name: Ancient Harbinger

38875.name: Forlorn Stalker

38875.flavor: He's going to leave the dying up to you, if that's cool.

38876.name: Shadowcaster
38876.text: Battlecry: Choose a friendly minion. Add a 1/1 copy to your hand that costs (1).
38876.flavor: I mean, it's not creepy if you ASK before you steal their shadow to make a small replica of them to keep on your shelf.

2013.text: Deal $2-$4 damage to a minion. Summon a 1/1 Imp for each damage dealt.
2013.name: Imp-losion

2014.name: King of Beasts

45392.name: Bolvar, Fireblood
45392.text: Divine Shield After a friendly minion loses Divine Shield, gain +2 Attack.

38882.name: Dark Arakkoa
38882.flavor: There's a whole gradient of Arakkoa! This one is on the darker side.

2019.name: Warbot

2020.text: Destroy a minion. If you have a damaged minion, this costs (4) less.

2021.name: Shieldmaiden

2022.name: Ogre Warmaul
2022.text: 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.

2023.name: Screwjank Clunker
2023.flavor: If it breaks, just kick it a couple of times while yelling "Durn thing!"

38888.name: Cult Apothecary
38888.text: Battlecry: For each enemy minion, restore 2 Health to your hero.

2025.text: Restore #4 Health to your hero and gain +2 Attack this turn.
2025.name: Seal of Light
2025.flavor: The walrus of Light restores EIGHT Health.

2026.name: Shielded Minibot
2026.flavor: He chooses to believe what he is programmed to believe!

42987.name: Thrall, Deathseer
42987.text: Battlecry: Transform your minions into random ones that cost (2) more.
42987.flavor: "Do not be afraid. Approach. The dead will sleep… for now."

2028.name: Quartermaster
2028.flavor: His specialty? Dividing things into four pieces.

2029.text: Summon three 1/1 Silver Hand Recruits. Equip a 1/4 Weapon.
2029.name: Muster for Battle
2029.flavor: "I'm bringing the guacamole!" – One of the most successful (yet rare) Silver Hand rallying cries

2030.name: Cobalt Guardian
2030.text: Whenever you summon a Mech, gain Divine Shield.

38895.name: The Boogeymonster
38895.text: Whenever this attacks and kills a minion, gain +2/+2.
38895.flavor: Has 20 years of training in classical ballet, but ALLLLLL he ever gets asked to do is boogie.

42992.name: Spirit Lash
42992.flavor: We've got spirit, yes we do! We've got spirit, stolen from you!

38897.name: Ancient Shieldbearer
38897.text: Battlecry: If your C'Thun has at least 10 Attack, gain 10 Armor.
38897.flavor: Back in her day, each shield weighed two tons and she had to carry four of them on each arm!

38898.name: Usher of Souls
38898.text: Whenever a friendly minion dies, give your C'Thun +1/+1 (wherever it is).
38898.flavor: Nothing unburdens your soul like a good ushing!

2035.name: Stonesplinter Trogg

2035.flavor: The only thing worse than smelling troggs is listening to their poetry.

38900.name: Cult Sorcerer
38900.text: [x]Spell Damage +1 After you cast a spell, give your C'Thun +1/+1 (wherever it is).
38900.flavor: No matter how many times we tell her not to, she keeps feeding C'Thun scraps under the table.

2037.name: Antique Healbot
2037.flavor: They don't make 'em like they used to! (Because of explosions, mostly.)

42998.name: Forge of Souls
42998.flavor: Powerful weaponry forged by Bronjahm, the Godfather of Souls.

38569.name: Faceless Shambler
38569.text: Taunt Battlecry: Copy a friendly minion's Attack and Health.
38569.flavor: "What is that thing?!" "I'm not sure, but it seems to be sort of Ysera shaped."

2040.name: Shadowboxer
2040.text: Whenever a character is healed, deal 1 damage to a random enemy.
2040.flavor: Punching is its primary function. Also, its secondary function.

2041.text: Deal $3 damage to a minion and the enemy hero.
2041.name: Cobra Shot
2041.flavor: "Cobra Shot" hurts way, way, way more than "Cobra Cuddle."

2042.name: Kezan Mystic
2042.text: Battlecry: Take control of a random enemy Secret.

2043.name: Ship's Cannon

2043.flavor: If you hear someone yell, "Cannonball!" you're about to get wet. Or crushed.

2044.name: Explosive Sheep
2044.flavor: How is this supposed to work? Your enemies think, "Hey! Cute sheep!" and run over to cuddle it?

38909.name: Giant Sand Worm
38909.text: Whenever this attacks and kills a minion, it may attack again.
38909.flavor: Banned from every all-you-can-eat buffet on Azeroth.

38910.name: Princess Huhuran
38910.flavor: She flitters around Ahn'Qiraj dreaming of the day she will meet a sweet prince, whom she can lay thousands of eggs with.

38911.name: Steward of Darkshire
38911.text: Whenever you summon a 1-Health minion, give it Divine Shield.
38911.flavor: Turns out divine shields are way cheaper if you buy in bulk.

2048.name: Druid of the Fang
2048.text: Battlecry: If you have a Beast, transform this minion into a 7/7.
2048.flavor: The Druids of the Fang live in the Wailing Caverns. They wear cool snake shirts and tell snake jokes and say "bro" a lot.

2049.name: Gilblin Stalker
2049.flavor:
"Shhh, I think I hear something."
"Ah, it's probably nothing." - Every Henchman

2050.name: Clockwork Gnome

2050.flavor: Clockwork gnomes are always asking what time it is.

2053.name: Annoy-o-Tron
2053.flavor: The inventor of the Annoy-o-Tron was immediately expelled from Tinkerschool, Tinkertown, and was eventually exiled from the Eastern Kingdoms altogether.

2054.name: Siege Engine
2054.text: Whenever you gain Armor, give this minion +1 Attack.

2055.name: Steamwheedle Sniper
2055.text: Your Hero Power can target minions.

2056.name: Ogre Ninja
2056.text: Stealth 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
2056.flavor: He didn't have the grades to get into ninja school, but his dad pulled some strings.

2057.name: Illuminator
2057.text: If you control a Secret at the end of your turn, restore 4 Health to your hero.
2057.flavor: "LUMOS!" is not what they yell. What do you think this is, Hogwarts?

2058.name: Madder Bomber
2058.text: Battlecry: Deal 6 damage randomly split between all other characters.

2059.name: Arcane Nullifier X-21
2059.text: Taunt Can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.
2059.flavor: There was some hard talk between gnome magi and engineers about inventing this mech.

2060.name: Gnomish Experimenter
2060.text: Battlecry: Draw a card. If it's a minion, transform it into a Chicken.

2061.name: Target Dummy
2061.flavor: The engineering equivalent of a "Kick Me" sticker.

2062.name: Jeeves

2062.flavor: This robot is a lean, mean, butlerin' machine.

2063.name: Goblin Sapper
2063.text: Has +4 Attack while your opponent has 6 or more cards in hand.
2063.flavor: He’s not such a binge exploder anymore. These days, he only explodes socially.

2064.name: Piloted Shredder

2065.name: Lil' Exorcist
2065.flavor: Warlocks have the town exorcist on speed dial in case they unleash the wrong demon.

2066.name: Gnomeregan Infantry

2067.name: Bomb Lobber
2067.text: Battlecry: Deal 4 damage to a random enemy minion.
2067.flavor: He lobbies Orgrimmar daily on behalf of bombs.

2068.name: Floating Watcher
2068.text: Whenever your hero takes damage on your turn, gain +2/+2.
2068.flavor: "Evil Eye Watcher of Doom" was the original name, but marketing felt it was a bit too aggressive.

2069.name: Scarlet Purifier
2069.text: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage to all minions with Deathrattle.
2069.flavor: The Scarlet Crusade is doing market research to find out if the "Mauve Crusade" would be better received.

2070.name: Tinkertown Technician
2070.text: Battlecry: If you have a Mech, gain +1/+1 and add a Spare Part to your hand.
2070.flavor: Won't you take me to... Tinkertown?

43031.name: Lilian Voss
43031.text: Battlecry: Replace spells in your hand with random spells (from your opponent's class).

2072.name: Hobgoblin
2072.text: Whenever you play a 1-Attack minion, give it +2/+2.
2072.flavor: Hobgoblins are meeting next week to discuss union benefits.  First on the list: dental plan.

2073.name: Piloted Sky Golem

2074.name: Junkbot

2075.name: Enhance-o Mechano

2076.name: Recombobulator

2076.flavor: For when you didn’t combobulate quite right the first time around.

2077.name: Mini-Mage
2077.flavor: He is sometimes found hiding in the treasure chest in the Gurubashi Arena.

2078.name: Dr. Boom
2078.text: Battlecry: Summon two 1/1 Boom Bots. WARNING: Bots may explode.

2079.name: Mimiron's Head
2079.text: At the start of your turn, if you have at least 3 Mechs, destroy them all and form V-07-TR-0N.
2079.flavor: Do not push the big red button!

2080.name: Mogor the Ogre
2080.text: All minions have a 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
2080.flavor: Mogor helped reopen the Dark Portal once. You know you're in trouble when you have to rely on an ogre.

2081.name: Foe Reaper 4000
2081.text: Also damages the minions next to whomever it attacks.
2081.flavor: Foe reaping is really not so different from harvest reaping, at the end of the day.

2082.name: Sneed's Old Shredder
2082.flavor: When Sneed was defeated in the Deadmines, his shredder was sold at auction to an anonymous buyer. (Probably Hogger.)

2083.name: Toshley
2083.text: Battlecry and Deathrattle: Add a Spare Part card to your hand.

2084.name: Mekgineer Thermaplugg
2084.text: Whenever an enemy minion dies, summon a Leper Gnome.
2084.flavor: He was obsessed with explosives until he discovered knitting. Now he yells, “SWEATERS! MORE SWEATERS!”

2085.name: Gazlowe
2085.text: Whenever you cast a 1-mana spell, add a random Mech to your hand.
2085.flavor: Gazlowe was voted "Most Likely to Explode" in high school.

2086.name: Troggzor the Earthinator
2086.text: Whenever your opponent casts a spell, summon a Burly Rockjaw Trogg.
2086.flavor: He keeps earthinating the countryside despite attempts to stop him.

2087.name: Blingtron 3000
2087.text: Battlecry: Equip a random weapon for each player.
2087.flavor: PREPARE PARTY SERVOS FOR IMMEDIATE DEPLOYMENT.

2088.name: Hemet Nesingwary
2088.flavor: It's hard to make a living as a hunter in a world where beasts instantly reappear minutes after you kill them.

43051.name: Meat Wagon
43051.text: [x]Deathrattle: Summon a minion from your deck with less Attack than this minion.

2093.name: Darkbomb
2093.flavor: If you're looking to make an "Emo" deck, this card is perfect!

2094.text:
Draw a card.
If it's a Beast, it costs (4) less.
2094.name: Call Pet

2095.text: Give your weapon +3 Attack. Combo: Give a random friendly minion +3 Attack.
2095.name: Tinker's Sharpsword Oil
2095.flavor: "Get ready to strike oil!" - Super-cheesy battle cry

38960.name: Blackwater Pirate
38960.flavor: "Look, they fell off the back of a ship, do you want them or not? I have a meeting with Y'Shaarj in like ten minutes."

38961.name: Polluted Hoarder
38961.flavor: Roll ‘greed’ OR THIS COULD HAPPEN TO YOU.

43064.name: Blood-Queen Lana'thel
43064.text: [x]Lifesteal Has +1 Attack for each card you've discarded this game.
43064.flavor: As a young blood-princess she learned the proper way for a lady to curtsy, how to address fellow members of royalty, and how to bite them.

43072.name: Moorabi
43072.text: Whenever another minion is Frozen, add a copy of it to your hand.
43072.flavor: Most disturbing is how Moorabi covers all those frozen minions with flavored syrup.

39002.name: Duskboar
39002.flavor: Often excluded from dinner parties.  To be fair, he is very boaring.

39003.name: Squirming Tentacle
39003.flavor: Yeah, I think we can agree that killing the squirming tentacle first is a good idea.

39008.name: Master of Evolution
39008.text: Battlecry: Transform a friendly minion into a random one that costs (1) more.
39008.flavor: Will be really useful in the new "Hearthémon" game.

43112.text: Shuffle all minions into your opponent's deck.
43112.name: Psychic Scream

43121.name: Vulgar Homunculus
43121.flavor: Fortunately he has an even number of fingers.

43122.name: Kobold Librarian
43122.text: Battlecry: Draw a card. Deal 2 damage to your hero.
43122.flavor: Kobolds sort books using a gooey decimal system.

41944.name: Adaptation
41944.flavor: Pray for salvation. If that fails, pray for extra horns or bigger teeth.

43127.name: Chillblade Champion
43127.flavor: It slices, it dices, it vaporizes! The Chillblade will make a Champion out of even the lowliest gnome.

43128.text: Destroy a friendly minion. Restore #8 Health to your hero.
43128.name: Dark Pact
43128.flavor: "Don't worry about the fine print. Just sign here."

39033.name: Hooded Acolyte
39033.text: Whenever a character is healed, give your C'Thun +1/+1 (wherever it is).
39033.flavor: Wait, what kind of acolyte doesn't wear a hood?

39034.name: Shifting Shade
39034.text: [x]Deathrattle: Copy a card from your opponent's deck  and add it to your hand.
39034.flavor: Yeah, it's cooler in the shade, but you're also more likely to get JACKED.

2172.name: Mistress of Pain
2172.flavor: Her sister is the Mistress of Pane who sells windows and shower doors.

43133.name: Hooked Reaver
43133.text: Battlecry: If you have 15 or less Health, gain +3/+3 and Taunt.
43133.flavor: The hook is just an accessory. He can reave just fine without it.

39041.name: Cyclopian Horror
39041.text: Taunt. Battlecry: Gain +1 Health for each enemy minion.
39041.flavor: What are the qualifications for being a 'Horror?'  Just how horrible do you have to be?

41323.name: Fire Fly
41323.text: Battlecry: Add a 1/2 Elemental to your hand.
41323.flavor: Archnemeses: small children with glass jars.

13334.howToEarn: Unlocked in Uldaman, in the League of Explorers adventure.
13334.name: Reliquary Seeker
13334.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Uldaman, in the League of Explorers adventure.
13334.text: Battlecry: If you have 6 other minions, gain +4/+4.
13334.flavor: The Reliquary considers itself the equal of the League of Explorers.  The League of Explorers doesn't.

39046.name: Nat, the Darkfisher
39046.text: At the start of your opponent's turn, they have a 50% chance to draw an extra card.
39046.flavor: You can take away his humanity, but you will never take away his fishing pole.

38944.name: Hogger, Doom of Elwynn
38944.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, summon a 2/2 Gnoll with Taunt.
38944.flavor: When C'thun went to sleep, he checked under his bed for Hogger.

1047.name: Tracking
