41263.name: Bittertide Hydra
41263.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, deal 3 damage to your hero.
41263.flavor: It's actually only the middle head that's bitter. The others are sweet and spicy.

41945.name: Lightfused Stegodon
41945.flavor: “Come now, Johnston. I think those horns are quite fetching on you.”

42011.text: Discover a card from your opponent's class.
42011.name: Hallucination
42011.flavor: It's the good kind of hallucination.

40991.name: Evolving Spores
40991.flavor: The most powerful mushrooms are commonly found in boxes marked with "?".

41264.name: Tortollan Primalist
41264.text: Battlecry: Discover a spell and cast it with random targets.
41264.flavor: I see pizza in my future.

2225.name: Grove Tender
2225.text: Choose One - Give each player a Mana Crystal; or Each player draws a card.
2225.flavor: Likes: Hiking and the great outdoors. Dislikes: Goblin shredders and sandals. (Can’t find any that fit!).

41331.name: Kalimos, Primal Lord
41331.text: [x]Battlecry: If you played an Elemental last turn, cast an Elemental Invocation.
41331.flavor: All that's missing is a little heart.

2233.name: Clockwork Giant
2233.text: Costs (1) less for each card in your opponent's hand.
2233.flavor: He and Mountain Giant don't get along.

2234.name: Wee Spellstopper
2234.text: Adjacent minions can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.
2234.flavor: Bane of spellcasters and spelling bees everywhere.

2249.name: Soot Spewer
2249.flavor: The inventor of the goblin shredder is involved in several patent disputes with the inventor of the soot spewer.

39118.name: Skeram Cultist
39118.flavor: Just before he comes into play, there is an AWESOME training montage with C'Thun.

39119.name: Soggoth the Slitherer
39119.text: Taunt Can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.
39119.flavor: Don't tell Soggoth, but in the future he gets totally owned by the Master's Glaive and his skull becomes a tourist attraction.

2257.howToEarn: Unlocked in Hidden Laboratory, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2257.name: Drakonid Crusher
2257.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Hidden Laboratory, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2257.text: Battlecry: If your opponent has 15 or less Health, gain +3/+3.
2257.flavor: Drakonids were created to have all the bad parts of a dragon in the form of a humanoid. But, like, why?

2258.howToEarn: Unlocked in Hidden Laboratory, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2258.name: Volcanic Drake
2258.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Hidden Laboratory, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2258.text: Costs (1) less for each minion that died this turn.
2258.flavor: Volcanic Drakes breathe lava instead of fire. The antacid vendor at Thorium Point does a brisk business with them.

2259.name: Light's Champion
2259.flavor: When there's something strange (say, a gibbering demon) in your neighborhood, who are you going to call?

2260.howToEarn: Unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2260.name: Quick Shot
2260.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2260.text:
Deal $3 damage.
If your hand is empty, draw a card.

2261.howToEarn: Unlocked in Hidden Laboratory, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2261.name: Nefarian
2261.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Hidden Laboratory, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2261.text: Battlecry: Add 2 random spells to your hand (from your opponent's class).
2261.flavor: They call him "Blackwing" because he's a black dragon...... and he's got wings.

2262.howToEarn: Unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2262.name: Emperor Thaurissan
2262.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2262.text: At the end of your turn, reduce the Cost of cards in your hand by (1).
2262.flavor: His second greatest regret is summoning an evil Firelord who enslaved his entire people.

2263.howToEarn: Unlocked in Blackrock Spire, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2263.name: Core Rager
2263.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Blackrock Spire, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2263.text: Battlecry: If your hand is empty, gain +3/+3.
2263.flavor: It takes a special kind of hunter to venture deep into a firey lava pit and convince a monster who lives there to come home and be a cuddly housepet.

43228.name: Fal'dorei Strider
43228.text: [x]Battlecry: Shuffle 3 Ambushes into your deck. When drawn, summon a 4/4 Spider.
43228.flavor: What’s worse? Seeing the spider, or NOT seeing the spider, but knowing it’s somewhere in your deck?

2274.howToEarn: Unlocked in Hidden Laboratory, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2274.name: Solemn Vigil
2274.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Hidden Laboratory, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2274.text: Draw 2 cards. Costs (1) less for each minion that died this turn.
2274.flavor: Each year, folk gather in front of Blackrock Mountain to mourn those who were mind-controlled into the lava.

2275.howToEarn: Unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2275.name: Flamewaker
2275.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2275.text: After you cast a spell, deal 2 damage randomly split among all enemies.
2275.flavor: Flamewakers HATE being confused for Flamewalkers. They just wake up fire, they don’t walk on it. Walking on fire is CRAZY.

43237.name: Cavern Shinyfinder
43237.text: Battlecry: Draw a weapon from your deck.
43237.flavor: They call her the candled vandal.

2278.howToEarn: Unlocked in Blackrock Spire, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2278.name: Dragon Egg
2278.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Blackrock Spire, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2278.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, summon a 2/1 Whelp.
2278.flavor: Think of them as bullets for your dragon gun.

2279.howToEarn: Unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2279.name: Grim Patron
2279.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2279.text: After this minion survives damage, summon another Grim Patron.
2279.flavor: If you love getting your face punched, come to the Grim Guzzler!

2280.howToEarn: Unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2280.name: Chromaggus
2280.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2280.text: Whenever you draw a card, put another copy into your hand.
2280.flavor: Left head and right head can never agree about what to eat for dinner, so they always end up just eating ramen again.

2281.howToEarn: Unlocked in Molten Core, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2281.name: Majordomo Executus
2281.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Molten Core, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2281.text: Deathrattle: Replace your hero with Ragnaros, the Firelord.
2281.flavor: You thought Executus turned you into Ragnaros, but really Ragnaros was in you the whole time.

2283.howToEarn: Unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2283.name: Hungry Dragon
2283.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2283.text: Battlecry: Summon a random 1-Cost minion for your opponent.
2283.flavor: Hungry Hungry Dragon is NOT a fun game.

2284.howToEarn: Unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2284.name: Dragon's Breath
2284.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2284.text: Deal $4 damage. Costs (1) less for each minion that died this turn.
2284.flavor: Dragons breathe fire, sure, but did you know they can also breathe Cotton Candy?  It's harder to give them a reason to do that, though.

43245.name: Abominable Bowman
43245.text: [x]Deathrattle: Summon a random friendly Beast that died this game.
43245.flavor: Frosty the Bowman... was an angry hateful soul... with a fresh hewn bow and a missing nose...

2286.howToEarn: Unlocked in Blackrock Spire, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2286.name: Twilight Whelp
2286.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Blackrock Spire, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2286.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +2 Health.
2286.flavor: The twilight whelps are basically magic-vampires. Despite this, they are not a reference to any popular series of novels.

2288.howToEarn: Unlocked in Molten Core, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2288.name: Imp Gang Boss
2288.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Molten Core, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2288.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, summon a 1/1 Imp.
2288.flavor: His imp gang likes to sneak into Stormwind to spraypaint "Ragnaros Rulez" on the Mage Tower.

2289.howToEarn: Unlocked in Molten Core, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2289.name: Lava Shock
2289.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Molten Core, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2289.text: Deal $2 damage. Unlock your Overloaded Mana Crystals.
2289.flavor: Chocolate lava cake is shockingly delicious.

2290.howToEarn: Unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2290.name: Fireguard Destroyer
2290.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2290.flavor: Ragnaros interviews hundreds of Fire Elementals for the position of "Destroyer" but very few have what it takes.

2291.howToEarn: Unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2291.name: Dark Iron Skulker
2291.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2291.text: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage to all undamaged enemy minions.
2291.flavor: He loves skulking. He skulks after hours just for the joy of it, but his friends are pretty worried he'll get burnt out.

2292.howToEarn: Unlocked in Molten Core, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2292.name: Druid of the Flame
2292.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Molten Core, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2292.text: Choose One - Transform into a 5/2 minion; or a 2/5 minion.
2292.flavor: Druids who fought too long in Northrend were easily seduced by Ragnaros; a mug of hot chocolate was generally all it took.

2295.howToEarn: Unlocked in Blackrock Spire, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2295.name: Volcanic Lumberer
2295.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Blackrock Spire, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2295.text: Taunt Costs (1) less for each minion that died this turn.
2295.flavor: The roots, the roots, the roots is on fire!

2296.howToEarn: Unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2296.name: Revenge
2296.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2296.text: Deal $1 damage to all minions. If you have 12 or less Health, deal $3 damage instead.
2296.flavor: This is better than Arcane Explosion, so I guess warriors are finally getting revenge on mages for Mortal Strike being worse than Fireball.

2297.howToEarn: Unlocked in Molten Core, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2297.name: Axe Flinger
2297.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Molten Core, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2297.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, deal 2 damage to the enemy hero.
2297.flavor: Once a lowly "Stick Flinger", he's been relentless on the path to his ultimate dream: "Tauren Flinger".

2298.howToEarn: Unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2298.name: Resurrect
2298.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2298.text: Summon a random friendly minion that died this game.
2298.flavor: I walked into the dungeon and noticed a slain adventurer. In his final moments, he had scrawled out a message in the dust on the wall beside him. Two words: "rez plz"

2299.howToEarn: Unlocked in Blackrock Spire, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2299.name: Dragon Consort
2299.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Blackrock Spire, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2299.text: Battlecry: The next Dragon you play costs (2) less.
2299.flavor: Everybody wants someone to snuggle with. Even giant armored scaly draconic beasts of destruction.

2301.howToEarn: Unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2301.name: Demonwrath
2301.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2301.text:
[x]Deal $2 damage to all
minions except Demons.
2301.flavor: Demons are not angry most of the time. You have to play this card in order to really bring it out of them.

2304.howToEarn: Unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2304.name: Gang Up
2304.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2304.text: Choose a minion. Shuffle 3 copies of it into your deck.
2304.flavor: If you are thinking about visiting Moonbrook, you better roll deep.

39169.howToEarn: Unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.
39169.name: Babbling Book
39169.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.
39169.text: Battlecry: Add a random Mage spell to your hand.
39169.flavor: His idol is the Green Hills of Stranglethorn, and he won't shut up about it.

2306.howToEarn: Unlocked in Hidden Laboratory, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2306.name: Dragonkin Sorcerer
2306.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Hidden Laboratory, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2306.text: Whenever you target this minion with a spell, gain +1/+1.
2306.flavor: Dragonkin Sorcerers be all "I'm a wizard" and everyone else be all "daaaaang".

2308.howToEarn: Unlocked in Blackrock Spire, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2308.name: Rend Blackhand
2308.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Blackrock Spire, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2308.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, destroy a Legendary minion.
2308.flavor: Rend believes he is the True Warchief of the Horde and he keeps editing the wikipedia page for "Warchief of the Horde" to include his picture.

43269.name: Kobold Barbarian
43269.text: At the start of your turn, attack a random enemy.
43269.flavor: What is best in life? To make candle. To keep candle. To hear lamentations of candle-takers.

43272.text: Lifesteal. Deal $3 damage to a minion. (Take damage from your cards to upgrade.)
43272.name: Lesser Amethyst Spellstone
43272.flavor:
A purple stone Azari carved
For dark hearts, craving, power-starved.
The first to bow, the warlock Rin,
Embraced the darkness, slew her kin.

43277.name: Bladed Gauntlet
43277.text: Has Attack equal to your Armor. Can't attack heroes.

43282.text: Give a minion +3 Health. Gain 3 Armor.
43282.name: Barkskin
43282.flavor: Make like a tree… and gain armor.

43284.name: Ironwood Golem
43284.text: Taunt Can only attack if you have 3 or more Armor.

39190.howToEarn: Unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.
39190.name: Wicked Witchdoctor
39190.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.
39190.text: Whenever you cast a spell, summon a random basic Totem.
39190.flavor: You can easily defeat her by either dealing 4 damage, or dropping a house on her.

43288.collectionText: Deal $2 damage to a minion. (Gain 3 Armor to upgrade.)
43288.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion. @(Gain 3 Armor to upgrade.)
43288.name: Lesser Jasper Spellstone
43288.flavor:
In ancient woods, elves fought the curse
The demon’s shadow to disperse
But hatred raged and frail souls turned
Now horned and hooved their forests burned.

39197.howToEarn: Unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.
39197.name: Kara Kazham!
39197.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.
39197.text: Summon a 1/1 Candle, 2/2 Broom, and 3/3 Teapot.
39197.flavor: This is what happens when you tell Khadgar to set the table.

43294.text: [x]Choose Twice - Draw a card; Give your minions +1 Attack; Gain 6 Armor.
43294.name: Branching Paths
43294.flavor:
Three paths diverged in a darkened hall, and I –
I took the one less traveled by,
And got eaten by a slime.

39207.howToEarn: Unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.
39207.name: Pantry Spider
39207.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.
39207.flavor: You have to admit, they make a cute couple.

43304.name: Astral Tiger
43304.text: Deathrattle: Shuffle a copy of this minion into your deck.
43304.flavor: Astral kitty litter is surprisingly hard to find.

39210.howToEarn: Unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.
39210.name: Book Wyrm
39210.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.
39210.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, destroy an enemy minion with 3 or less Attack.
39210.flavor: His favorites are classic tragedies like "The Hobbit" and "Grendel".

39215.howToEarn: Unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.
39215.name: Arcane Anomaly
39215.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.
39215.text:
Whenever you cast a spell, give this minion
+1 Health.
39215.flavor: He used to get work as a Spatial Anomaly, but he got tired of having his polarity reversed.

39225.howToEarn: Unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.
39225.name: The Curator
39225.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.
39225.text: Taunt Battlecry: Draw a Beast, Dragon, and Murloc from your deck.
39225.flavor: The Curator guards Azeroth’s deadliest creatures, but it’s secretly terrified of squirrels.

43322.name: Crushing Hand
43322.flavor: Shamans always have the firmest handshakes.

41354.name: Tol'vir Warden
41354.text: Battlecry: Draw two 1-Cost minions from your deck.
41354.flavor: Ferocious in combat… and even more terrifying in pet battles.

43329.name: Kobold Hermit
43329.text: Battlecry: Choose a basic Totem. Summon it.
43329.flavor: To truly understand candles, it takes YEARS of quiet contemplation.

43331.collectionText: Summon 1 copy of a friendly minion. (Overload 3 Mana Crystals to upgrade.)
43331.name: Lesser Sapphire Spellstone
43331.text: Summon 1 copy of a friendly minion. @(Overload 3 Mana Crystals to upgrade.)
43331.flavor:
A stone of blue, embraced with glee
By murloc lords beneath the sea
Soon numberless they swarmed the shore
First two, then four, then more...and more...

41357.name: Raptor Hatchling
41357.text: Deathrattle: Shuffle a 4/3 Raptor into your deck.
41357.flavor: They’re just baby teeth. Lots and lots of baby teeth.

43345.name: Sewer Crawler
43345.flavor: His clothing is "ratty" in more ways than one.

43357.text: Deal $3 damage to a minion. Summon a 3/3 Wolf.
43357.name: Flanking Strike
43357.flavor: Wolves to the left and arrows to the right, here I am stuck in the middle with you.

43358.name: Cave Hydra
43358.text:
Also damages the minions next to whomever
this attacks.
43358.flavor: Can be upgraded into a Cave Lurker.

43359.text: Secret: When an enemy attacks your hero, summon a 3-Cost minion as the new target.
43359.name: Wandering Monster
43359.flavor: Not all who wander are lost. This one is lost though, for sure.

41360.text: Each time you play a Beast this turn, add a random Beast to your hand.
41360.name: Stampede
41360.flavor: Many hunters long for the pitter-patter of enormous feet.

43363.text: Summon two 3/3 Wolves. (Play a Secret to upgrade.)
43363.name: Lesser Emerald Spellstone
43363.flavor:
An emerald stone for Tauren hands
Who sought its strength to save their lands
Their tribes now lost, their rage released
Who’s hunting now? And who’s the beast?

39269.howToEarn: Unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.
39269.name: Menagerie Magician
39269.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.
39269.text: Battlecry: Give a random friendly Beast, Dragon, and Murloc +2/+2.
39269.flavor: Just between us, if things get tight the Menagerie Magician position will probably be the first to go.

2408.howToEarn: Unlocked in Molten Core, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2408.name: Blackwing Technician
2408.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Molten Core, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2408.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1/+1.
2408.flavor: This is who you go to when your Blackwing needs a tune up. Don't go to a cut rate Blackwing tune up shop!

2409.howToEarn: Unlocked in Hidden Laboratory, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2409.name: Blackwing Corruptor
2409.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in Hidden Laboratory, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
2409.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, deal 3 damage.
2409.flavor: He got his name when he gave Blackwing some comic books and rock & roll records.

43373.text: Give a minion Divine Shield. Draw a card.
43373.name: Potion of Heroism

41407.text: Summon copies of your damaged minions.
41407.name: Sudden Genesis
41407.flavor: Being hurt can make you another person.

43382.collectionText: Summon a 2/2 Spirit with Taunt. (Restore 3 Health to upgrade.)
43382.name: Lesser Pearl Spellstone
43382.text: Summon a 2/2 Spirit with Taunt. @(Restore 3 Health to upgrade.)
43382.flavor:
In ages old, when Ancients broke
Azari of the Legion spoke
To tempt the mortals: gems of power
 The weak succumbed, their souls devoured.

43384.name: Call to Arms
43384.flavor: More personal than a text to arms.

43392.name: Valeera the Hollow
43392.flavor: "Run away. Hide in your precious keeps, behind your walls and your bodyguards. Night always falls, and shadows will fill your hallowed halls. One day, one of those shadows will be me."

43398.name: Deathstalker Rexxar
43398.text: [x]Battlecry: Deal 2 damage to all enemy minions.
43398.flavor: "You were too slow, old friend. The hunt began long ago. And now... it will never end."

43406.name: Uther of the Ebon Blade
43406.flavor: "Step forward. Confess! Once I was a mere servant of the Light. Now I alone stand in judgement."

43407.text: Secret: After your opponent plays a minion, deal $6 damage to it and any excess to their hero.
43407.name: Explosive Runes
43407.flavor: Sometimes it's safer NOT to read the warning signs.

43408.name: Shadowreaper Anduin
43408.text: Battlecry: Destroy all minions with 5 or more Attack.
43408.flavor: "I will tell you what Velen never taught me. Whosoever stands before the Light… inevitably casts a shadow."

39313.howToEarn: Unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.
39313.name: Violet Illusionist
39313.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.
39313.text: During your turn, your hero is Immune.
39313.flavor: She’s much more cheerful after losing the ‘n’ in her name.

43414.collectionText: Add 1 random Mage spell to your hand. (Play 2 Elementals to upgrade.)
43414.text: Add 1 random Mage spell to your hand. @(Play 2 Elementals to upgrade.)
43414.name: Lesser Ruby Spellstone
43414.flavor:
The final stone undid its master
Spun into wards by nameless caster
Azari wailed a savage roar
Now sealed in nether, evermore.

43415.name: Bloodreaver Gul'dan
43415.text: Battlecry: Summon all friendly Demons that died this game.
43415.flavor: "Still you refuse to bend your knee? None can escape death, you old fool. And in death… all will serve me…"

43417.name: Malfurion the Pestilent
43417.text: [x]Choose One - Summon 2 Poisonous Spiders; or 2 Scarabs with Taunt.
43417.flavor: "Cenarius once taught me about the precarious balance between life and death. I have come to understand: there IS no balance. Death always wins."

43419.name: Frost Lich Jaina
43419.text: [x]Battlecry: Summon a 3/6 Water Elemental. Your Elementals have Lifesteal this game.
43419.flavor: "Arthas was a spoiled child, playing with toys he could neither control nor understand. Come into the cold. I will show you the true power of the Frozen Throne."

43420.text: Each turn this is in your hand, transform it into a random Mage spell.
43420.name: Shifting Scroll
43420.flavor: Next turn, this is going to be AMAZING.

43423.name: Scourgelord Garrosh
43423.text: Battlecry: Equip a 4/3 Shadowmourne that also damages adjacent minions.
43423.flavor: "You dare to challenge me? Come! Draw your last breath - and then, you are mine."

43424.text: Shuffle 5 Scrolls into your deck. When drawn, cast a random spell.
43424.name: Deck of Wonders
43424.flavor: "Pick a card, any card. Wait! No! Not that one!" - Last words of previous owner

43426.name: Aluneth
43426.text: At the end of your turn, draw 3 cards.
43426.flavor: PHENOMENAL ARCANE POWER…itty bitty living space.

43439.name: Hadronox
43439.text: Deathrattle: Summon your Taunt minions that died this game.
43439.flavor: The viziers of Azjol-Nerub released Hadronox as a last-ditch effort to hold back the Lich King. They did so by VERY carefully scooping him up in a LARGE newspaper and releasing him.

2484.text: Each time you cast a spell this turn, add a random Hunter card to your hand.
2484.name: Lock and Load
2484.flavor:
Rexxar narrowed his eyes, grabbed his machine gun, and said: "It's go time.  Lock and load."
This card pays homage to that special moment.

39350.howToEarn: Unlocked in the Prologue, in One Night in Karazhan.
39350.name: Enchanted Raven
39350.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in the Prologue, in One Night in Karazhan.
39350.flavor: Once upon a midnight restive, Medivh pondered, feeling festive!

2488.name: Maiden of the Lake
2488.flavor: Not a good basis for a system of government.

2491.name: Mogor's Champion
2491.text: 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
2491.flavor: This champion has learned from the best.  Except for his target selection.

43453.name: Scorp-o-matic
43453.text: Battlecry: Destroy a minion with 1 or less Attack.
43453.flavor: Back in my day, we had to manually scorp.

2495.name: Boneguard Lieutenant
2495.flavor: Underneath all that impressive armor, he's just skin and bones.  Okay, maybe just bones.

2497.name: Mukla's Champion
2497.flavor: An elegant gorilla, for a more civilized age.

2499.name: Tournament Attendee
2499.flavor: He was so excited to get season tickets to this year's Grand Tournament.  He normally doesn't get them at first and has to buy them from Ogre scalpers.

2500.name: Clockwork Knight
2500.flavor: It takes a lot to wind him up.

2502.name: Injured Kvaldir
2502.flavor: Don't worry.  With a little skin cream he's going to clear right up.

2503.name: Silver Hand Regent
2503.flavor: The Silver Hand is the best paladin organization.  The Argent Crusaders are super jealous.

2504.name: Tuskarr Jouster
2504.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, restore 7 Health to your hero.
2504.flavor: Just could not be talked out of using his turtle for the joust...

2505.name: Argent Watchman
2505.text: Can't attack. Inspire: Can attack as normal this turn.
2505.flavor: Who argent watches the Argent Watchman?

2507.name: Master Jouster
2507.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, gain Taunt and Divine Shield.
2507.flavor: Needs just a few more ratings points to become Grandmaster Jouster.

43469.name: Corrosive Sludge
43469.flavor: The result of centuries of terrible sanitation.

2510.name: Grand Crusader
2510.text: Battlecry: Add a random Paladin card to your hand.
2510.flavor: A veteran of a number of crusades, she is a force for light and goodness.  Her latest crusade is against goblin telemarketers.

2511.name: Kvaldir Raider
2511.flavor: Coming soon... to a tuskarr village near you!

2512.name: Frost Giant
2512.text: Costs (1) less for each time you used your Hero Power this game.
2512.flavor: Don't ask him about the beard.  JUST DON'T.

2513.name: Tuskarr Totemic
2513.flavor: Turns out the tuskarr aren't real choosy about their totems.

43474.name: Stoneskin Basilisk
43474.flavor: He got that way from looking into a mirror.

2515.name: Warhorse Trainer
2515.text: Your Silver Hand Recruits have +1 Attack.
2515.flavor: He doesn't even get Sundays off.  Every day he's hostling.

39380.howToEarn: Unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.
39380.name: Silverware Golem
39380.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.
39380.text: If you discard this minion, summon it.
39380.flavor: From the secret research labs of the Swiss Army.

2517.name: Garrison Commander
2517.text: You can use your Hero Power twice a turn.
2517.flavor: He'll never admit it, but he pushes you hard because he really cares about you.

2518.name: Crowd Favorite
2518.text: Whenever you play a card with Battlecry, gain +1/+1.

2519.name: Eydis Darkbane
2519.text: Whenever you target this minion with a spell, deal 3 damage to a random enemy.

2520.name: North Sea Kraken
2520.flavor: You have no idea how tired this guy is of being released.

2521.name: Pit Fighter
2521.flavor: What did the pits ever do to you?

2522.name: Captured Jormungar
2522.flavor: You can keep him, but you have to promise to feed him and clean out his tank every day!

43483.name: Arcane Tyrant
43483.text: Costs (0) if you've cast a spell that costs (5) or more this turn.
43483.flavor: Tyrant is such a strong word.

43485.name: Green Jelly
43485.text: At the end of your turn, summon a 1/2 Ooze with Taunt.
43485.flavor: This card really breaks out of the mold.

43486.name: Dragonslayer
43486.flavor: A pair of stout dwarves nearly averted the Cataclysm.

43489.name: Toothy Chest
43489.text: At the start of your turn, set this minion's Attack to 4.
43489.flavor: Do you want to eat an adventurer?  I want to eat an adventurer!

2532.name: Frigid Snobold
2532.flavor: Ironically, the natural enemy of the snobold is THE CANDLE.

2533.name: Dragonhawk Rider
2533.flavor: Check it out.  You can do barrel rolls on this thing.

43494.name: Sleepy Dragon
43494.flavor: Local villagers call her "Naps Under the Mountain."

2535.text: Give a Demon +3/+3. Give your opponent a Mana Crystal.
2535.name: Demonfuse
2535.flavor: Very dangerous when attached to a demonbomb.

2537.name: Void Crusher
2537.text: Inspire: Destroy a random minion for each player.

2539.name: Flame Lance
2539.flavor: It's on the rack next to ice lance, acid lance, and English muffin lance.

2541.text: Secret: When a friendly minion dies, summon a random minion with the same Cost.
2541.name: Effigy

2542.text: Transform a minion into a 4/2 Boar with Charge.
2542.name: Polymorph: Boar

2544.name: Coldarra Drake
2544.text: You can use your Hero Power any number of times.
2544.flavor: The Grand Tournament has a "No dragons allowed" policy, but it's rarely enforced.

2545.name: Fallen Hero
2545.text: Your Hero Power deals 1 extra damage.

2546.name: Rhonin
2546.text: Deathrattle: Add 3 copies of Arcane Missiles to your hand.

43507.name: Hoarding Dragon
43507.flavor: Keeps his two cents to himself.

2549.name: Dalaran Aspirant
2549.flavor: Is he aspiring or inspiring?  Make up your mind!

2551.name: Spawn of Shadows
2551.flavor: What did you expect to happen?  He's a Spawn.  Of Shadows.

2552.name: Ram Wrangler
2552.text: Battlecry: If you have a Beast, summon a random Beast.
2552.flavor: Not getting trampled is really the trick here.

39417.howToEarn: Unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.
39417.name: Fool's Bane
39417.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.
39417.text: Unlimited attacks each turn. Can't attack heroes.
39417.flavor: A fool and his bane are soon parted.

2555.name: Holy Champion
2555.text: Whenever a character is healed, gain +2 Attack.
2555.flavor: She really likes seeing people get better.  That's why she hurts them in the first place.

2556.name: Confessor Paletress
2556.flavor: She sees into your past and makes you face your fears.  Most common fear:  Getting Majordomo out of Sneed's Old Shredder.

43517.name: Furbolg Mossbinder
43517.text: Battlecry: Transform a friendly minion into a 6/6 Elemental.
43517.flavor: Behold, the unstoppable power of MOSS!

39426.howToEarn: Unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.
39426.name: Arcane Giant
39426.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.
39426.text:
[x]Costs (1) less for each spell
you've cast this game.
39426.flavor: Claims to be drawn to Karazhan because of the ley lines. Actually, just loves Moroes’ cooking.

2563.text: Put a copy of an enemy minion into your hand.
2563.name: Convert

2564.text: Swap the Attack and Health of all minions.
2564.name: Confuse

2566.name: Shadowfiend
2566.text: Whenever you draw a card, reduce its Cost by (1).
2566.flavor: Hopes to be promoted to "Shadowfriend" someday.

1790.howToEarn: Unlocked in The Military Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1790.name: Deathlord
1790.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in The Military Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1790.text: Taunt. Deathrattle: Your opponent puts a minion from their deck into the battlefield.

2568.text:
Choose a minion. Whenever it attacks, restore 4 Health to
your hero.
2568.name: Power Word: Glory
2568.flavor: The promise of glory is a powerful tool to get minions to do your bidding.  Only slightly less powerful than the promise of an ice cream bar!

2569.name: Twilight Guardian
2569.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1 Attack and Taunt.
2569.flavor: A result of magical experiments carried out by the Black Dragonflight, it's not his fault that he's a vicious killer.

2571.name: Spellslinger
2571.text: Battlecry: Add a random spell to each player's hand.
2571.flavor: Does he sling spells, or do his spells linger about.  Who can say?

2572.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion. This spell gets double bonus from Spell Damage.
2572.name: Arcane Blast

2575.name: Tournament Medic
2575.flavor: The medic tournament is less entertaining than the Grand Tournament.

2576.name: Saboteur
2576.text: Battlecry: Your opponent's Hero Power costs (5) more next turn.
2576.flavor: Listen all y'all it's a saboteur!

2577.name: Lance Carrier
2577.flavor: Lance Carrier is an obscure entry level position in orcish armies.  A mystery, since orcs don't generally use lances.

39442.howToEarn: Unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.
39442.name: Priest of the Feast
39442.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.
39442.text:
Whenever you cast a spell, restore 3 Health to
your hero.
39442.flavor: Now that's a world champion cheesecake!

2579.name: Silent Knight
2579.flavor: He used to be a librarian.  Old habits die hard.

2580.name: Flame Juggler
2580.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to a random enemy.
2580.flavor: At first he liked juggling chain saws, but then he thought, "Flames are better!  Because FIRE!"

2581.name: Fencing Coach
2581.text: Battlecry: The next time you use your Hero Power, it costs (2) less.
2581.flavor: Good fencers make good neighbors, right?

2585.name: Coliseum Manager
2585.text: Inspire: Return this minion to your hand.
2585.flavor: Meets monthly with the gladiators to discuss career goals.

2586.name: Anub'arak
2586.text: Deathrattle: Return this to your hand and summon a 4/4 Nerubian.
2586.flavor: Was actually a pretty nice guy before, you know, the whole Lich King thing.

2587.text: Shuffle 3 Ambushes into your opponent's deck. When drawn, you summon a 4/4 Nerubian.
2587.name: Beneath the Grounds
2587.flavor: Can you hold these eggs for just a second?  I promise they're not full of giant enraged undead spider things.

39453.howToEarn: Unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.
39453.name: Moroes
39453.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.
39453.text: Stealth At the end of your turn, summon a 1/1 Steward.
39453.flavor: Moroes runs an army of stewards, but still ends up inflating the balloons himself.

1797.howToEarn: Unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1797.name: Feugen
1797.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1797.text: Deathrattle: If Stalagg also died this game, summon Thaddius.
1797.flavor: Feugen is sad because everyone likes Stalagg better.

2594.name: Ice Rager
2594.flavor: He's a lot cooler than Magma Rager.

2595.name: Bolf Ramshield
2595.text: Whenever your hero takes damage, this minion takes it instead.
2595.flavor: Bolf keeps coming in 2nd at the Grand Tournament.  It might be his year this year, if Lebron doesn't enter.

2596.name: Wyrmrest Agent
2596.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1 Attack and Taunt.
2596.flavor: Keeping tabs on the Grand Tournament is priority #1 for the five mighty Dragonflights!

2598.name: Kodorider
2598.flavor: Someone called her a Rhinorider, and she's NOT HAPPY.

39465.howToEarn: Unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.
39465.name: Moat Lurker
39465.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.
39465.flavor: He really enjoys lurking and gets a lot of job satisfaction out of it.

1799.howToEarn: Unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1799.name: Wailing Soul
1799.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1799.flavor: This soul just wails on you. Dang, soul, let up already.

39468.howToEarn: Unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.
39468.name: Purify
39468.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.
39468.text: Silence a friendly minion. Draw a card.
39468.flavor: Even better than a hot shower with vigorous scrubbing!

1800.howToEarn: Unlocked in The Arachnid Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1800.name: Nerub'ar Weblord
1800.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in The Arachnid Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1800.flavor: Weblords spend all day making giant trampoline parks.

2610.name: Totem Golem
2610.flavor: What happens when you glue a buncha totems together.

2612.text: Restore #7 Health. Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, Restore #14 instead.
2612.name: Healing Wave
2612.flavor: Favored by shaman who study the art of restoration and healing, this spell would feel smug, if it had feelings.

2613.name: Draenei Totemcarver
2613.flavor: It's nice to find a real craftsman in this day and age of mass-produced totems.

2615.name: Thunder Bluff Valiant
2615.flavor: Allowing totems to attack is not cheating.  I mean, there isn't anything in the rule books about it.

2617.name: Charged Hammer
2617.flavor: You can only pick it up if you are worthy.

2618.name: The Mistcaller
2618.text: Battlecry: Give all minions in your hand and deck +1/+1.
2618.flavor: Calling the mist doesn't sound all that great.  "Ooooh, it is slightly damp now!"

2620.name: Elemental Destruction
2620.flavor: I'm not a shaman or anything, but isn't Elemental Destruction the opposite of what they want to do?

2621.name: Wilfred Fizzlebang
2621.text: Cards you draw from your Hero Power cost (0).
2621.flavor:
He can summon anything, even a FEARSOME DOOMGUARD*.
*He's pretty sure this is going to work out.

2623.name: Wrathguard
2623.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, also deal that amount to your hero.
2623.flavor: After playing against 5 Annoy-O-Trons, any normal guard will become a Wrathguard.

2624.name: Fearsome Doomguard
2624.flavor: They were originally called Cuddleguards, but they were not inspiring the proper amount of fear.

39489.howToEarn: Unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.
39489.name: Avian Watcher
39489.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.
39489.text: Battlecry: If you control a Secret, gain +1/+1 and Taunt.
39489.flavor: He mostly watches light romantic comedies.

39491.howToEarn: Unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.
39491.name: Arcanosmith
39491.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.
39491.flavor: He’s really just a Blacksmith, but he thought the fancy title would bring in more business.

2628.text: When you play or discard this, deal $4 damage to a random enemy.
2628.name: Fist of Jaraxxus

39495.howToEarn: Unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.
39495.name: Protect the King!
39495.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.
39495.text: For each enemy minion, summon a 1/1 Pawn with Taunt.
39495.flavor: Form ranks! Everyone into the King's Tuskarr Defense!

2632.text: Destroy 2 random enemy minions. Discard 2 random cards.
2632.name: Dark Bargain
2632.flavor: A prime example of lose-lose negotiating.

2633.name: Acidmaw
2633.text: Whenever another minion takes damage, destroy it.
2633.flavor: With the help of his trusty sidekick Dreadscale, the giant jormungar Acidmaw is ready to face any knight!

2634.name: Dreadscale
2634.text: At the end of your turn, deal 1 damage to all other minions.
2634.flavor: Let's be clear about this:  ACIDMAW is the sidekick.

2635.name: King's Elekk
2635.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, draw it.

2638.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion and the minions next to it.
2638.name: Powershot

38669.name: Validated Doomsayer
38669.text: At the start of your turn, set this minion's Attack to 7.
38669.flavor: Really feels good about himself and is in a much better place now. But… he sure does miss piloting those shredders.

2641.text: Secret: After your hero is attacked, summon a 3/3 Bear with Taunt.
2641.name: Bear Trap
2641.flavor: You'll never guess what's in that conveniently bear-sized, bear-smelling box.

2642.name: Brave Archer
2642.text: Inspire: If your hand is empty, deal 2 damage to the enemy hero.

1806.howToEarn: Unlocked in The Military Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1806.name: Voidcaller
1806.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in The Military Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1806.text: Deathrattle: Put a random Demon from your hand into the battlefield.

1861.howToEarn: Unlocked in The Plague Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1861.name: Stoneskin Gargoyle
1861.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in The Plague Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
1861.text: At the start of your turn, restore this minion to full Health.

2648.text: Secret: When your turn starts, give your minions +1/+1.
2648.name: Competitive Spirit
2648.flavor: Competition can be an inspiration to improve oneself.  Or kill all the competitors.

2654.text: Destroy all minions except each player's highest Attack minion.
2654.name: Enter the Coliseum
2654.flavor: You have to get past the vendors first.  So many are lost to shopping...

2655.name: Murloc Knight
2655.flavor: Hee hee!  Look at his cute little feet.

41415.name: Sabretooth Stalker
41415.flavor: It's gotten a bit long in the tooth.

2493.name: Master of Ceremonies
2493.text: Battlecry: If you have a minion with Spell Damage, gain +2/+2.

2681.name: The Skeleton Knight
2681.text: Deathrattle: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, return this to your hand.
2681.flavor: Apparently it really was just a flesh wound.

2682.name: Chillmaw
2682.text: [x]Taunt Deathrattle: If you're holding a Dragon, deal 3 damage to all minions.
2682.flavor: Chillmaw keeps trying to ruin the Grand Tournament, and she would've done it too, if it weren't for those dang kids!

2683.name: Nexus-Champion Saraad
2683.text: Inspire: Add a random spell to your hand.
2683.flavor: The ethereals have their own jousting tournament, and Saraad is the reigning champion.  Also he won the ethereal hot dog eating contest.

39554.howToEarn: Unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.
39554.name: Netherspite Historian
39554.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.
39554.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, Discover a Dragon.
39554.flavor: She can tell you all about the history of people not STANDING IN THE GREEN BEAM!

2704.name: Refreshment Vendor
2704.flavor: Menu:  Funnel cakes, carrots, popcorn, jormungar steaks.  It's hard serving a diverse clientele.

2711.name: Orgrimmar Aspirant
2711.flavor: "Four out of three orcs struggle with math." - Angry Zurge

2715.name: Buccaneer
2715.text: Whenever you equip a weapon, give it +1 Attack.
2715.flavor: The best part of buccaneering is the pants.

2717.text: Give a minion +3 Attack and Divine Shield.
2717.name: Seal of Champions

2720.name: Argent Lance
2720.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, +1 Durability.
2720.flavor: The stripes make it look like a candy cane, but we recommend against licking it.

2723.name: Sea Reaver
2723.text: When you draw this, deal 1 damage to your minions.
2723.flavor: A little better than Sea Minus Reaver.

2724.name: Gormok the Impaler
2724.text: Battlecry: If you have at least 4 other minions, deal 4 damage.
2724.flavor: Gormok has been giving impaling lessons in a small tent near the tournament grounds.  For only 25g you too could learn the fine art of impaling!

2725.name: Icehowl
2725.flavor: This massive yeti just closes his eyes and charges at the nearest target.  The nearest Target is a couple blocks away and has sick deals on skateboards.

2726.name: Mysterious Challenger
2726.text: Battlecry: Put one of each Secret from your deck into the battlefield.
2726.flavor: He may sound surly and antisocial, but he's actually just really shy.

2727.name: Eadric the Pure
2727.text: Battlecry: Change all enemy minions' Attack to 1.
2727.flavor: Nobody rocks a monocle like Eadric.

2729.name: Bash
2729.flavor: You might think bashing doesn't take a lot of practice.  It doesn't.

43463.name: Wax Elemental
43463.flavor: Takes double damage from wick-based weapons.

2736.name: Justicar Trueheart
2736.text: Battlecry: Replace your starting Hero Power with a better one.
2736.flavor: It's like putting racing stripes and a giant spoiler on your hero power.

43465.name: Ebon Dragonsmith
43465.text: Battlecry: Reduce the Cost of a random weapon in your hand by (2).
43465.flavor: Having a furnace-mouth is really handy for a blacksmith.

2748.name: Fjola Lightbane
2748.text: Whenever you target this minion with a spell, gain Divine Shield.

2752.name: Evil Heckler
2752.flavor: To be honest, heckling is not the most effective form of evil.

2753.name: Magnataur Alpha
2753.text:
Also damages the minions next to whomever
he attacks.
2753.flavor: Playing him also gets you into the Magnataur Beta.

2754.name: Bolster
2754.flavor: The best offense is a good defense.

2756.name: King's Defender
2756.text: Battlecry: If you have a minion with Taunt, gain +1 Durability.
2756.flavor: "King's Attacker" is a shield.  Funny, huh?

2757.name: Skycap'n Kragg
2757.text: Charrrrrge Costs (1) less for each friendly Pirate.
2757.flavor: What's more boss than riding a parrot with a jawbone for a shoulderpad while wielding a giant hook-lance-thing and wearing a pirate hat?  NOTHING.

2758.name: Alexstrasza's Champion
2758.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1 Attack and Charge.
2758.flavor: "Put more spikes on her.  No, more spikes.  What part of 'more spikes' do you not understand?  MORE SPIKES!" - Alexstrasza

2760.name: Varian Wrynn
2760.text: Battlecry: Draw 3 cards. Put any minions you drew directly into the battlefield.
2760.flavor: Leader of the Alliance!  Father of Anduin!  Also he likes to play Arena, and he averages 12 wins.

2763.name: Poisoned Blade
2763.text: Your Hero Power gives this weapon +1 Attack instead of replacing it.
2763.flavor: How much more poisoned can a blade get?  The answer is a lot.  A lot more poisoned.

2765.name: Shado-Pan Rider
2765.flavor: He needed a break after that business in the Vale of Eternal Blossoms. Naturally, he chose to spend his vacation in an icy snowscape killing monsters.

2766.name: Cutpurse
2766.text: Whenever this minion attacks a hero, add the Coin to your hand.
2766.flavor: He has a giant collection of purses now.  One for every outfit!

2767.name: Undercity Valiant
2767.flavor: Almost went to play for Stormwind before signing with Undercity.

2768.name: Shady Dealer
2768.text: Battlecry: If you have a Pirate, gain +1/+1.
2768.flavor: I have great deal for you... for 4 damage to your face!

2770.text: Add 2 random class cards to your hand (from your opponent's class).
2770.name: Burgle

39374.howToEarn: Unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.
39374.name: Onyx Bishop
39374.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.
39374.text: Battlecry: Summon a friendly minion that died this game.
39374.flavor: B4 is a nice place to visit, but he wouldn't want to live there.

2777.name: Tiny Knight of Evil
2777.text: Whenever you discard a card, gain +1/+1.
2777.flavor: "No, no, no. I asked for a tiny JESTER of evil."

2780.name: Savage Combatant
2780.text: Inspire: Give your hero +2 Attack this turn.
2780.flavor: Maybe if you whistle a tune it will soothe him.  Yeah...  Try that.

2782.name: Darnassus Aspirant
2782.text: Battlecry: Gain an empty Mana Crystal. Deathrattle: Lose a Mana Crystal.
2782.flavor: She loves mana crystals, she hates mana crystals.   So fickle!

2783.name: Druid of the Saber
2783.flavor: That's saberTEETH, not like curved pirate blades.  That's a different kind of druid.  Druid of the Curved Pirate Blades.

2785.text: Gain 10 Mana Crystals. Discard your hand.
2785.name: Astral Communion
2785.flavor: Hey!  Moon!  Can I have some mana crystals?

2786.name: Wildwalker
2786.flavor: She was born to be something.  She is just not quite sure what yet...

1147.name: Nat Pagle
1147.text: At the start of your turn, you have a 50% chance to draw an extra card.
1147.flavor: Nat Pagle, Azeroth's premier fisherman!  He invented the Auto-Angler 3000, the Extendo-Pole 3000, and the Lure-o-matic 2099 (still in testing).

2788.name: Knight of the Wild
2788.text: Whenever you summon a Beast, reduce the Cost of this card by (1).
2788.flavor: He gets a discount on the tournament entry fee because he is his own horse.

43473.name: Lone Champion
43473.text: Battlecry: If you control no other minions, gain Taunt and Divine Shield.
43473.flavor: He is a champion, with no friends. He'll keep on fighting, til the end!

2792.text: Choose One - Deal $2 damage; or Summon two 1/1 Saplings.
2792.name: Living Roots
2792.flavor: 2 out of 2 saplings recommend that you summon the saplings.

2793.text:
Destroy a minion.
Add a random minion to your opponent's hand.
2793.name: Mulch
2793.flavor: Is this a noun or a verb?  We will never know.

2796.name: Aviana
2796.flavor: Call her "Tweety".  She'll find it real funny.  I PROMISE.

41427.name: Fire Plume's Heart
41427.flavor: Why does an active volcano need to be defended? To save its ash.

2818.name: Gadgetzan Jouster
2818.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, gain +1/+1.
2818.flavor: It's not HER fault you didn't put a spinning saw blade on your horse.

2822.name: Dreadsteed
2822.text: Deathrattle: At the end of the turn, summon a Dreadsteed.
2822.flavor: Crescendo himself summoned this steed, riding it to victory in the Grand Tournament.  Wherever he rides, an army of riders ride behind him, supporting the legendary champion.

41305.flavor: Roc eggs are great in omelettes, sandwiches, and as bait to turn poachers into bird food.

41881.name: Tar Lord
41881.text: Taunt Has +4 Attack during your opponent’s turn.
41881.flavor: Tar Lord, man... legendary monster? Aw, forget it.

40323.name: Raza the Chained
40323.text: [x] Battlecry: If your deck has no duplicates, your Hero Power costs (1) this game.
40323.flavor: "Could you do me a favor and get the keys from Kazakus?"

40324.name: Freezing Potion
40324.flavor: This is delicious! Oh no. BRAIN FREEEEEEEZE!

2096.name: Anodized Robo Cub
2096.flavor: It's adorable! AND OH MY GOODNESS WHY IS IT EATING MY FACE

46079.name: Kobold Monk
46079.text: Your hero can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.

40337.name: Wind-up Burglebot
40337.text: Whenever this attacks a minion and survives, draw a card.
40337.flavor: Don't blame the bot for his crimes...  Blame whoever keeps winding him up!

2627.name: Armored Warhorse
2627.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, gain Charge.
2627.flavor: Yep.  It's a horse... wearing armor... going to war.

40344.name: Hozen Healer
40344.text: Battlecry: Restore a minion to full Health.
40344.flavor: He didn't go to school for healing, but we keep losing all the good healers to Ratchet, so I guess we'll take him.

39492.howToEarn: Unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.
39492.name: Cloaked Huntress
39492.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.
39492.flavor: She's practically GIVING your secrets away!

40364.name: Public Defender
40364.flavor: Happy to defend any public offender!

40371.text: Give all minions in your hand +1/+1.
40371.name: Smuggler's Run
40371.flavor: One of the most famous busts in Gadgetzan’s history happened on Smuggler’s Run, where Sergeant Sally apprehended a cadre of Grimy Goons transporting a massive number of illegal fish heads.

40372.collectionText: Choose One - Summon a Jade Golem; or Shuffle 3 copies of this card into your deck.
40372.name: Jade Idol
40372.text: Choose One - Summon a{1} {0} Jade Golem; or Shuffle 3 copies of this card into your deck.

40373.text: Gain control of an enemy minion with 2 or less Attack until end of turn.
40373.name: Potion of Madness
40373.flavor: You'd be insane NOT to drink it!

40375.text: Restore #12 Health to a friendly character.
40375.name: Greater Healing Potion

40378.name: Drakonid Operative
40378.text: [x]Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, Discover a card in  your opponent's deck.
40378.flavor: His job is to spy on the Goons and the Jade Lotus, but he's OBVIOUSLY a dragon so it's pretty hard work.

40381.name: Mana Geode
40381.text: Whenever this minion is healed, summon a 2/2 Crystal.
40381.flavor: Gadgetzan, where even the pet rocks have pet rocks.

40389.name: Fel Orc Soulfiend
40389.text: At the start of your turn, deal 2 damage to this minion.
40389.flavor: "Doc says the persistent burning sensation in my soul is probably just an ulcer."

40391.name: Crystalweaver
40391.flavor: The trick is soaking the crystals in warm milk to soften them up.

40393.text:
[x]Give a minion +3 Attack.
If it's a Demon, also
give it +3 Health.
40393.name: Bloodfury Potion
40393.flavor: You know what really makes my blood boil? The skyrocketing price of Bloodfury potions!

40397.name: Mark of the Lotus
40397.flavor: The mark of the Lotus is a little flower drawn in permanent marker on the ankle.

40401.text: Gain an empty Mana Crystal for each friendly minion.
40401.name: Pilfered Power
40401.flavor: The Hozen don't get paid much, but at least they get to keep any excess mana.

40404.name: Celestial Dreamer
40404.text: [x]Battlecry: If you control a minion with 5 or more Attack, gain +2/+2.
40404.flavor: If you think her job is easy, YOU try falling asleep on cue.

40407.flavor: Sure you could have that Polymorph potion, but wouldn't you rather have this mystery potion?  It could be anything.  Even a Polymorph potion!
40407.name: Kabal Chemist
40407.text: Battlecry: Add a random Potion to your hand.

40408.flavor: The mysterious leader of the Kabal is NOT a dragon, and does NOT deal in illegal potions.  Any public statements to the contrary will be met with litigation and Dragonfire Potions.
40408.name: Kazakus
40408.text: [x]Battlecry: If your deck has no duplicates,  create a custom spell.

40409.text: Secret: After your opponent plays a minion, transform it into a 1/1 Sheep.
40409.name: Potion of Polymorph

2639.name: Stablemaster
2639.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly Beast Immune this turn.
2639.flavor: Takes way better care of her pets than her brother, Unstablemaster.

40416.name: Kun the Forgotten King
40416.text: Choose One - Gain 10 Armor; or Refresh your Mana Crystals.
40416.flavor: Aya siphons a bit of Kun's soul to animate each golem in her Jade army. To his credit, he's being a great sport about it.

46082.name: Hungry Ettin
46082.text: Taunt Battlecry: Summon a random 2-Cost minion for your opponent.
46082.flavor: How can he be hungry… if he's Ettin!?

40419.name: Call in the Finishers
40419.flavor: When you really need a job done… but you don't really care if it gets done right.

40422.name: Jade Chieftain
40422.flavor: Seeing his Jade Golem grow up into the tall, handsome 6/6 standing before him was the proudest moment of his life.

40426.name: Alleycat
40426.flavor: To be a cool cat in Gadgetzan, you gotta have bling.

40428.name: Rat Pack
40428.text: [x]Deathrattle: Summon a number of 1/1 Rats equal  to this minion's Attack.
40428.flavor: He's gonna do it his way.

40432.name: Kabal Talonpriest
40432.flavor: Inkmaster Solia had to figure out how to tattoo feathers.

40437.text: Gain 1 Mana Crystal this turn only.
40437.name: Counterfeit Coin
40437.flavor: There is something funny about this coin… can't quite put my finger on it…

40438.name: Brass Knuckles
40438.text:
[x]After your hero attacks,
give a random minion in
your hand +1/+1.
40438.flavor: For the goon that wants to make a fashion statement.

40441.name: Lotus Assassin
40441.text: Stealth. Whenever this attacks and kills a minion, gain Stealth.
40441.flavor: For 5000g, you can just give the Jade Lotus any name and they will assassinate and/or embarrass them.

38718.name: Mire Keeper
38718.text: [x]Choose One - Summon a 2/2 Slime; or Gain an empty Mana Crystal.
38718.flavor:
"Hey.... Is that Mire for sale?" 
"No.  I'm keeping it."

45265.name: Fungalmancer
45265.flavor: Fungalmancy is the easy major for those who can't cut it at Waxmancy.

40465.name: Patches the Pirate
40465.text:
[x]After you play a Pirate,
summon this minion
from your deck.
40465.flavor: What do sailors yell when Patches steals their treasure chest full of laws and other things being transported to parliament for a vote?  "The Eyes have it!"

42714.name: Vryghoul
42714.text: [x]Deathrattle: If it's your opponent's turn, summon a 2/2 Ghoul.
42714.flavor: It's pronounced VERY GHOUL. Don't let anyone tell you different.

40469.name: Grimestreet Enforcer
40469.text: At the end of your turn, give all minions in your hand +1/+1.
40469.flavor: "Sir, you don't have a permit to park your mount here."

40474.name: Grimestreet Informant
40474.text: [x]Battlecry: Discover a Hunter, Paladin, or Warrior card.
40474.flavor: "Naw, naw.  You're talkin' about Grime BOULEVARD.  I ain't know nuthin' 'bout that."

40482.name: Hobart Grapplehammer
40482.text: Battlecry: Give all weapons in your hand and deck +1 Attack.
40482.flavor: Grapplehammer is the horrible mind behind the Automatic Piranha Launcher (banned in 7 districts)!

40486.name: White Eyes
40486.text: Taunt Deathrattle: Shuffle 'The Storm Guardian' into your deck.

43493.name: Sneaky Devil
43493.flavor: The result of a tragic accident involving a Defias Thug, a Wand of Polymorph, and a bundle of Fel Lotus.

40492.name: Backstreet Leper
40492.text: [x]Deathrattle: Deal 2 damage to the enemy hero.
40492.flavor: Quit playing games with his heart. And his fingers. And foot. It's rude.

40493.name: Blowgill Sniper
40493.flavor: Imagine how much further his darts would go if he had lungs instead of gills!

40494.name: Big-Time Racketeer
40494.flavor: "It'd be a shame if someone disenchanted those Legendaries."

40496.name: Kabal Courier
40496.text: Battlecry: Discover a Mage, Priest, or Warlock card.
40496.flavor: Hey, you park your kodo under a harpy nest, you get what you deserve.

606.name: Timber Wolf
606.flavor: Other beasts totally dig hanging out with timber wolves.

40517.name: Felfire Potion
40517.flavor: Kazakus has a squad of imps bottling Felfire round-the-clock and he *still* can't keep up with demand.

40523.collectionText: Summon a Jade Golem. Gain an empty Mana Crystal.
40523.name: Jade Blossom
40523.text: Summon a{1} {0} Jade Golem. Gain an empty Mana Crystal.
40523.flavor: Meditating under a jade blossom is said to grant you wisdom, unless you have a pollen allergy.

40527.name: Jade Spirit
40527.flavor: "He's so cute!  I just want to squeeze him, then use him for Jade Golem parts!" - Aya Blackpaw

40531.name: Grimscale Chum
40531.text: [x]Battlecry: Give a random Murloc in your hand +1/+1.
40531.flavor: Listen, see?  We'll take 'em to the docks, see?  And throw 'em in the sea, see?

40537.name: Krul the Unshackled
40537.text: [x]Battlecry: If your deck has no duplicates, summon all  Demons from your hand.
40537.flavor: Spicklefizz pondered his life choices as he looked at the chain around his neck. "Become a warlock," they said. "You get to enslave demons," they said.

40541.name: Abyssal Enforcer
40541.text: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage to all other characters.
40541.flavor: The Kabal print this on every package of illicit Mana Crystals: WARNING - DO NOT PUT WITHIN REACH OF ABYSSALS. THIS IS NOT APPROVED FOR USE BY FLAMING DEMONS OF ANY KIND.

47035.name: Kingsbane
47035.text: [x]Deathrattle: Shuffle this into your deck. It keeps any enchantments.
47035.flavor: But it has a soft spot for emperors.

40549.name: Weasel Tunneler
40549.text: Deathrattle: Shuffle this minion into your opponent's deck.
40549.flavor: He's the reason the First Bank of Gadgetzan has steel floors.

40566.text: Give a random Taunt minion in your hand +3/+3.
40566.name: Stolen Goods
40566.flavor: It fell off a kodo, I promise!

40567.name: Grimestreet Outfitter
40567.text: Battlecry: Give all minions in your hand +1/+1.
40567.flavor: If you bargain hard, he'll throw in the hat.

40568.name: Grimy Gadgeteer
40568.text: At the end of your turn, give a random minion in your hand +2/+2.
40568.flavor: "You look like a Gadgetgun 3000-Mark IV man, am I right?"

40569.name: Grimestreet Pawnbroker
40569.text: Battlecry: Give a random weapon in your hand +1/+1.
40569.flavor: "I don't know a lot about used GvG cards, so I'm going to have to call in an expert."

40574.name: Alley Armorsmith
40574.text: [x]Taunt Whenever this minion deals damage, gain that much Armor.
40574.flavor: The rent is cheap and she passes the savings onto YOU!

40577.name: Meanstreet Marshal
40577.text: Deathrattle: If this minion has 2 or more Attack, draw a card.
40577.flavor: Remember, submit your bribes directly to the Marshal - it's the law!

45269.name: Raven Familiar
45269.text: Battlecry: Reveal a spell in each deck. If yours costs more, draw it.
45269.flavor: Quoth the raven, 'Does yours cost more?'

40583.name: Kabal Crystal Runner
40583.text: Costs (2) less for each Secret you've played this game.
40583.flavor: "Listen, I can cut you in on a little of this premium mana, but you can't tell my boss."

40587.text: Secret: When a friendly minion dies, return it to your hand.
40587.name: Getaway Kodo

40596.name: Aya Blackpaw
40596.flavor: Though young, Aya took over as the leader of Jade Lotus through her charisma and strategic acumen when her predecessor was accidentally crushed by a jade golem.

40598.name: Unlicensed Apothecary
40598.text: After you summon a minion, deal 5 damage to your hero.
40598.flavor: Get the ingredients wrong on ONE healing potion and they take your license. What a world!

1988.name: Goblin Auto-Barber
1988.flavor: This guy is excellent at adjusting your haircut and/or height.

40603.name: Wrathion
40603.text: Taunt. Battlecry: Draw cards until you draw one that isn't a Dragon.
40603.flavor: Wrathion, son of Deathwing, is a dragon.  Why isn't he tagged as a dragon, you ask?  WHAT, ARE YOU TRYING TO BLOW HIS COVER??

40605.name: Auctionmaster Beardo
40605.text: After you cast a spell, refresh your Hero Power.
40605.flavor: Gadgetzan has always run an under-the-table auction house, and business has been PRETTY good for Beardo since the population explosion.  And since the explosion that destroyed the competing auction houses in the city.

40607.name: Genzo, the Shark
40607.text: Whenever this attacks, both players draw until they have 3 cards.
40607.flavor: Infamous in the seedy underground card rooms of Gadgetzan, he got his nickname winning the coveted Shark Plushie in the city's first Hearthstone tournament.

40608.name: Small-Time Buccaneer
40608.text: Has +2 Attack while you have a weapon equipped.
40608.flavor: "Oh, I'm not serious about it.  I only pirate on the weekends."

40611.name: Tanaris Hogchopper
40611.text: [x]Battlecry: If your opponent's hand is empty, gain Charge.
40611.flavor: The Hogchoppers are well-known throughout Kalimdor for being a real, actual group.

40613.name: Leatherclad Hogleader
40613.text: Battlecry: If your opponent has 6 or more cards in hand, gain Charge.
40613.flavor: The Hogchoppers, the terrors of Tanaris, can always be found at one tavern or another in Gadgetzan, refueling for totally real and legit adventures that they go on.

40615.text: Draw 2 cards. Minions drawn cost (2) less.
40615.name: Lunar Visions
40615.flavor: The true mystery of lunar visions is how there is nothing to watch when there are so many channels.

40617.name: Fight Promoter
40617.text: [x]Battlecry: If you control a minion with 6 or more  Health, draw two cards.
40617.flavor: "Yeah, I can get you Knuckles.  No, no, he's been clean for *weeks*."

41242.name: Giant Mastodon
41242.flavor: Still salty about it not being the "Year of the Mastodon."

1993.name: Trade Prince Gallywix
1993.text: Whenever your opponent casts a spell, gain a copy of it and give them a Coin.
1993.flavor: Gallywix believes in supply and demand. He supplies the beatings and demands you pay up!

40634.name: Small-Time Recruits
40634.flavor: Now we know why they wear tiny watches.

40636.name: Wickerflame Burnbristle
40636.flavor: Wickerflame spent years as a recruit for the Goons, never making the big-time because he always fired his chest-cannon too slowly.  "Hey," he thought, "maybe if I keep my beard lit on fire, I can do this faster."  BOOM, promoted.

1995.text: Shuffle an enemy minion into your opponent's deck.
1995.name: Recycle
1995.flavor: Druidic recycling involves putting plastics in one bin and enemy minions in another bin.

1997.name: Fel Cannon
1997.text: At the end of your turn, deal 2 damage to a non-Mech minion.
1997.flavor: The box says, "New and improved, with 200% more fel!"

2036.name: Burly Rockjaw Trogg
2036.text: Whenever your opponent casts a spell, gain +2 Attack.
2036.flavor: He's burly because he does CrossFit.

40678.name: Knuckles
40678.text:
After this attacks a
minion, it also hits the enemy hero.
40678.flavor: When confronted with accusations of performance-enhancing bananas, Knuckles replied, "I get my fruit from trees I knock down with my bare hands like everyone else."

40679.text: Give a random Beast in your hand +2/+2.
40679.name: Smuggler's Crate
40679.flavor: Are you sure these are the crates that are supposed to go to the Gadgetzan petting zoo?

40681.name: Shaky Zipgunner
40681.text: [x]Deathrattle: Give a random minion in your hand +2/+2.
40681.flavor: The Grimy Goons can get you any weapon you want but if you want it to not explode you gotta pay extra.

40683.name: Piranha Launcher
40683.text:
[x]After your hero attacks,
summon a 1/1 Piranha.
40683.flavor: A great improvement over the guppy launcher.

40684.name: Trogg Beastrager
40684.text: Battlecry: Give a random Beast in your hand +1/+1.
40684.flavor: Still angry that the Gadgetzan Rager Club wouldn't accept him as a member.

40691.name: Seadevil Stinger
40691.text: [x]Battlecry: The next Murloc you play this turn costs  Health instead of Mana.
40691.flavor: Pretty harmless unless you're a Seadevil.

40693.name: Lotus Illusionist
40693.text:
[x]After this minion attacks
a hero, transform it into a
 random 6-Cost minion.
40693.flavor: If you think her Illidan and Sylvanas cosplay is great, wait till you see her Reno Jackson!

40694.text: Transform all enemy minions into random ones that cost (1) less.
40694.name: Devolve
40694.flavor: Ragnaros looked down. He looked like some kind of War Golem. "WHAT HAVE YOU DONE TO ME," he yelled. But all that came out was a deep grinding sound. He began to cry.

40695.name: Shadow Sensei
40695.flavor: He used to be Aya's tutor, but she fired him for bugging her too much.

40696.name: Gadgetzan Ferryman
40696.text: Combo: Return a friendly minion to your hand.
40696.flavor: Is it just me, or is there something fishy about that ferryman?

40697.name: Jade Swarmer
40697.flavor: He's so good at swarming, he can swarm all by himself!

40698.name: Jade Shuriken
40698.flavor: Good news is, after you remove it from your wound, you can use it to pay your medical bills!

40700.name: Spiked Hogrider
40700.text: Battlecry: If an enemy minion has Taunt, gain Charge.
40700.flavor: Did you know the Hogchoppers compete every year at the Mirage Raceway?  They do.  It's a real group.

40701.name: Inkmaster Solia
40701.text: [x]Battlecry: If your deck has no duplicates, the next spell you cast this turn costs (0).
40701.flavor: Solia marks the Kabal with intricate tattoos that grant immense power. Also it makes it harder for other gangs to recruit from their numbers. BACK OFF, GOONS.

40703.flavor: The brilliant mastermind of the Grimy Goons, Han sometimes thinks about ditching the idiot Cho, but that would just tear him apart.
40703.name: Don Han'Cho
40703.text: Battlecry: Give a random minion in your hand +5/+5.

45307.name: Necrotic Geist
45307.text: Whenever one of your other minions dies, summon a 2/2 Ghoul.
45307.flavor: An eye for an eye, and a ghoul for a ghoul.

2009.text: Choose One - Summon 5 Wisps; or Give a minion +5/+5 and Taunt.
2009.name: Dark Wispers
2009.flavor: Don't worry; we fired the person who named this card.

2011.name: Glaivezooka
2011.text: Battlecry: Give a random friendly minion +1 Attack.
2011.flavor: For the times when a regular bazooka just isn't enough.

40741.name: Daring Reporter
40741.text: Whenever your opponent draws a card, gain +1/+1.
40741.flavor: She's working on a story!  While skydiving!

40742.name: Lotus Agents
40742.text: Battlecry: Discover a Druid, Rogue, or Shaman card.
40742.flavor: Mostly, they stand around and look cool.

40743.name: Grimestreet Smuggler
40743.text: Battlecry: Give a random minion in your hand +1/+1.
40743.flavor: She's got anything you want.  Need the latest derpinger?  No problem!

40744.name: Ancient of Blossoms
40744.flavor: His new shampoo is really working!

40745.name: Defias Cleaner
40745.flavor: His house cleaning service is quite thorough.  Not a spot to be found... or any of your stuff!

2017.name: Gahz'rilla
2017.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, double its Attack.
2017.flavor: The Sen'jin High football team is The Gahz'rillas.

2018.text: Deal $1 damage to a random minion. Repeat until a minion dies.
2018.name: Bouncing Blade
2018.flavor: Only goblins would think this was a good idea. Even they are starting to have their doubts.

40791.name: Luckydo Buccaneer
40791.text: Battlecry: If your weapon has at least 3 Attack, gain +4/+4.
40791.flavor: You can't just leave a Luckydo somewhere.  You gotta keep 'em with you!  Especially in Gadgetzan!

40797.name: Jade Behemoth
40797.flavor: I think we should talk about the jade elephant in the room.

40803.name: Finja, the Flying Star
40803.text: [x]Stealth Whenever this attacks and kills a minion, summon 2  Murlocs from your deck.
40803.flavor: The last true master of Finjitsu.

2024.name: Iron Juggernaut
2024.text: Battlecry: Shuffle a Mine into your opponent's deck. When drawn, it explodes for 10 damage.
2024.flavor: The Iron Juggernaut guards Orgrimmar and has just earned the "Employee of the Month" award!

2027.name: Coghammer
2027.text: Battlecry: Give a random friendly minion Divine Shield and Taunt.
2027.flavor: So you ripped this out of a machine, carved some runes on it, stuck it on a handle, and now it's a weapon of great divine power? Seems legit.

40839.name: I Know a Guy
40839.flavor: Well… a guy who knows a guy.

2031.name: Bolvar Fordragon
2031.text: Whenever a friendly minion dies while this is in your hand, gain +1 Attack.
2031.flavor: Spoiler alert: Bolvar gets melted and then sits on an ice throne and everyone forgets about him.

43369.name: Rhok'delar
43369.text: Battlecry: If your deck has no minions, fill your hand with Hunter spells.

2032.name: Puddlestomper
2032.flavor: He pays homage to Morgl, the great murloc oracle! (Who doesn't??)

2033.name: Ogre Brute
2033.text: 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
2033.flavor: Ogres have really terrible short-term chocolate.

2034.name: Dunemaul Shaman
2034.text: Windfury, Overload: (1) 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
2034.flavor: He just closes his eyes and goes for it. Raarararrrarar!

40889.name: Naga Corsair
40889.flavor: Hook-tails are nice and all but she keeps getting stuck on things.

2038.name: Salty Dog
2038.flavor: He's recently recovered from being a "scurvy dog."

40905.name: Shaku, the Collector
40905.text: [x]Stealth. Whenever this attacks, add a random card to your hand (from your opponent's class).
40905.flavor: Aya even staged an intervention once, but Shaku still insists that he is not a hoarder.

40906.name: Second-Rate Bruiser
40906.text: [x]Taunt Costs (2) less if your opponent has at least three minions.
40906.flavor: He'll be a first-rate bruiser once he gets used to his contacts.

2039.name: Lost Tallstrider
2039.flavor: The message, "If found, please return to Mulgore," is tattooed on his rear.

40911.name: Hired Gun
40911.flavor: He loves his job and would do it for free!  (But don't tell his boss!)

40914.name: Friendly Bartender
40914.text: At the end of your turn, restore 1 Health to your hero.
40914.flavor: "What'll it be?  A Jade Brew?  A Grimy Goose?  A Kabal Manatini?"

40921.name: Toxic Sewer Ooze
40921.text: Battlecry: Remove 1 Durability from your opponent's weapon.
40921.flavor: When Sergeant Sally shows up unexpectedly, DO NOT FLUSH YOUR MANA CRYSTALS DOWN THE TOILET.

40928.name: Streetwise Investigator
40928.flavor: "Hmmmm…  Call it a hunch, but I'm starting to think that there may be some kind of criminal activity going on in Gadgetzan."

40929.name: Kabal Songstealer
40929.flavor: Gadgetzan Writer’s Award goes to the player who writes the most compelling fanfic about why this Arakkoa has a golden frog in his hand!

40931.name: Backroom Bouncer
40931.text: Whenever a friendly minion dies, gain +1 Attack.
40931.flavor: "WHY ARE YOU IN THE BACK ROOM?  WHO IS WATCHING THE FRONT?!"

40935.name: Manic Soulcaster
40935.text: Battlecry: Choose a friendly minion. Shuffle a copy into your deck.
40935.flavor: When casting a tournament, you really have to put your soul into it!

40936.text:
[x]Give all enemy minions
-3 Attack this turn only.
40936.name: Pint-Size Potion
40936.flavor: I hope you didn't disenchant your Shadow Word: Horror!

40938.text:
[x]Deal $5 damage to all
minions except Dragons.
40938.name: Dragonfire Potion
40938.flavor: No one was brave enough to fire the dragon in person… so they made the potion do it.

40940.name: Kabal Trafficker
40940.text:
[x]At the end of your turn,
add a random Demon
to your hand.
40940.flavor: She ships illicit mana crystals around the world in packages marked: FUNNEL CAKE.

2045.name: Anima Golem
2045.text: At the end of each turn, destroy this minion if it's your only one.
2045.flavor: The Dark Animus is evil and mysterious and huge and unable to write sentences that utilize proper grammar.

1363.name: Shadow Word: Death
1363.text: Destroy a minion with 5 or more Attack.
1363.flavor: If you miss, it leaves a lightning-bolt-shaped scar on your target.

40949.name: Gadgetzan Socialite
40949.flavor: Comment on her height, and she'll go from flapper to kneecapper in seconds flat.

40950.name: Worgen Greaser
40950.flavor: Hair products are 79% of his monthly budget.

40951.name: Grook Fu Master
